Yellow light haze. Wheaty malty apricots, yeasty fruityness, some stale malts. Dry feel, bittery. Mm.. Well made and wheaty ale. Cant find anything too special though.-- bb
Bottle. Pours clear yellow with nice bright white head. Some lacing. Nose is hoppy. Pine and orange. Smells great. Taste is up front bitterness. Tastes kind of like a pale ale. Great!
Love this beer. Pours opaque tan with minimal head. Floral and citrus notes in the aroma. Start and finishes strong with grapefruit after taste. Excellent hoppiness.
Draft - Sweet skunky grapefruit hops. Clear gold with a rich white head. Nice earthy pin hops with a balanced sweetness. Well done.

Bottle with massive thanks to Guy. Pours bright orange with a fair bit of haze and a sticky white head. Nose is full of tropical fruits, citric zest, mild spice, cloves and fairly heavy banana. The sweet and juicy fruits cut through the nose perfectly. Perfect balance to this. Tropical fruits, stone fruit, melon, banana, cloves, mild pepper and orange blossom in complete unison. Incredible for a style which I wouldnt normally touch

Drucken på Mikkeller bar, Stockholm. Lätt humlig doft, kroppen rätt fyllig, smaken fint humlig, inte alla likt en veteöl. Riktigt bra! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap på Mikkeller Stockholm. Tropiskt fruktig som en påse bilar. Fruktig på ett riktigt bra sätt

Fat på Mikkeller Bar. 
Dimmig bärnsten. 
Doftar lätt av tuggummi och frukt. 
Lätt smak av frukt men även något kemiskt. 
Tunn i kroppen.

Gumballhead on tap at Local Option pours a clear copper gold with a fruity wheat gumball aroma sweet & sticky they has a bitter hop edge to it. The taste is fruity and sharply bitter with a gumball sweetness. Medium-full bodied the beer is sweet with an earthy edge - great stuff.

Timothy O'Toole's Pub, Chicago, draft. No head. Light blond and clear. Thin taste of lemon zest. No aroma. Not for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at mikkeller, copenhagen. Hazy deep golden color, white head. Aroma is yeast, wheat, fruits, citrus notes. Taste is wheaty, some yeast, crispy hoppy notes.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Aroma is hoppy with some bubblegum and soapiness. Very light and intriguing, taste is very light with prominent wheat features, quite earthy and lemony. Hops in taste is hardly there except a soapy feel, with a bitterness on end.

So, here I sit rating beer # 4000 and this is appropriate. Ive been trying to taste this for years on end. Finally found on tap at the vintage, a great place fer sure. I was hoping for a well behaved wheat beer with bubble gum flavors but what I got was a well behaved slightly hoppy beer. Phil is a great business guy who knows what hes doing. I was thinken this would be one great wheat beer but it turned out to be somewhat hoppy, surprisingly so. Pale yellah. Slight B/O aroma, what is it with these hoppy beers lately, not in to too much B/O unless its my favorite mates, heheh and even then I think of it as perfume. Good co2 keeps this stuff refreshing none the less, baby. Fun overall. But you can tell its made to please the hop heads round here, probably why it has such a good rating. Medium hop bitterness on the finish. For a hoppy beer, not bad by this lager lovers standards. Considering the hop effects from the start, not bad overall. Glad to have finally tasted this and on tap thanks to phil at vintage, YEAH!
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text:
Tasted from draft. Pours a clear gold with white head. Aroma is sweet grains, wheat and some lemon and citrus notes. Taste is very well balanced with moderate sweetness and medium bitterness. Nice clean citrus bitterness. Throughout. Definite get a lemony flavor with the wheat. Excellent for the style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a lightly hazy yellow with a full white head. Aroma reminds men of new leather shoes. In a good way. Musky. Herbal. The taste is smooth and hoppy but not bitter with a refreshing lemony finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Thanks to Mike. Pours a clear golden color. Tropical/citrus hop aromas dominate the nose. Finishes very well. Medium light bitterness. Mostly an ipa beer. Very smooth, but hop packed beer. Tropical fruit notes from the fresh hops. Very nice.

Tap at original mikkeller. Pour is almost clear amber with a small White head. Lots of wheat fruityness and hops going on. Taste is more wheat up front, but is overall really fruity. A really easy drinking beer. Crisp, semi-High carb.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours clear gold with a white head. Aroma citrus, tropical fruit, wheat. Taste is citrus, tropical fruit, wheat, grapefruit. Light with balanced finish.

Tap in a pint glass at Kaseys Tavern. Golden colored ale with minimal head. Lacing is average at best. Surprised this is referred to as a wheat. More citrus than most wheat options. Easy to drink and enjoyable. I would contend its a pale ale pretending to be a wheat. Some sweetness in the middle that disappears by the end. Im a fan. No idea why this is called gumballhead.

Tap in pint glass at kaseys in Chicago. Gold with white head. Citrus hop aroma. Hoppy taste throughout. slightly sweet. Tastes more like a pale ale than a wheat. A bit thin in the mouth. Its ok. Like getting the orange gumball. You really wanted the cherry, but its better than the banana one at least.

Bottle from trade. Thanks, mdg164! Pours a light orange gold with a big white head. Aroma is dank, some pine, some citrus. Nice mothfeel with perfect carb, flavor is lemony citrus, some dank, slight grassy bitter in the finish.

Meduim gold color with a two finger white head. Aroma is light pine, citrus, grass and some hops. Taste is piney, lemony and a nice sweet and hoppy balance. Refreshing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great wheat ale. Tasty , smelly , amazing. Sweet all around. Nice poor with great head. Enjoy.

Draft at Taste the Rarity
Pours apricot orange with a white head. Aroma that reminds me of sunflower seeds, light soap, and spice. Flavor is a citrus explosion, leaning towards the sweet side with a full mouthfeel. Interesting!
On draft. Dark gold color with thick white head. Lemon and wheat aroma. Zesty lemon taste. Smooth palate. Enjoyable.

Brown bottle, 355 ml, trade with rfraga7 (thank you!), savoured on July 9 2014; eye: golden, clear, no effervescence, tiny sheet of white head, light lacing; nose: hops, light pine, tropical fruits, light perfumy, light bubble gum; mouth: hops, light pine, light tropical fruits, light bubble gum, light citrus, light acidity, finale in hops with slight presence of bubble gum, medium body, below-average carbonation, mildly bitter, slightly sweet, a bit thin; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 355 ml, échange avec rfraga7 (thank you!), savourée le 9 juillet 2014; il : dorée, limpide, pas deffervescence, petite couverture de mousse blanche, légère dentelle; nez : houblon, léger pin, fruits tropicaux, léger parfumé, léger gomme balloune; bouche : houblon, léger pin, léger fruits tropicaux, léger gomme balloune, léger citron, légère acidité, finale en houblon avec très légère présence de gomme balloune, corps moyen, carbonatation sous la moyenne, moyennement amère, très légèrement sucrée, un peu mince; en résumé : bien
Bärnstensfärgad med litet skum. Doftar Amerikansk humle och veteöl. Smakar humligt och lite söt. Lite för gammal för ölen känns lite trött!

Happened to notice this on the bottle list at Ginos. checked and they just got many cases. Clear dark yellow. Grapefruit nose. Great palate makes this. Soft peaches and citrus. Dry finish. Delectable taste and palate.

Poured from bottle into tulip glass. Bottled on 6/16 so this was only 11 days old!
Appearance: Slightly cloudy, white head about 1-2 inches thick. Many bubbles floating up from the bottom of the glass. Upon swishing, sparkling bubbles coated the sides of the glass. Color was a light gold. This beer is beautiful and very inviting!
Aroma: Very pungent with big Amarillo hop aroma. Profile consists of floral notes, fruit (passion fruit, a little grapefruit), and pine.
Taste: Hop domination on the front. Big grapefruit flavor and pine. As this beer warmed up I picked up the wheat backbone which brings a special refreshing kick of malts to the finish.
Palate: Very sudsy with a medium body, almost creamy.
Overall: This is the ideal for a refreshing beer. Beautiful merger of a pale ale and wheat beer. Very Amarillo-centric and it makes sense with that big fruit flavor! Happy to have had this with such a fresh born on date!

Bottle from Mikkeller online shop; clear amber pour with a quickly dissipating bubbly white head, tropic hop aroma of passion fruit and pineapple, taste is not that wheat mostly grapefruit and pine a hint of spice and banana.

Fluffy white head, clear golden color. Distinct Amarillo hop aroma, grapefruit, lemon, herbal, grassy, and floral. Well rounded and pleasant sweetness. Fizzy, soft carb, and light with a nice clean finish.

Bottle. Hazy golden with white head. Delicious aroma, grapefruit, pine, resinous. Taste of grapefruit, pine, orange, citrus, little earthy wheat flavour in the finish. Crisp and refreshing. Yep, its delicious.

Pours a slightly cloudy yellow gold with a good sized white head. Nose is hoppy. Very creamy with a silky texture. Hops are upfront and dominate the flavor. Not overly bitter, there is a wheat grain backbone to help balance the hops. A hopheads delight.

Draft. Pours clear, effervescent amber with thick, dense head. Aroma is grassy hops, bubblegum, citrus, crackery malt. Taste is malt and grassy hops, over-brewed peppermint tea, candied grapefruit, spice. Tasty.

Appearance - 5 - nice golden color clear beer w/ fluffy white head and nice lacing
Aroma - 10 - nice super fruity apricot, lemon, orange smells
Taste - 10 - super fruity apricot, peach, tangerine, lemon, orange, bready malt, wheat in the background
Palate - 5 - super light drinking hoppy wheat ale, alc completely covered, aftertaste light tropical fruits
Overall - 19 - Similar to easy jack. Great light hoppy beer

Bottle to glass. Pours a mostly clear golden yellow color with an off-white head. Aroma is fleshy fruit sweetness with citrus. Flavor is a perfectly balanced citrusy bitter sweet character with a mild wheat background. Light in body, smooth, very drinkable. An excellent beer.

At SeaJax sample. Slightly warm when I got to the 4th sample. Very wheat-y with a slight hop bitter aftertaste. I know it's 3 Floyd's but not for me. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy
Catching up on old ticks. Honestly one of the strongest wheat beers I remember having. Perfectly balanced with nice bright hops. Smooth and easy. Hope I can try this one again soon.

pours clear golden with frothy white head. aroma has a little bot of hops, i was expecting a wiessen type beer, but this is far from it. taste is very light perfect for summer with a light hop bitterness.
10 day old bottle from Three Floyds. Poured clear orange with fluffy white head. Aroma of mild hop resin. Light carb med bod. Balanced light bitter taste. Classic
Tap. Clear, dark gold. Mild nose. Hoppy. Mildly citrus. Only vaguely wheaty or yeasty.
Pours clear golden with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are citrus, caramel, pine, and a little wheat - with a slightly bitter finish.

Golden and slightly cloudy. Prominent aroma of grass and some citrus. Tastes a bit like unfermented wort. Low bitterness. Lasting unpleasant aftertaste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours hazy gold into a shaker. Bright white head with medium retention recedes to coat surface. Citrus and yeast aromas. Soft with wheat, yeast and citrus front to back.

Soooooooooooo good! Floral/grapefruit notes I could literally drink 20 of these! A great beer for a hot day! Very hard to get unless you live in the area! Absolutely try it if you can get it!- You will be doing youre self a favor\flavor.!

On tap into a shaker. Bubblegum, grass, lemon, and tropical nose. Pleasant. Clear honey body with very little, light white head and very, very little lace. Medium bitter and medium light sweetness. On the thin side of creamy with an active carbonation and a medium body. The finish is bubblegum and grass with some lemon and pepper. Some citrus too. Dry and crisp with a lemon, fruity and bready melllow aftertaste

On tap at Urge. Pours a medium orange with a one finger white head with just a little lacing. Aroma is of citrus (a lot of lemon), tropical fruits, white grapes, light pine, and some wheat bread malts. Taste is pretty similar to the aroma with the addition of some light herbal & grassy hops and some light sweet malts. Has medium-light body with a slightly creamy mouthfeel and a semi-moderate bitter, medium carbonated, semi dry, medium, refreshing finish. Overall, a excellent wheat ale that I would rate as the best in the world.

Hefe-weizen-esque in glass. Billowing lasting 2-finger head sits atop a hazy golden body. Good lacing. Nose is muted. Lemon, apple and some earthy,grainy notes.

Flavor is also muted offering some lemon, grain, grass and crackers. Body is medium and a triumph when compared to the oft-skeletal bodies of so many wheat ales. Dry, thirst quenching finish. A quality example of a very underwhelming style.

Love this beer. Golden colored wheat beer with thick head and good lacing. Refreshing like a lemonade, lemon, citrus, piney aroma and taste. Amarillo Hops galore, but not too bitter. Limited distribution makes this hard to get, but I found some in Richmond, IN.

Pours a deep golden color. Has a sweet aroma of candied fruit. It has a slightly sweet taste with an overwhelming display of hops. If you are looking for a potent hoppy beer this is the one. Not too bitter, so an easy beer to enjoy
In a world full of cheesy-ass wheat, this one stands tall. Not too sweet, has some bite on the back side if the tongue and like all 3 Floyd's brews, great balance in the aftertaste.

Pours a pale golden orange with a thin fizzy white head. Aroma is sweet orange, wheat grass, some light floral notes, and maybe a touch of honey. Nothing overpowering but its very well balanced and smells great. Flavor is oranges, honey, sweet wheat grass. Very nice flavor. Very enjoyable beer.
If you find this beer on tap, order it. Excellent wheat beer with citrus flavors. One of my favorites. Great with food.
Whenever you can make a wheat beer not taste like a wheat beer youve got a winner. This is a hopped out beer. Excellent.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2014 Served: 12 oz bottle
Look: pours a golden almost honey 
Smell: strong smell of hops, citrus fruit. Lemons, and tangerines. Smell flowers from the hops.
Taste: taste lemons, strong hops flavor
Feel: very light in the tongue. Like the light carbonation.
Overall: great flavor dry refreshing. Perfect beer for summer evenings.
Enjoy. Good lighter beer.
First Drank: home in Decatur XMAS 2013

Bottle from Mikkeller Online Shop. Dark golden to orange, slightly hazy body, with a small, frothy, white head. Aroma of citrus, red fruits, orange, peach, bubblegum, grass. Tastes of red fruits, citrus, orange, peach, grass, biscuit. Mouthfeel medium, with a lively carbonation and it finishes moderate bitter, with citrus, red fruits and malt notes. A refreshing, greatly balanced and easy to drink combination of a pale ale and a wheat beer. The Amarillo hops are beautifully showcased. Tasty!

Bottle pours a clear golden yellow with some white fizz. Light wheat in the sweet malty aroma with some lightly citrusy american hops. The flavor is crisp and smooth goes down real easy but has some backbone. Really good american wheat beer. Light grain spice, minimal wheat mustiness with some light lemon citrus, earthy fruity hops. Bright carbonation makes flavors linger with some sweetness.

Bottle, thanks to rxeight. Pours surprisingly clear and gold with white head. Aroma is full of citrus and pine -- is this a wheat beer or an IPA? Taste is hop-forward -- citrus, pine, with a light body, wheat that comes through more as it warms. Easy drinking, light body, heavily hop-forward. Doesnt really have a prominent wheat character. I imagine this is one of those beers that redefined styles a few years back -- very forward thinking and progressive, making an ipa wheat beer. As an IPA, its okay. As a wheat beer, its hard to even recognize it. As a pioneer, this could be an earth-shattering revelation. Without that context, its a hoppy beer that has some wheat in it thats pretty tasty.
tap. Hazy golden with small head. Wheat beer with huge amarillo hops. Big citrus, slight lemon. I wish all wheat beers were this tasty.

Orangeish pour thin white head. Fruity wheat aroma, like a bowl of fruity pebbles. Light body light to medium carbonation. Refreshing. Some orange and banana with some fruity marsh mellow like. Nice hop profile. Good stuff.

on tap at Pazzos (Lexington, KY). Clear golden body with excellent clarity; very durable, creamy white head leaves the glass well coated with sticky lacing. 

Aroma: moderately strong but somehow gentle mix of hops.

Flavor: Some complexity from the hop (mix). Some bisquity malts in the background. 

Feel: light bodied but not at all watery, thanks in part to the crisp, medium-high carbonation that seems just right 

O: another excellent selection from FFF

Perhaps my fave example of a wheat beer, having drank alot of german and belgium wheats in the past, it is nice to find a wheat beer that crosses both the APA and wheat beer cross roads without being excessively hoppy or heavy on the belly, perhaps my fave beer out of both of these categories!

Poured from bottle. Pours a clear golden yellow, starting with a thick head that dissapates to a thin lacing. Aroma is Hoppy and citrus. Taste is lemon, fruity. The Hops stand out with a dry finish. One of my Favorites.

DUft. store duft af grapefrugt, citrus lime., frisk frugt,
Smag: meget frisk i smage af frisk frugt. fin bitterhed. meget smagsfuld øl.

Bottled 02/12/14.
Pale yellow with a golden hue. 
Pungent, light semi-tart fruit. Big hop nose, not pelletized, more oily but no resin. 
Amarillo hops sit on the palate, bitterness is above average, but body is still soft with a bit of zesty wheat subduing any perceived harshness. A bit chewy up front than a drier finish. 
Lingers of a hoppy bitterness but very light. Quenchable pale ale with amazing flavor given drinkability.

12oz bottle pours clear toasted orange with a finger of head. Nose is peach, pineapple, orange peel. Taste is pineapple, peach, citrus, held up by balanced notes of wheat and grainy malt. Finish is medium bitterness, some creamy malt, with piney citrus and tropical fruit. Tasty.
Murky golden pour, thick white head of foam. Aroma of citrus, bread, and malt. Taste is mild hops, citrus, light malt. Crisp, tasty, and very drinkable.

Had to look up the definition of a Wheat Ale before this rate. This fits the bill. Pours hazy yellow with big dissipating white head. Scent is lemony, spicy, with slight bread. Flavor has the citrus of a wheat beer with a big hoppy bite. Live on the tongue. I can see why it is best of style brew. Bottle - Received in Trade
Tasted from a 12oz. bottle. It poured a hazy golden hue with a frothy white head and streaky lacing. Has a fruity hopped-wheat aroma. Taste of wheat with a layer of citrus-zest.
Great first beer! Drinkable, not over the top, tastes great. Great go to beer
Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends in Copenhagen. Fruity smell and something that reminds me of honey. As it warms up the hops shows up. Fruity taste with some hops. Light body. Easy to drink.
Drank straight from bottle. Smooth and fruity taste. Light and refreshing. Lemony aftertaste combined with a hoppy flavor. Bartender give me another!!!

My favorite beer from my favorite brewer. So glad I live in Indiana and can pick up my weekly 6 pack of Gumballhead. For those who have not tried Broodoo by Three Floyd's, it has a very similar taste profile. Highly recommended. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

@ Drakes / Florence KY --- Bright hazy orange amber with a solid 1" white head, swirls of lace. Good looking brew. Taste is mild malt with a little grass, and a hint of citrus and honey. Hops enter assertively at the back of the palate, lasting well into the finish. Solid food beer, and a good aperitif as well. Recommended.
35 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear golden with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are citrus, caramel, pine, and a little wheat - with a slightly bitter finish.
Gold pour with a white head. Nose is light hops, wheat, and lemon. Easy palate, refreshing lemon, nice hop note, smooth finish.

Bottle. Pours a hazy amber with medium white head. Aroma is hoppy hay and caramel. Taste is light enough to make sure you know this is a wheat beer. Lemon and hoppy, slight bitter. Never got the crazy love for this one.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text:
UPDATED: APR 14, 2014 Editing original rating. Last two batches of this that I have got have tasted and smelled different. Not sure if FFF is not putting as much care into the brew, or if theyve just changed something on it. The hops and citrus used to jump out at you in this, but lately its seemed more on the lighter side and watery. Maybe its just me and tastes have changed, not sure. 

This was my first taste of Three Floyds beers over a year ago. Ive since been able to try five of their beers total and this is still one of my favorites. Its difficult to get ahold of their beers since Im in NY, but Ive gotten what I could. Its an amazing wheat beer with a summer feel, but Id drink it year round if I had the access. The aroma is incredible and the hops smell is of citrus and grass. Appearance is golden with some bubbles that come up the glass and a minimal head. Taste is perfect with lemon and other citrus flavors. By far the best wheat beer Ive had and Id recommend this to anyone if it fits your tastes.

Bottle thanks to my secret santa jckp64. Pours a hazy amber color with a small foamy head that lingers nicely. Aroma is nice fresh lemons with some grainy malt, grass, and a light fruitiness. Tastes like the perfect light summer beer. Smooth grainy malt, nice refreshing lemon flavor, spicy hop finish with grass and a little pine. Love the mouthfeel. Carbonation is nice and sharp on the tongue. Well crafted wheat beer.

Not being a big wheat beer fan, this one always hits the spot. Pours a straw colored pale gold. Light aroma of cereal and lemon. Taste is lemon (as the description says), but has such a light bodied malt bill and sweet yeast, it never gets "filling", as many wheat beers seem to. The wheat is noticable in the finish, as it lingers a bit, but it stays light in the mouthfeel. Enjoyable wheat beer for sure!

Reviewed from notes. Picked up a sixpack as I drove through Indiana on my way out to Alaska last summer.
She pours a nice bright yet clear golden color and leaves the same colored body, however, its slightly hazy here and there, streams of carbonation are rising at a moderate pace, a one finger white foamy head lasts for about a minute before dieing, some moderate sticky lacing.
The smell has the hops up front, slightly citrusy, slightly grassy, and the wheat is very subdued.
The taste has a balanced sweet fruity grassy citrusy hops, wheat is once again very subdued, slight malty aftertaste, crisp dry finish.
The palate is about a light to medium, semi-sessionable. Carbonation is actually a lot smoother than most APWAs Ive had, actually, I would say this is quite impressive for me and for the style.
Overall, Ive had a fair amount of APWAs over the years, and I would say this is probably the smoothest one anyone could ever find; I would have this again, even though its a hoppier version of the style.

Good aroma, butterscotch. 1/4 fingers length of head and fades quickly.
Nice golden color, some bubbles comes up from the bottom
Very unique taste, must be from the red wheat. Not sure I could drink a lot of these, but a good bear.

Pours a hazy golden color, nice earthy aromas, light mouthfeel, light citrusy hop on the finish, pretty good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled at CBF years back. Big pine hop aroma
Pale green golden 
Light wheaty body
Aromatic citric and piney notes
Perfumed retronasal
Draft.Yellow with a white head. Orange hop in the nose with a slight hop and wheat flavor.best pale ale out there.
Bottle. Pours a clear, sparkling light amber. little bit of froth. Nice bright hoppy aroma. Really great balance, with a nice bight, finishing off a crisp wheat but hoppy flavor. Really nice.
Bottle, shared by jack. This was super fresh. Bottled seven days ago picked up at the brewery. Super hoppy like most 3F. Okay but a little one-dimensional.

From bottle. Pours a slight hazy golden copper hue with a thin white head. Decent lacing. Aroma is floral, grassy, citrusy and a hint of honey. Taste is floral hops up front, with medium bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied with lively carbonation. Finish is a sweet lemon zest. Best wheat ale I've ever had.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours clear yellow with a light white head. Aroma is fruity, citrus, floral. Flavor is wheat, fruit, citrus. Nice beer.
Awesome wheat beer thats just barely a wheat beer. Very hoppy and very good.

12 oz bottle. Pours a hazy goldenrod color with a pearly white head. Very lively carbonation. Nice lacing. Aroma is floral, grassy, and citrusy. Flavor is floral hops up front, with medium bitterness. Palate is medium-bodied. The finish is a sweet lemony flavor. Absolutely delicious. Very grateful to my friend MD for this!

Still my favorite summertime drinker. Though the ABV doesn't suggest it, this is a strongly bitter and aggressive beer, much like everything from 3 Floyd's. It lingers a little long on the tongue, but these go back wonderfully in the warmer months.

Got a nice bright beer here...a little citrus nose and taste... Real easy to drink...nice session wheat ipa:/... Try HALF ACRES akari shogun and the easier to get Lagunitas Little Sumpin sumpin....mmmm good wheatPAs

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at three floyds brewpub. Pours a clear, filtered golden color. Aroma of citrus with hints of yeast. Taste is very unique. Not your typical wheat beer. Mild hop bitterness with a smooth citrus / orange finish. Solid malt presence throughout. Im not a wheat beer guy, but I could drink this! Solid offering, not dissappointing.

Highly impressed. Dont like the wheat beer style at all, this knocked my socks off, quite literally.. tons of citrusy hops and very great flavor. no hint of the dreaded wheat beer flavor at all. id say it is more like an APA

There is a very interesting "gumball" smell and reminds me a little of juicy fruit smell, which I love. The flavor is lemony and fresh. I dont get a lot of hop or grain flavor. I would say it is a very clean and crisp beer. Probably more suited for a summer day than New Years Day. Still, I think the aroma is really what makes this beer interesting.

12 oz bottle. Pours a clear bronze with a nice frothy head that disappears fairly quick. Aroma is lots of citrus, berries and grapes. Taste is heavenly and balanced with citrus, berries, bread and some yeasts. Really nice bear!

Rating based on notes from some time ago... Bottle. Light amber pour. Aroma is very hoppy, with nice citrus. Flavour is hops, light citrus, and a little bready. Beautifully balanced and very tasty. Ill be looking for this one again.
Bottle, thx blackipa, pours a birght yellow, aroma is citrus, taste is a nice hoppy flavour, with a nice taste all around, overall pretty tasty

Bottle at the Jeffrey (so happy this place opened). Pours normal orange with white head. Amazing nose of tropical fruit and hops. Tastes of papaya, mangoes, wheat, Chardonnay, vanilla, and yeast. Pretty awesome glad I got chance to have

Thanks to Jrod1969 for this extra, cheers Jared!

Poured to NB globe.

A: Brass ale pours to single finger, bone white head which dissipates into blanket of fine bubbles. Near excellent clarity. Confluent columns of bubbles rise from the bottom. 

S: Lots of grapefruit, cotton candy, other citrus. Light, very light, resin. Light hint of grain and corn.

T: I cant recall having a wheat ale which actually accentuated the flavor of the wheat so well. Slightly sour, yeasty flavor, plenty of citrus rinds. Effervescent finish highlights the hops in the beer. 

M: light, yet tacky. High carbonation. Numbing and dry mouthfeel. 

D: Quite a drinkable beer. I wish it were hotter out, it would pair well with a warm day.

Serving type: bottle

02-16-2011

Clear Gold Color, Huge White Head, Long Lasting, Lots Of Thin Stings Of Lacing. Very Pleasant Aroma, Reminds Me Of Passion Fruit, Floral Hops. Lager Like Base Topped Off With Passion Fruit and Floral Hops to Finish Off. Slightly Sweet, Moderately Peppery Bitter Finish.. Medium Body, Highly Carbonated. Really Nice and Easy. Enjoyed It. Recommended...

Side by side comparison between Gumballhead and 80-Acre. Similar small white head. Gumballhead is clear, 80-Acre a little cloudy. 
Gumballhead a little grapefruity nose. 80-Acre has a sweet nose. 
Gumballhead is a little piney and citrusy, with a hoppy bitter, dry finish that lingers. Medium carbonation. Gumballhead leaves a bigger, longer feel in the mouth. 
80-Acre is almost a light saison sweetness, followed by a little hoppy kick that then turns back to sweet for the finish. 
80-Acre is good, but Gumballhead remains my favorite!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(bottle) pours a slightly hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of heavy tropical fruit, mango, orange peel, nettles, pale malts and resin. flavour is mostly herbal hops and nettles, slightly oxidized and phenolic, with a hint of peaches and gooseberries. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Picked up bottles @ 3 Floyds. Pours golden, citrus aroma, first flavor to hit is grapefruit. Always pick up when available at the brewery along with Alpha King. Great beer, enjoy. Cheers!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

floral, citrus, frothy, white foam, golden, amber, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, slick feel, lively, 

I read about this in a beer book im reading and the first time I drank it I didnt notice the subtle pineapple taste/aroma that is magnificently blended to create a beer with a tropical explosion. Although this beer didnt pair well with my fish tacos, when drank on its own its a beer Id drink a 6 pack of easily and enjoy every sip.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2014 Draft: pours a nice golden yellow with a frothy white head. Aromas of citrus, and fruit. Its easy drinking and fresh... Clean... Bright. Great wheat beer... Immensely drinkable, this is wonderful!

Finally got my hands on this one thanks to queenholly. Thanks!! Bottle pours a mostly clear golden or light orange with a massive fluffy white head on top. Lots of lacing on the glass as the head recedes. Aroma is sweet lemony, grassy hops, malt sweetness and honey, then some floral potpourri. This smells like hop candies. Flavor is big lemon hops with a lightly sweet malt backbone. This has a big time punch of flavor and the floral lemon flavors longer on the palate. Very light bodied, a bit of slickness, and high carbonation. I can see why people love this one. Super quaffable and lots of flavor. Nicely balanced between the hops and malts. Might be one of the best beers for drinking a 6-pack that I have had.
Hands down the best beer i had ever had. Do yourself a favor and go find one and drink it.

A frothy white head floats on the cleanest wheat body Ive seen, just slightly hazed, bright and golden with a few streamers, bits of chunky lace decorate the lip of my glass as the head falls to a thin ring

Mellow citrusy-dank aromatics are spiked with big peach and chardonnay-esque notes on a slightly resonating, highly quaffable light-medium palate, a solid dose of intriguing juicy hop characteristics with very well restrained bitterness, greens and oranges galore with flashes of yellow, mango, papaya, sweet grapefruit, delicate nuances of pineapple, solid depth while maintaining a very pleasant, easy going demeanor

355ml at 45º into 17oz Direction Pilsner

Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, caramel, hops, resin, mango and a bit of pine. Bitter finish with caramel, citrus and hops. Very good brew, more APA like than wheat though.

Bottle. Poured 11/16/13. Translucent star-gold with a dense white head. Aroma is fruity, sweet, grass, citrus, touch of funk, honey. Smells fantastic. Taste is warm, honey, earthy, grass, not too wheaty, sweet, herbal, spicy, mild hoppiness, bread; fantastic! Finish is grass and citrus with a touch of leather. Nice lacing throughout. Medium-low carbonation. Mouth feel is coating but not real syrupy. Fantastic. Maybe my favorite wheat ale.

Woo fire woo fire fire woo woo fire fire damn!!!!!!! Delicious 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Stamped 3173.
Appearance: The body is crystal clear with an amber hue, a dense white head accompanies it for a moment before settling into a creamy coating.
Aroma: The aroma is slightly floral with orange and grapefruit with a mild sweetness of cotton candy.
Taste: The intro is of subtle sweet peach and tangerine leading into a mild bitterness of grapefruit. The finish adds some carbonic acid and lemon, reminiscent of Perrier water with a slice of lemon. The finish lingers a moment, clean and grassy.
Palate: Full-bodied and highly carbonated.
Overall: This is a very tasty wheat ale, the best Ive ever had, that I can think of. I love the complexity throughout and the mouthfeel is spot on for the style. This is a great beer, one I would love to drink again.

This beer is insanely drinkable to me, like Brooklyns Summer was this summer. It reminds me of a pilsner that met a belgian ale and had a child- and that child has some of the hoppiness of a distant cousin. When Millers/Coors/Bud decides to try to appeal to craft beer drinkers with better beer while sticking to their easy-drinking roots, they should model their efforts on Gumballhead.

12 oz. bottler from a trade with Fletche00. Clear, gold, with a small, off-white head. The aroma is lemon peels, immense resinous and piney hops, caramel, and some light coriander and peppercorns. The flavor is light sweetness, and a pretty aggressive bitterness. Theres a light spiciness in the finish. Medium body, lively, and crisp, with a pretty clean finish. This is a nice, hoppy wheat beer.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2015 This beer has really grown on me. At first the hop flavor for a wheat hit me as odd, but over time I have found it interesting and enjoyable. Nice lemon aroma, decent golden hue, and a neat combination of hops and fruit flavor. A really good beer.

FROM NOTES: July 22, 12
Poured from a 12 ounce bottle into a pint glass and enjoyed with Barnaby Struve, clearly the best way to enjoy it. 

A: Citrus hops and tropical fruits including grapefruit, mango, pineapple, orange, and lemon zest. There is a bit of wheat as well and a touch of spice. 
A: Pours a light golden color with a big fluffy white head that leaves an ass-ton (International Unit of Measurement, ass-ton = a LOT) of lacing.
T: True to the nose, big notes of lemon zest, huge notes of citrus and grapefruit, and a touch of pine on the back end. The wheat/malt profile is there, but definitely in the background. A touch of breadiness remains on the finish. 
P: Light bodied, good carbonation, refreshing and light. 
O: 3Fs does it again. One of the best wheat beers I have ever had, a truly interesting experience and one I hope to have often!

Bottle: beaming amber with good clarity & only a faint yeasty haze; chunky, big-bubbled white head grows huge & settles very slowly. Aroma is very pine forward, brash pine cones, zesty grass, faint white pepper, & candied grapefruit peel. Taste is not as bitter as expected; soft wheat, nibbling pine, grass, oranges, & light grapefruit peels. Little bitter back-end pine with some lasting wheat & mild citric outro. Very drinkable, tasty stuff.
Bottle. Clear light gold with large white head. Hay and hops. Just the right body. Awesome refreshing beer.-- rated with Beerbasher

A: Golden Straw Hue, Passes Lots of Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

S: Wheat, Grapefruit, Mild Floral

T: Wheat, Grapefruit, Floral

M: Decent Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Mildly Bitter, Mildly Drying

Overall...a great hoppy wheat ale, so well done and highly recommended.
Poured from the bottle, a honey amber with a huge bubbly head. Aroma is citrus and floral hops. Lots of bitterness with some sweetness for balance. Very good.

Tap at the Hopleaf, Chicago. Poured a hazy medium amber with a frothy off white head and some low carbonation. The aroma is hoppy with a hint of dry yeast. The flavour is medium bitter with a smooth Amarillo hop slightly spicy citrus palate.
Aroma: citrus. App: yellow, thin head. Taste: lemon finish. Palate: thinner than expected. Over: not that impressed. Not bad just not great.
Bottle pour. Nice subtle pine aroma with a really smooth and mellow wheat taste. A very nice brew that reminds me of a wheat APA style, if there is such a thing.

12 oz bottle. pale, golden pour with me a frothy white head. Aroma has notes of lemon, and orange with hints of bready, toasty malt. Flavor is more of the same. Perfect harmony of malt and hops. Mild bitterness with tons of flavor. Clean finish. Super drinkable.
One of my favorite beers. Not to hoppy and perfect for hot summer days or cool fall nights.

Bottle poured into a Pint glass. No date, but it was bought at the brewery 10/13/13. My first Wheat Ale. Three finger pillowy white head that slowly settles in. The beer is a light golden coppery color, allows light through fairly freely, and has a good amount of carbonation. The aroma is similar to that of an IPA, hoppy, citrusy, but with a sweeter fruity smell you typically dont get. The taste is extremely balanced; I change my mind as to whether its more sweet or bitter with each sip. I suppose its slightly hop forward however. Grapefruit, orange, and a light hint of caramel when the sweetness peaks. Light-medium body, eminently drinkable, and it leaves thick walls of lacing behind. Thoroughly enjoyable beer.

A fantastic IPA with subtitle nodes of a fruity aftertaste that doesn't over power the bitter after taste of an IPA 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap. Golden with just a little haze and quite a bit of head. Not your typical wheat. Hop taste predominates but is not overwhelming. Very good stuff.

Earthy dirty hop nose. Slight grainy malt nose. Clear golden color. Moderate hop bitterness. Some citrusy notes. I'm afraid this one is past its prime. 

---Rated via intercellular device

Im not a big wheat beer gal, but I will buy this again. Its slightly cloudy and pours a light head. The aroma is hoppy which is unique to the wheat beers Ive had - I have to remind myself this is a wheat beer. It doesnt have the normal sweetness Id expect. All around delicious.
Bottle. A great wheat beer. Lemon, orange, and wheat in the aroma and a flavor pretty decently balanced between the hops and wheat. Very smooth, easy drinking. Worth the search to find this one.

Amazing pale wheat beer. Light, and refreshing with more flavor than you'd think possible for a wheat beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Quite good. Nice overwhelming amount of Amarillo hops, and some wheaty / biscuity notes. Flavors of orange zest and grapefruit.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

No wonder why it's a higher rated wheat. It's loaded with lemony hops. Pretty clear orange. Crisp drinkable and earning its highest wheat beer dues

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours golden yellow with about an inch of head. Very, basement aromas of, floral and banana. Very bitter crisp taste. Nice overall.
pours yellow gold. Spicy lemon zest hop aroma. Wheaty texture, but light and drinkable. Much of the hop aroma and flavor carries over exactly to the beer. Completely fantastic.

Got fresh from 3F and couldn't be happier. Nice citrusy aroma and taste at the start. Taste turns a little lemony with a sort of ripe raspberry (maybe) after a while. With the brewery in transition was really missing this one. Lovin' it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Like a distant ice cream truck, some weather screams for this hoppy wheat beer. A truck from Munster playing metal that is. Heat and humidity are the last two ingredients needed for gumballhead. The aroma, color, and refreshing taste are ideal on a late summer night. Pour from a 12 oz. bottle picked up at the brewery.

Hazy, yellow-orange pour with a frothy, white head. The aroma has obvious wheat mixed with lemon, orange peel, and some spice. It has a medium body with a slightly sticky texture and average carbonation. The taste begins with the slightest bitterness and becomes more sweet to the finish. This beer is smooth, flavorful, and still refreshing.

Pours a slightly hazy orange with a finger of head that hangs out. Surprisingly hoppy aroma given that its a wheat beer. Some obvious citrus scents as well. Definite wheat characteristic flavor with some lemony accents. Distinct biting finish. Not overly carbonated mouthfeel. Goes down smooth. Good beer, even if its not my favorite style
Slight haze on this yellow gold pour. Off white head fades quick but leaves a lot of lacing. Aroma is citru then hops then wheat. Taste follows nose. I really liked it, but expected more wheat notes.

Bottle from queenholly. Pours a pale golden straw, little to no head. Grain upfront, a crisp citrus quality as well, very light. Body lively, sweet grain profile, almost a hint of tartness, finish subtle and crisp. Not mind blowing, but does what it needs to do.

Poured from glass freshly purchased. Pours a fizzy minimal off-white head with a golden clear color. Has a nice citrus, fruit with some nice wheat notes, moderate hoppiness. Flavor is moderate hoppiness, some sweetness and malt with some ester and wheat notes. Above average fizzy mouthfeel with above average carbonation. Overall this is a good beer but not my favorite.

Bottle pour hazy light yellow. Nose lots grapefruit, mango, pine. Taste initial crisp bite, pine citrus fruit. Mellow mid palate malt finish light bitter with some lemon. My new standard for a wheat beer.

Pours a nice clear golden color with one finger white head. Good lacing. Smell is citrus up front, much more like an IPA than a wheat. The taste follows the nose - sweet citrus with a very refreshing hefeweizen-like lemony finish. Light bodied and lightly carbonated, very refreshing. Overall an outstanding American wheat, extremely well balanced. Great job FFF!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a standard golden with white head. Great aromas of citrus, herbs, and some tropical fruit. Awesome. Nice bitter floral flavours. Great flavorful wheat ale.

Poured from a bottle into a pint glass. Aromas of citrusy hops. Beautiful golden color with a frothy, pure-white head. Hard to believe a beer thats this hopped-up could also be refreshing, but it is. Flavors of malty sweetness (but never sticky) that are perfectly balanced with a lemony hop finish. It ends crisply without a hint of hop dryness. This is the ultimate poolside sipper!

Pours a hazy orange yellow with sweet nose with some soft citrus. Nice crisp taste with some lemon zest notes that fades into a gentle bitterness. This is really refreshing, definitely one of the better wheat beers Ive had.

Bottle courtesy of kermis. This has clear golden pour with a ligth, white head on top. Aroma is very nice, great combination between hops and wheats. Flavour is very thin, almost watery, but also quite sweet. Mouthfeel is slightly watery also, but it suits the style and the beer. Very nice brew.

One of the best wheat beers out there. Great initial taste, a hidden sweetness to it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample courtesy of and shared with kermis. 
Thick white head. Hoppy aroma. Hazy golden blond pour. nice bitterness. Lovely.
A very nice lemon and citrus tasting beer. Bitter after taste, but still very refreshing.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2014 Old rating rerated 17.03.2014, 0,35l bottle @ home:
Big creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly fruity, light malts, unripe mango, yeast, hay, banana, leafs, grass, hints of citrus peel and weeds. Taste is slightly dry, light malts, hay, weeds, yeast, leafs, sap, hints of citrus peel and tropical fruits. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice enough.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2013 Pale and hazy. Lots of pineapple, pear, and lemon aromas. Light body and tiny bubbles give the beer a very refreshing character. Citrusy and bitter flavor finishes with a taste reminiscent of limoncello.

I do not understand what all the hype is about with this particular three Floyd's offering.

For wheat beers:
Bottom line I prefer goose island 312


This beer is nothing special and should be sold in 12 packs for $12.00



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ home, 7/7 2013. Clear dark orange, medium white head that last, some lacing. Aroma, nice hoppy, piney, fruity, wheat, malty sweetness. Taste, light hoppyness, piney, grass, wheat, malty. Bitter wheat aftertaste. A bit dry on the mouth. Great summer beer.

From a 12oz bottle. Aroma is pine, wheat, and a light sweet malty scent. Flavor is wheat, pine, citrus, and sweet malt. Amazingly drinkable beer. So balanced, I love this beer. Wish we got it in Minnesota.
Nice beer. Pretty hoppy. Almost no head retention. Hops overpower much of the wheat character. But nice overall.
UPDATED: OCT 5, 2013 Pale yellow with minimal head. Subtle aroma but smooth balanced lemony flavor, delicious... I like this beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Clear golden colour with white head. Wheat, citric aroma. wheat, citric and grassy hops, bitter taste. light to medium body.

Bottle from ck1 - part of a 6 shared with E & K - thanks bro! Amazed for all the times having that have not rated. Pours yellowish orange with a white head. Aroma has fresh fruits, grassy hops, citrus and pine, with faint graininess. Taste is of fruits and pine, sweet with citrus and faint peach. Somewhat effervecent. Light to medium bodied. Very hoppy and complex for a bit of a blah style. As ever, nicely done by FFF.

This beer just works on all levels. A light golden color with a nice fluffy white head that hangs around for a bit. A sweet aroma with a nice hint of lemon. A clean crisp taste. Everything youve heard about Gumball Head is true.

Unique beer; probably the best Summer ale on the market. Lemony nose and aftertaste to this well balanced beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It's good. Not super impressed. Of the wheat also that I have had, this is one of the better ones. Gumballhead pours a light gold with almost no cap. It had the aroma of ... Well... Candy? Flavor is fruity and sweet. Notes of lemon. Overall good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

For those of you thinking this is just hype, its not.   Ive bought 10 cases of this so far and have paid 96 dollars for one of them. Aroma, absolutely unreal. I could smell this all day.   Im not even kidding.   I know of no one that has tried this beer and hasnt been astounded by it.   It literally changes the game. When I had this for the first time it was like having beer for the very first time,  I never had a clue any beer could taste this good. Add that to its beautiful color,  head and undeniably beautiful aroma and you have a winner.   Its so different from anything youve ever had,  I promise.  Do make sure if you land your hands on this to ensure it is fresh, it does change in taste as it ages,  and the wheat begins to get that chappy taste of blue moon.   I love this beer so much and I credit it for my change to craft beers because Ive searched so hard for it and never can find it so I now have found many other food beers.
Amazing wheat beer that almost tastes like an IPA, hoppy smooth delicious, transcends all boundaries of wheat ales.

Pours light golden with some white head. Aroma of wheat and lemon and a bit of pine. The taste is light and sweet with a hoppy finish. Overall a pretty decent beer and I would definitiely have some more of this.
Bottle.  Pale gold with a nice, dense head.  Huge pine aroma with a bit of citrus and malt.  The wheat really smooths out the finish.  Tastes more like a creamy IPA or pale ale.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2013 1/VI/13 - 33cl bottle @ pre-FortaRock tasting - BB: n/a (2013-511) Thanks to BelvidereIPA for the trade!
Note: Tinus should update his ratings faster, in order to avoid double drinking! :p But I dont think he minded...
Clear orange beer, irregular off-white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: pretty fruity, peaches, some exotic fruits, passion fruit, mango. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: citrus, bit fruity, bitter hops, grassy, more citrus, sourish touch, some grains. Aftertaste: dry, bitter hops, fruity bubble gum, exotic fruits, citrus, grassy, sourish, wheat (?), bitter ending. Nice beer.

Slightly hazy dark golden colour, white head. Aroma of hops, malts, tropical fruits, wheat, yeast, candy, gumballs, caramel, apricot, light banana. Sweet flavour, wheat, bitter hops, clementine and light orange. Quite light body, finish hops, wheat, very fruity!
Great beer, I love this one!
(From 33cL bottle @ ZZT VII afterparty. Thanks for sharing, kermis!)

Update: Another bottle, shared by Tim @ the pre-FortaRock tasting. I remain at my opinion, its a great beer. Lovely fresh, fruity notes on a wheat background. Refreshing and balanced, I could drink this again and again.
Purchased at brewery. Road trip was well worth it. This is my summar staple. Great all day. I cant believe this is a wheat beer. Great hop balance.
Sampled from bottle. Not much to detect from the notes taken other than I thought it was a bit weird but at the same time quite nice. Worth a try anyway.
Floral, citrus, banana, bubblegum, licorice, vanilla, cereal, hay, bread, caramel, ginger

Pours a crystal clear medium golden color with a huge fluffy white head that persists forever. Holy hop Batman, I wasnt expecting such an aroma from this. Earthy pine and grapefruit atop a solid base of bready and spicy malts. The flavor is pine and resin atop a spicy yeasty earthy wheat base. Lingering spicy hoppy finish long after each sip. Medium body with a moderate level of carbonation and a sweet resinous mouthfeel. Wow, now thats a wheat beer. Mild phenols dont distract my sensitive palette and the hop flavor and aroma makes this quite interesting.
Appearance light pale  yellow aroma of pine taste pine rather sweet and medium body long on the Palate

On tap at the house cafe in DeKalb . Nice one finger head, crisp clean and citrusy .about as session as you can get from 3Fs . This beer has become a high demand classic in Chicagoland .if youre thirsty and you find a place with it on tap..do partake .

Bottle thanks to joshmcg000. Hazy gold pour with a 1 finger, creamy white head that has great retention and leaves pretty decent lacing. Aroma of super fruity, citrus and pineapple heavy tropical fruit hops, dusty wheat, sweet malt and a hint of grassiness. Flavor starts off with lots of lemony citrus and tart stone fruit, then some dusty and floury wheat, a little biscuit,  and increasingly strong pineapple heavy tropical fruit, a little minerality comes in along with a lemon curd tartness and nice acidic hop bite. Light to medium body with a creamy, juicy entry, hugely blanketing moderate strength and fairly sharp carbonation and aforementioned acidic hop bite, fits the awesome fruity flavor profile extremely well. This is one of those beers that make you wonder, if hop bines produced a fruit, would the juice of that fruit be this good?

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2015 Slightly hazy, yellow with white head. Dusty earthy hop flavor, light citrus flavor and aroma, lemon finish. Crisp sweet, hops cut through and make it refreshing. One of the better wheat ales Ive had. Astringent finish
Smak och doft av citrus, persika, aprikos med toner av citron och jäst. Torr, jämn och fin APA. Frisk, fruktig med lagom sötma och trevlig beska med citrus- och grästoner.
Pint at Chumleys. Clear golden, thin white head. Beautiful juicy fruity hops, nice peppery character, grassy, straw, wheat, nice stuff.

Bottle. Pours clear golden butterscotch with a small creamy white head that dissipates with nice lacing. Aroma is faint wheat, grass. Flavor is light citrus, wheat, bit of lemon zest. Light sweet, light bitter. Light bodied, prickly carbonation. Very refreshing. Like a wheat pale ale.
Yellow, some cloud, no head. Fruity aroma, yeasty and almost citrusy finish. Good summerbrew, but maybe 3F´s rep is overpowering the actual beer.

Flaska från Mikkeller and friends. Kylskåpskall. Mörkt gyllenfärgad, klar, lågt smutsvitt skum som lägger som ett lock. Fruktig doft av citronzest, mandarin, aprikoser, persika och jäst. Lätt kropp, fruktig sötma, stora citrussmaker, aprikoser, torrare avslutning, lätt gräsig citrusbeska, viss jästsmak och maltiga sädsmker. Fantastiskt gott.

A-straw, subtle pepper, and lemon. A- hazy yellow, head disappears quickly. T-lemon zest, grassy malt, grapefruit flavor and bitterness. P- velvet grain malt that moves to spicy, dry bitterness at the end of the swallow. Very enjoyable and dynamic for a wheat beer. Delicious.

Pours a hazy yellow with an off-white head. Nose is peach, grapefruit, resin, grass. Taste is peach, orange zest, lime, grapefruit, wheat.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy pale amber with medium white head. Aroma of wheat, earth, hay, honey, grapefruit, grass. Taste is sweet with a light zesty bitter and sour. Lingering light bitter finish. Body is light and refreshing with about average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled at DLD 2013.  It poured a clear golden color with a white head. The aroma was of light bitter hops, honey-like sweetness and a clean malt backbone. The taste was of clean hop bitterness, honey sweetness and wheat with a very clean mouthfeel. Decent.

On tap at Florentine in Chicago.  This is a really cool beer; very different from run of the mill wheat offerings.  Tasting this blind I would have thought this was a rye beer.  Aroma is incredible - floral hops and sweet fruit.  Taste has same characteristics along with lemony notes; once again -  thought I tasted rye malts in here.  Kinda reminds me of Founders Rye P.A.  Unique beer that I recommend you try if you get the chance.
Pours golden with a frothy head.  Very mild, as expected, but have never had a wheat beer like this. So smooth and pleasant. Three Floyds is amazing!

Bottle courtesy of olr1984, thank you kind sir! Pours a very nice dark gold with a massive, fluffy white head. Aromas of sweet lemon, orange and lime and a slight sugary note. Tastes great, lemon zest, orange peel and maybe some tangerine followed by light malt sweetness and a clean feeling really like chewing on citrus peels. Mouthfeel is nearly perfect just a tad heavy for a light ABV wheat beer but pretty darn close. Overall, this is an amazing beer for this style (which I am not a big fan of). The only other wheat beer that I really enjoy is CCB Florida Cracker and this is a close second. I thoroughly love sipping on this beer and wish I had more of it on hand.

Pours orange with low white head. Quite lively carbonation
Hoppy aromas from the amarillo with pine tree and citrusy fruits
Fresh, nice, clean, well balanced. Just the perfect amount of bitterness combined with a low to medium body makes this a very pleasant wheat ale.

Pours a cloudy orange with a large creamy white head that has good head retention and leaves a nice amount of lacing. Aroma of pine, citrus, grapefruit, and fresh cut hops. Definitely more of an IPA nose than a wheat. Taste is a, great mix of malts and citrusy pine hops. Not like any other wheat ale out there, much more flavor! Very crisp and fresh. Long finish with malts and citrus aftertaste. Medium body, smooth texture, rather high carbonation. Overall heads above any other wheat ale out there!

Bottle. Pours a see through golden with nice head and lacing. Aroma of grapefruit and taste like no other wheat beer I've had. Generous hops and wonderful balance and finish!

----Hophaze out

Bottle, thanx Gisle. Almost clear golden with a frothy, quickly diminishing head. Lovely sweet fruity hoppy nose. Light toasted malted, sweet almost tropical fruity hoppy, dry medium finish. Ghee, what a thirstquencher.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Timothy OTooles. Pours golden with an inch of white foam. Nice floral hop notes on the nose. Lots of citrusy hop flavor on the tongue.  Hard to believe this one only has 28 IBUs. nice amount of bitterness to keep things clean on the finish. Really redefines the style in new and interesting ways.

Perhaps I am biased, but this wheat beer is delicious. When the liquor stores have it, I like to buy as many cases as possible. (Same goes for Zombie Dust). Grapefruit, bubblegum and a light amount of alcohol. One of the best sipping beers period.

The appearance is an amber color mixed with a small white head that fades quickly, and the aroma is slightly hoppy with some sweet malts. The taste is mildly sweet, slightly sour, and a touch bitter, which melded with the medium body, sticky texture, soft carbonation, and slightly astringent finish, which makes for perhaps the most interesting wheat beer out there.

Appearance is mostly yellow with a medium-bubbled head that steadily shrinks but covers the surface. Excellent lacing.

Scent rocks. Such a tropical aroma, wonderfully accentuated by light green budding flowers.  Exciting scent that I cant say Ive encountered elsewhere.

Taste is also pretty unique; wonderful would be an understatement. Not generally a fan of wheat beers because of the sweetness and the unencumbered esters. There is practically nothing about the flavor of this beer that bothers me, which surprises me with a wheat.  Crisp and even lemony!

Mouthfeel is very mellow without abandoning any desired presence. Doesnt leave any lingering cotton on the sides of the tongue that less refined wheat beers seem to do. (I realize many wheat beer fans might not want the style so clean - but I personally prefer this approach.)

In the interest of legitimating this review, I just tried Zombie Dust and found it slightly overrated (though certainly very good); this, on the other than, deserves the attention it gets. Anyway, believe the hype.
Bottle, pours a clear golden with white head.  Aroma of citrus hops.  Taste is hoppy, some lemon with light citrus and floral notes.  Overall a very tasty, easy to drink lighter brew.

Bottle at home. Pour is hazy copper with one-finger white head and great lacing. Big hoppy, piney aroma - earthy hops, caramel, bread, grapefruit peel, and orange. Taste is wheaty, caramelly, bready, piney, weedy, grapefruit, fruit peel, dirty, and earthy with a big bitter finish. Medium body with high carboantion. Not bad, but really just a hop bomb, not a wheat ale at all.
Bottle. Hazy light gold, decent head.  Light but hoppy , not too bitter, wheat is mild.  Different but enjoyable.

Amazingly hoppy aroma with grapefruit, lemon grass, and the hop resin left in a homebrew.  Pours hazy and heady.  Taste is light but very hoppy.  Great notes of grapefruit, lime zest and slight skunk.  Very easy to kick back.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2013 Pours a crystal clear, very light golden color with a quickly dissipating white head. The bouquet is characterized by a clean grapefruit perfume and lemon hard candy. Theyve changed the recipe since last I had it. And not for the better. The mouthfeel is still slick and moist, but the lovely Amarillo hops are quickly overcome by a peat flavor. Its not unpleasant, but to a man who spent a lot of time hunched over pints of Gumballhead in the recent past, disappointing.
On tap at Local Option, Chicago. A unique wheat ale - I guess you can turn anything into an IPA if you want to. Hoppy bitter, citrus. Tasty stuff.
12oz bottle. Pours a golden yellow color with a good bit of white head. Aroma of hops, citrus, and wheat. Taste was similar to the nose but hoppier then a traditional wheat beer. Overall great beer.

Bottle. Clear yellow with a thick bubbly white head. Perfumy aroma, hay, grass, wheat, dusty malt, lemon, flowery, blomstereng, sommer og blomster. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Light/medium body, watery/oily texture, medium carbonation. Crisp finish with lingering citrus and flowery notes. Excellent beer for the summer.

Appearance: A pale, yellow color ... just about what youd expect from a wheat ale. Theres a pretty decent bubbly head on it, and patchy, slightly above average lacing. The label is probably my favorite on any beer that Ive ever had.

Smell: Just an awesome nose on this one. You get some wheat characteristics, but there are plenty of hops of the grapefruit variety.

Taste/feel: Its likely just because of the name, and I know Im drinking it, but I honestly feel like I get some bubblegum flavors out of this beer -- theres a lot of fruity hops at the front of the tongue, and then the wheat comes through on the finish. Maybe that bubblegum flavor is just the peach coming through, but I can pretend what I want! Anyway, just an awesomely refreshing beer without much bitterness. Any state that gets this beer shipped to them should consider themselves extremely lucky, as this would make for an ideal session beer... Id drink it just about daily in the summer.

Very floral and tropical like an IPA but light and sweet on the finish. Another easy to drink session able beer on par with Alpha King and Zombie Dust. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @ home It pours clear golden with a medium white head.... The aroma is fresh hops, grass, peaches and flowers..... The flavor is fresh hops, peaches, citrus and some flower flavors.......

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2014 Pours a clear light golden yellow with a big fluffy white head and excellent lacing.  Light aroma of citrus, mild mango and some pine from the hops, with a hint of malt and wheat.  Taste has citrus hop flavor that hints at tropical, some pine and pale malt and wheat.  Medium mouthfeel with medium/high carbonation.  Liked this beer much more than the first time I had it in 2013.  Still sort of straight forward and simple but seemed more flavorful this time. 

---Jeremy H

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2014 2013 bottle to snifter.  Pours a very clear yellow/orange with good carbonation.  Aroma is grassy hops, citrus and sweet malt.  Taste is tea leaves, hops and a sweet malt.  Slight bitterness at the end.  Thin mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2014 bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy bright golden color with a big foamy white head.  Aroma is lots of pine with citrus and yeast.  The taste is grainy with a nice yeasty undertone.  A little orange and other citrus comes through and finishes with a big pine bitterness at the end that stays with you.  Medium and slightly dry mouthfeel.
Has easily been my favorite wheat, if not my favorite beer for years. Typically, I lean toward IPAs but gumballs crisp, refreshing taste keeps me coming back. Just wish more stores would carry it.

Shared at Hunaphu Day. Hazy golden pour with a frothy white head. Grainy bread, juicy citrus hops with pine. Citrus flavor, grainy wheat, hints of yeast and bread. Light refreshing hoppy wheat beer. Pretty tasty.

A golden color with a slight haze, generous white head. Floral, citrus, wheat scent. A nice light carbonation, a wheat hop bitter with some caramel malt, rye, grapefruit. Good for a wheat beer, definitely the most complex I've had. Good beer to have some pizza with.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Yellow, white head. Nose is fruity hops, juicy fruit, wheat. Taste is juicy fruit, citrus fruits, light grains. Nice crisp hoppy finish.

From bottle. I've had many of these over the years; one of the perks of living in Chicago. To sum-up my opinion in this...looks like a pale ale but with more phone. It's a lite weight wheat beer. Not much cloudiness or thickness, but does retain the citrusy sweetness and some spiciness of a model wheat beer plus it has just enough hop fire and bitterness to give it an edge. Very drinkable; if it were not for the alcohol content; I'd drink a whole six pack on my own. Smelling this is reminiscent of opening a bag of gumballs, though not in a sick way. Love this beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
hazzy orange color, aroma of citrus fruits, wheat, bread, same flavors, slight spices, bubblegum, very hopy for the style and very enjoyable

Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a finger or two of sticky foam. The nose has a nice fresh hops on the front end with a nice grainy dose of cereal malt and a touch of earthy spice. Lemon, shredded wheat... Yum the palate follows suit and is light refreshing and thirst quenching. Great balance and very focused flavors.

On tap MAH. - Lemony yellow with a brief white head. Aroma of grapefruit and peach with floral notes. Does something unusual on the tongue - does a sort of backflip, starting with a quick initial resin-citrus profile, then almost vanishes before its replaced by a more floral-citrus then fades into a clean lingering hop finish. Moderate body, refreshing. Overall very entertaining.
Wheaty, hoppy, and crisp lemony finish.  A wonderful brew to say the least.

Probably the best wheat style beer Ive ever had. Not my favorite style of brew, so thats being as generous as I can allow. Pours a light amber color. Lemon and fresh grass on the nose. Pours with slight white head that diminishes to edges. Cloudy, delicious and crisp.

Poured with vigor into a pint glass. Ton of head that formed large bubbles. Reduces slowly. Pale yellow-orange color. Hoppy citrus aroma. Fairly clear for having yeast for bottle conditioning. Slight metallic taste from the hops. Interestingly hoppy wheat beer. Very clean, not too bitter. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured on tap into a pint glass. Had a clean white head that dissipated pretty quick. Color is a cloudy yellow. The smell is hoppy with bubble gum. The aroma makes my mouth water. The taste is that of wheat and some bubble gum. Clean and crisp to drink with a medium body.

Pours clear golden yellow with a medium white head. Smells juicy and has a touch of bubblegum. Taste is at first bitter with a sweetness that is similar to grain malt and bubblegum. Medium-bodied with a crisp, prickly texture that moves slick and mildly fizzy mouth-carbonation, Three Floyds Gumballhead finishes with a solid hop bite.

Pours a clear golden color with a finger white head and is a bit lively.  Has aromas of bananas, bread, and a bit of resin.  Has a light sweetness balanced by a light bitterness that lingers.  Real light bodied, and slides down the throat quite easily.  This beer doesnt quite follow normal guidelines for a wheat ale, but what do you expect from FFF.  This beer is decent, but I wont go looking for this beer like a lot of folks do.
UPDATED: OCT 31, 2014 Aroma is pine/grapefruit, yeast, citrus and wheat.  The flavor is slightly funky yeast, fruit, citrus/fresh peach, a background of wheat and a very tangy/mildly bitter finish.

A semi fizzy light yellow beer with a minimal head.  The aroma is soft, but I pick up notes of mild gasoline and mild grapefruit and of course, wheat.  Thats what happens when you brew a 100% Amarillo beer.  Dont worry, the artwork and prejudiced reputation of the brewer makes up for it, right?  Not really.  The flavor is better than the aroma with notes of grapefruit, lemon and wheat, but isnt anything special.  Overall, this beer is OK for an American wheat beer, but is far worse the the ratings suggest.  The automatic hard on you have for 3F beers needed a dose of reality and this is it : )

I had heard a lot of hype surrounding gumballhead so I had to give it a try. While it is not a bad beer all the hype did not live up to my tasting. It has a very hoppy smell almost to the point of an IPA and pours a golden yellow color. The taste is smooth and mellow but doesnt have a whole lot of body and girth to it. On the plus side it is has no bad after taste. Worth a try to form your own opinion about it.
Crisp, clean mouth feel with well balanced hop finish. Light lace on glass with some lasting head.  Satisfaction in a glass.
Trade from queenholly and first 3floyds! pours a hazed gold, with thin soapy head...smells of fruits, citrus taste is carb goodness with sweet fruits and hint of a wheat great beer!

Aroma of wheat and hops with active pour, balanced taste and growing mouthfeel.

Dark yellow, some carbonation. Minimal soapy head. Aroma of citrus hops. Flavor of smooth citrus hops. Medium body. Smooth and refreshing. Extremely drinkable.
A light fruit, maybe floral scent.  Very nice.  I can taste the lemon, but doesnt really seem citrus-y.  Delightful brew.

One of my staple beers.  Excellent fruity wheat beer that goes down smooth any time of year.  Has a nice bite of hops to round it out 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smells awesome and tastes of citrus, wheat, and lots of hops! Balanced taste and enjoyable for any occasion.
This Beer has a Great aroma, very citrusy and floral.  Easy drinking finish with a light body.  Has hints of wheat and tons of hops.  Blonde color with white head. Great quaffer for the afternoon!

Reviewed 10/30/2012. Thanks to Momar42 for the bottle, and double thanks for providing me with my first Three Floyds beer!! About 6 oz poured into a pint glass.

A: Pours a golden yellow color with nice clarity - something Im not used to in wheat ales. The head is a one finger eggshell shade with some nice lacing down the glass.

S: Fairly tropical, with that distinctive Amarillo hop aroma. Tea leaves, mango, papaya, and grapefruit all come across, but perhaps not quite as vividly as I hoped. Still, it smells like it will be up my alley...

T: Much like the aroma, its hoppy; but with the focus on tropical fruits, rather than pine/herbal notes. Its very citrusy to start (like I expect out of a good IPA), but the wheat that comes through in the mid-taste smooths things out like a baws. What catches me off guard is the subtle complexity featured, transitioning from slightly sweet to slightly bitter in different stages (and this isnt even a full bottle!) Not quite as drinkable as expected, but surprisingly joyous to savor.

M: Slightly heavy in its texture, which is my only real beef here. Its dry, crisp, and drinkable, which is what I want out of my hoppy beers, with the strong carbonation I expect out of a wheat beer.

O: I normally dont like plain wheat ales, unless theyre hoppy. This fits said criteria nicely, so its plain to see that I enjoy this a whole lot. This was my first from FFF, and needless to say, it lived up to the hype for me. I would drink the shit out of this in hot weather - if only I didnt live in Maryland...

12oz Bottle A - Pours golden, slightly hazey, white head dissipates quickly, lots of bubbles S - Floral citrus hops, bit of wheat malt T - Malted wheat gives good backbone, bitter overtones thourgh out, resin, lemon zest, & orange peel. Yummy! M - Light bodied nice tangy carbonation, lingering resin finish O - Love the Hoppy Wheat style. This one is a CLASSIC!

pours out a hazy orange-yellow with a fluffy white head. citrus hops and some sweetness from the wheat are the main aromas. a very clean beer, a great balance of crispness and light but potent hop flavors!

Straw colored. little head, mild lacing, minimal haze after cold haze was gone. poured from 12 oz bottle, citrus sweet aroma from hops. Wheat taste lingers with citrus. American wheat ale, fairly unfamiliar with style. Very good. Hard to find but lucky my brother lives in Chicago. Hope to taste more 3floyds.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2013 Pours slightly hazy gold with lots of carbonation and a white head. Aroma is very nice, tons of citrus, tropical fruit. Bitter pine and tropical fruit hop flavor up front. Gives way to lots of lemon / grapefruit with a nice wheat backbone.Very fresh, really awesome. One of the greatest session beers I have had.

Bottle. Very crisp, clear light golden color with bubbly head. Aroma of alfalfa, light pine, and earthy hops. Quite bitter on the taste with a hint of wheat and a lemony finish. Very carbonated. Good, but I think this bottle is past its prime.

Bottle to pint glass. Pours dark yellow with moderate head. Aroma is spicy, grass, and bread. Taste is small bitter up front, spice, citrus, and long malt finish with some bitterness. Mouthfeel is moderate and lower carbonation.
Pours a hazy straw color with a small white head. Aromas of hops and citrus, particularly lemon. Refreshing, crisp taste with a clean grapefruit finish.

Bottle.  Its an almost transparent straw colour.  Lots of bubbles.  Tall, permanent head.  Its very aromatic.  You could smell the tropical and citrus fruits from a distance.  Guava, honeydew melon, starfruit, pineapple.  A bit of a chewy mouthfeel.  Wheat as an ingredient is barely apparent until tasting it.  The taste is crisp with plenty of American hops; its moderately bitter with wheat and bready malt mildly insisting their way through.  Flavour has plenty of citrus zest, some avocado, honeydew and mango.  Finish is reasonably long with lots of citrus in the hops.  Thank you Kevin for the bottle!
FLAMEEE!!!!  love this beer.  it is expensive, but its worth it.  buy it everytime i see it at the bar/liquor store
Very fresh taste and smell.  Smell is citrus and a little hoppy.  Tastes a little sweet, mixes well with the wheat , and citrus flavors.  Pretty refreshing, wish it was a little easier to find!

Citrus, mild apricot, and mild malt.  Golden with white head and mild lacing.  Citrus, mild apricot, full bodied, and medium bitterness.  Refreshing, balanced, tongue zinger and dry finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 ounce bottle into pint glass; no bottle dating, but was purchased recently.  Pours lightly hazy golden amber color with a nice 2 finger fairly dense white head with excellent retention, that reduces to a nice cap that reduces to a nice cap that lasts.  Spotty foamy lacing clings to the glass, with some good streaming carbonation.  Aromas of pineapple, grapefruit, lemon zest, orange zest, floral, pine, herbal, grass, and wheat.  Damn nice aromas with good strength and hop/malt balance and complexity.  Taste of pineapple, grapefruit, orange zest, lemon zest, floral, grass, pine, wheat, and herbal spiciness.  Fair amount of floral bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of pineapple, citrus zest, floral, grass, pine, wheat, and herbal spiciness on the finish for a good bit.  Very nice amount of hop flavor and good complexity and balance; zero cloying flavors on the finish.  Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth and crisp mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with zero warming on the finish.  Overall this is an excellent pale wheat beer.  Very nice hop flavor with good balance and complexity; extremely smooth and easy to drink.  A highly enjoyable sessionable offering for sure.

Kinda clear light orange color with a nice white fluffy head that disappears pretty quick leaving some nice lacing. Aroma is very hop forward with nice citrusy characteristics such as orange and grapfruit. Maybe some pear in there. Taste is nice and hoppy, grapefruit. Also get some grassy malts in there. Like tasting the smell of walking on a field of barley. Plays well with some grassy hops. All in all a good solid beer! Cheers!
pours light orange.  Nice citrusy aroma from the amarillo hops.  The taste is a nice light citrus hop flavor.  Clean finish. This is very refreshing and my go to session beer... when I can find it.

Tap @ PP Carlsbad.  Clear golden pour with a froth of white foam.  Aroma is light bitter hops, honey-like sweetness, and a clean malt backbone.  Taste is clean hop bitterness, honey sweetness, and wheat.  Clean mouthfeel.  Drinks more like an american pale ale than a wheat beer but its plenty tasty.  Nice beer.

Pours a crips, clear light orange with a small white head. Beautiful aromas of citrus, Cholas, vatos. So Mexican. Very crisp. Very drunk. Hoppy, god I love those Mexican babes.  A close 2nd to the eurotrash sluts. This beer is good.

Can't believe this one's a wheat! Big lemony, hop burst of flavor. Amazing malt profile.

Poured a hazy golden color. Aroma is wonderful: fruit, hops, grapefruit, citrus, maybe berries. Taste is slightly bitter, floral and grapefruit notes. Finish is smooth. This is a really good beer; I think my favorite in this category! Revised, 5/18/13 This is still a good beer, but not at good as the first time. A bit more bitter/hoppy than I remember. Yellow golden. Kinda bright. White head. Danky smell. Light body. Hazy. Light spritzy malt flavor. Just sessionable.
From a bottle shared at home.  Pours a cloudy pale gold with a white head.  Hops dominate the nose.  Flavors of strawberry, citrus and bread.  Refreshing bitter finish.

One of the best tastiest lite beers I've had! Not a bad beer but hard to find

Picked up from 3 Floyds brewpub Cary out. The aroma of every fruit imaginable. Light gold in color with a heavy white head. Taste amazing. Over all perfect beer.

355ml bottle, clean golden color, with a fluffy bubbly white head, nice yeasty, floral fruity pear, litchee, pineapple, orange peel, cedary hoppy nose, with some piney, leafy, grassy accents, with a faint toasted, wheat, pale malt note, within an orange marmalade aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty, flowery fruity pear, litchee, peach, tangerine, lemon, orange peel, piney, minty hopped charecter, with a light grainy wheat, pale, toasty honeyish malt undertone, leading towards a faint grainy honeyed wheat, pale toasty maltiness, fruity citrus lemon, grapefruit  peel, cedary hop bittering finish.

355ml bottle. Clear copper shade with a fast-diminishing white head. Aroma is rich in piney, floral hops just as Id hoped. Mildly bitter, resinous hops are the first thing picked up by my tongue, calling to mind an IPA, but then the taste of wheat grain underneath reminds me what Im dealing with. It all comes together well, but I just felt it was lacking the bite and character I was hoping for. Maybe I expected too much from a Three Floyds brew, but drinking a beer like this makes you realise why these guys have such a good reputation for quality.
Slight citrus and wheat aroma. Light golden color. Taste has hints of floral, hops, and citrus.

On tap at Brew Pub.  Pours a clear golden amber color with a big fluffy white head and long retention. Smell is a mixture of piney citrus hops and wheaty, along with a dash of peppery spice.  Taste is hopped up, spicy wheat beer!  Hops hit first and are followed with a spicy, peppery middle, and finishes with a bit of pine sap and bready wheatness that leaves a slightly bitter aftertaste. Mouthfeel is nice and smooth with moderate carbonation.
