Took me a while to appreciate this beer being a wheat, but is now my absolute favorite.  Its hoppy, but not so much Id consider bitter.  Smooth and easy to drink.  Something mouth tingling or numbing that makes me crave this beer and always have it in my fridge.
Sweet and floral scent. Bitter and somewhat sweet taste with a bubbly finish.

Poured from 12oz. bottle into pint glass

A: Pours a deep yellow with a nice white white head, 1 finger. Dissipates quickly leaving a little lace. Little sediment floating around the glass.

S: What a smell! A grassy, fruity smell hits the nose instantly with some sweet hops as well on the backend.

T: Slight fruit taste with some good bitter hops through out, leaving a sweet taste on the tongue.

M: Very light body with a good carbonation. Goes down just as good as a light macro brew beer.

O: Great light pale ale with an amazingly smooth finish. I wish this was more readily available! Thank god for the six packs.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-13-2011
UPDATED: JAN 14, 2013 worth the hype!  floral, lemony citrus-hop aromas and flavors running all over the place.  Fresh, slightly sweet wheat malt finish.  Worth the hype!

First off this is one of the best beers i have ever had   pours slightly hazy dark gold   aroma is clearly simcoe hops (hope i am not wrong about that) light citrusy floral aroma    taste is citrus followed by cantaloupe and melon notes   body of the beer is perfect for a wheat   words cant describe this one   excellent
Very tasty adult bevy. One of the best Ive had from Three Floyds. Even though I love all their beers
Why do I love this beer?  I love it because its a fantastic example of a style I normally dont like yet its innovative and delicious.

Been saving a bottle, perhaps to enjoy with the trickling of the rain and the reading of a book on my back patio. Pours an astonishing amber-pigmenged golden copper, frothed head one-to-two fingers in length. Carbonation is nice. Tastes and smells of spicy yeast, citrus/citrus hops, grapefruit zest, wheat bread, thyme and flowers. Ends bittersweet and amazingly pillowy. A winner in my book; same as the comic.

Bue à partir dune petite bouteille que mon cher ami Patrick a bien voulu partager avec moi. Boire une bière de Three Floyds est toujours une expérience sensoriel. La Gumballhead ne fait pas défaut à cette tradition de bière poussée à la limite. Ici cest une bière jaune dorée translucide, elle nest pas trouble. Le nez est presque tout en agrumes, le houblon domine malgré une trace de blé discret. La bouche est amère, le corps est moyen, il y a du bonbon, de la gomme balloune et des sardines, oui des sardines. Elle est facile à boire, pique la bouche et en moins de deux la bouteille est vide. 7+/10
A nice wheat beer, though a bit too hoppy for my taste in wheat ales.  Lemon, orange, and wheat in the aroma and a flavor pretty decently balanced between the hops and wheat.

Une bière dorée qui ne semble pas être très voilée.  Un anneau comme simple représentation mousseuse.  Un nez déconcertant de houblons fruités qui font vibrer des céréales mielleuses et des notes de blé aux contours citronnés.  Suis-je vraiment sur le territoire de la bière de blé américaine ou de la IPA?  Peu importe.  Je suis devant une 3F et cela paraît.  Des saveurs qui sont pleines de fraîcheur et délicatesse.  Des céréales mordantes et des houblons qui stimulent la langue.  Un murmure sucré et des palpitations fruitées.  Une bouche qui présente un corps de moyenne dimension avec une généreuse infiltration de bulles et une texture huileuse.  Une finale chargée de notes amères et de notes citronnées.  Merci Steve!

Golden pour with a frothy white head.  Aroma of light citrus fruit, lemon zest, whest, slightly spicy.  Taste:  Hoppy, lighter citrus fruit, Wheat, Lemon, Slight ginger spiciness, very slight yeast, peach.  Lighter mouthfeel, good carbonation.  As easy drinking as water.

Uploading from Beer Buddy App. Notes from memory. Very nice wheat beer. Crisp and refreshing. Has a nice full body you don't typically find in a lot of wheat beers. Well done beer in a style I don't love. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

6-pack from brewery.  Pours golden and clear.  This is a wheat ale?  Terrific citrusy aroma.  This is a wheat ale?  Starts off like a wonderfully fruity, balanced, hoppy IPA, and finishes with a distinctly wheat taste.  A unique and delicious combination.  A moderate grapefruit bitterness creeps up on you over time, without ever overpowering.  Medium-bodied with good carbonation.  Basically another American Pale Ale from the masters of APAs.

Nice golden color with a cloudy body. Great foamy suds. Sweet hoppy aroma. Smooth and weighty on the palate. Subtle hops in the taste. I really enjoy this one. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPod Touch

Pours a golden yellow with a foamy white head.  Ok retention with good lacing.  Smells of lemon, hops, and a hint of grass.  Taste is lemon, ginger, slight hops.  Balanced very well.  This is a top notch wheat ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Bottles 101. Pours a straw yellow color with a thin white head. Aroma of lemon zest and a hint of bubble gum. Tastes of fresh lemon with a nice hop bitterness on the finish. An interesting take on a wheat beer. Every sip had me quenching another sip. These guys always impress and this is another fine example. I'm not a big wheat beer but I would visit this again!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: APR 16, 2015 Wheat smell, wheat taste, & a wheat after taste. The hops are a nice additive that give this beverage some character. Three Floyd?s made a descent hoppy wheat beer.

On tap at Brickhouse in Madison, WI over the weekend.  Poured a clear golden with minimal white head.  I was surprised to see that Ive never had this before (or if I have, Id never rated it).  Very smooth and crisp, easy to drink, kinda sweet.  Nothing wild. Very well made.
Draft at brewpub 26/07/11. Pours clear straw yellow with big resilient white head. Citrus, wheat and bubblegum - a refreshing very tasty quaffer!

Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a Three Floyds branded pint glass.

Pours a light straw-like gold. Pine and citrus rind on the nose. Opens with hops just like the nose citrus rind and pine but certainly not overpowering. A touch of sweet malt joins and makes its presence know, but not in a way that would weigh down this brew. Finishes light, fairly dry and crisp with a pleasant hop bite. Overall very light bodied, but the malt backbone certainly is detectable but not overly so, slick mouthfeel. This is a perfect session beer, especially in the summer.
Bottle, direct from brewer thanks to Todd. A light golden yellow complexion with minimal head. Very hoppy wheat ale with citrus flavors. Nice palate. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours  hazy light gold with white head from the bottle.  Aroma is incredible for a hop lover with strong floral and citrus aromas.  Taste starts with a very slight bitter and evolves into a smooth hoppy wheat beer ending with grapefruit.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2013 Yes, this is an ale made with wheat, but it unlike any other wheat ale.  It is a hopped up ale.  It has an orange citrius flavor and more hop bitterness than than the majority or IPA and even some doubles.  But it has a nice smooth finish typical of a wheat beer.

Bumping this up a tick or two.  Damn good stuff.  Might be the best year round $10 six pack

355ml Bottle (Thanks Nisse666) - Hazy amber/gold with a foamy white head. Wheat, yeast, banana, spice, toffee and peach in the aroma. Hoppy and fruity taste with notes of banana, grapefruit, peach, pineapple, yeast and spice. Really nice and enjoyable. Especially refreshing on a summers day such as today.
This is clearly on of the best wheat ales out there. In fact, this is the only one I like!

Draught at Mikkeller bar, Copenhagen. Slightly hazy golden color. Citrusy and clovey aroma. Taste of citrus, clove, pepper and herbal orange. Tingling spicy mouthfeel. American hops and Belgian spiciness, it is a bit controversial combination.

cant  believe I havent rated this yet.  wonderful citrusy aroma. hazy golden pour. taste is lightly sweet but hops is there.  citrus wafts through the nose at every drink.  perfect mouthfeel with lively carbonation and fairly dry finish.  overall, its very IPA like with solid wheat character.  could drink this all night...and I probably will.

Growler from the brewery. Nice golden colour with a thick white head. Aroma was sweet, slight banana, and some dough. Flavour was very nice, a bit more hoppy than expected, and it seemed stronger in alcohol than it is.

Bottle (12 oz.). Thanks to Preismj! Pale golden with a medium mostly diminishing white head but theres still a small white lasting head and some lacing. Aroma of peach and a lot of other fruits and a slight malt presence. Taste of fruits (mostly peach) and malt with a slight dry bitter finish. Lively carbonation. Can draw comparisons with good IPAs. A good tasty and refreshing beer.

A: Gumball head is an absolutely crystal clear golden hue with massive amounts of bubbles emanating from the depths of the glass in rapid ascension. There is an average sized white head that fades after a few moments, leaving a nice trail of lacing in its wake.

S: Fresh, delicious hops and wheat. This beer is really fresh, and smells like it. Very enticing.

T: If you like wheat beers and IPAs, this is a match made in heaven. This beer is very refreshing and tastes fantastic. The wheat / hop balance is perfect. There is more of a hop presence here than in most pale ales, which I find to be delightful. The wheat aspect adds that "not normal" feel to what basically tastes like a single IPA.

M: Very smooth with a nice hop bitterness in the finish. Clean and fresh.

D: Chuggable. Highly recommended.
UPDATED: JUN 18, 2013 Damn good hoppy wheat beer.  The flavor alone is fantastic.  Restrained grain backbone with plenty of hop flavor.

After all the hubbaloo about aquiring this (stores onlt get one case and are sold out and only ration 1 sixpack per person), I was expecting more. Aroma was not as esetry as many whaet beers, but good. Very slight haziness to the golden color, tick white head., Very carbonated and fizzy.  More hoppiness than any whaet beer I have had. Flavor was juicy , citrus, some hay, a touch of baked bread and a fair about of hops throughout. Medium light mouthfeel, dry finish. Decent but not worth being rationed, I was expecting a belgian style wheat and got hoppy americanized beer. Would like to try on tap, they say that yeast is added after fermentation to the bottle, but didnt seem very yeasty, or sweet.
One of my first beers from Three Floyds. Has a pleasant aroma and a beautiful color. Has an outstanding taste that starts hippy and ends with a sweet wheat taste.

This beer was my first introduction to Three Floyds. On tap in Munster at the brewpub. Color is a clear quite carbonated gold topped off with a white head that cleats out quick. Starts with a bitter hoppy taste fading into a nice wheat flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

27th June 2010Hazy gold beer. Good white head. Sweet honey - orange nose. Crispy palate, slightly dry. Light creamy malt with pleasant mild fresh orange. Carbonated sting at the end and a touch of hop grass. Crisp, fresh and refreshing. Great summer beer.
Pale golden with good lacing. Grassy, grapefruits, yeasts, malts, and wheat. Very rich, crisp and flavorful. My new favorite wheat-style beer!
Draft.  Amazing citrus aroma.  Nothing special in the appearance or taste but the after taste lingers in a not so good way.  Solid beer, but not one of three floyds' best.

Pours a dark gold color with a little bit of haze.  Fruity, Piney, and grassy on the nose, taste is very tropical fruity.  Not really my mix, but it is good nonetheless.  And with 3 Floyds, always interesting.
On tap at Brothers in South Bend. Pours a clear gold with a decent white head and aromas of herbal and citrusy hops. Flavor is hoppy up front and gives way to wheat as it goes on. Yummy.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text:
Bottle: Thanks Steve:
Medium airy but vast white head, disappear slow and leaves a thicker island on top of an almost clear yellow colored beer.
Smell is very nice: fresher hops and citrus set the tone, then there are hints of peach, abricot, wheat, light malt tones, some banana. Crispy.
Taste is also fresh hopped with citrus and peachy tones, there are some light tones of (sharper) wheat and grains, some (pretty light) bitter, a hint of marzepin and some nice crispy fruity herbs.
Aftertaste is lovetly crisp hops, with citrus, some grass and a bitterness which is stronger present than in the taste.
Low carbo, soft mouthfeel and medium to full body and a creamy texture.
Lovely hop character which easily and gently blends in. Very good beer!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Pours a carbonated golden with a nice white head.  Huge aroma of grapefruit, pine, lemon, and hops.  Actually, the hops virtually explode into your nose.  Taste remains very pleasant, but a notch below the aroma.  The strong hoppy impressions are not as abundant, but merely an undertone.  I get lots of melon actually.  Lemon remains, and is very grassy, with a grassy and lemony aftertaste that lingers for a bit.  Lighter in body but not exactly thin if that makes any sense.   A great session beer without a doubt.

Pale golden yellow pour with substantial inch tall lingering white head. Bubbles continuously rise in the shaker glass. Lemon citrus hop aroma. Bitter hop flavor upon entering the mouth. This gives way to a complex lemon taste. Finish is where the wheat flavor enters, being complimented perfectly with a bit of lemon. Outstanding beer. Like a very full bodied hefeweizen with tons of hops.
Draft at Bakerstreet Steak House. This beer has a bright citrus aroma that's crisp and refreshing.

6/1/12- Pours a light murky gold with a 1f white head. Aromas include lemony pine and a hint of spicey and fruity wheat. Light in body with sparkling carbonation that leaves behind wheat bread, bitterness, with more notes of lemon and grapefruit on a quick dry almost chalky finish. This is not your typical wheat, as it has some assertive hoppiness and almost abrasive carbonation, yet manages to be refreshing. What do you want? It is Three Floyd's and it's a standout wheat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar. Light amber gold color with a massive white head. The nose is pine, orchard fruits, rain water, strawberry and grass. The taste is tropical fruits, bouncy malty strawberry sweetness, watermelon. Grass. Lovely, light and easy to drink. A great every-day beer.

Beers like this really redefine the Wheat Ale style as this is so incredibly hoppy it is almost hard to believe that it is a wheat beer, which is a style I normally dont go for, but I love my hops and this delivers in a big way.

Fantastic beer. It is so different from any other wheat beer I have ever tasted. It has a crazy flavor after you get past the initial wheat and hop taste. The aftertaste is what makes this beer special. It has a hint of citrus and other floral notes that bring out the "Gumball" signature taste!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Pours a clear gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges and laces. Aroma has a lot of light flora and fruits with a bit of underlying grass and wheat. Flavor has a lot more grassy hops with a slight bitterness and some light fruit/flora that comes out in the finish. Very drinkable.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2013 One of my all time favorite sess beers. Clearish orange pour, decent head that fades kind of quickly. Perfect carbonation for the style, slow bubbles reaching the surface. Lacing was minimal and non sticking. Aromas are some of the jucciest bubblegum hop citrus flavors, with tangerine, resin, and other earthy tones. Drinks unbelievably refreshing, starts as an ipa but fades to a more easy going and refreshign wheat taste. Wish I had access to this stuff all year. Re-rate: tried a fresh batch from late august....pilsner tasting malt and no citrus grass earthiness anymore. Lowered .6. Hopefully it gets back to where it once belonged....get back

Up there with Zombie Dust as the best overall from 3F. . . in terms "a beer I could drink all day every day, should I ever have that luxury" type of category.

I still remember the first time I tasted Gumballhead, on tap at Twisted Spoke years ago.  Bartender had trouble describing it but kept saying it was good.  

I still cant believe the amazing balance of delicate flavors in this one.  Theres the undeniable gumball flavor, but it does not come at the expense of anything-- nothings too sweet, nothings too hoppy, and its not too strong either.

Awesome beer.  I will say its more suited toward hot weather. . . but drinking one in the winter can be grate nostalgia material.
Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Golden beer with a offwhite head. Fruity and hoppy aroma. Fruity and nice hoppy flavour. A nice hoppy beer with no bitter finish - I like that.

Draft at Mikkeller Bar.  Clear golden pour with a small white head.  Aroma is fresh hoppy with fruits, citrus and floral aspects.  Citrus, grapefruit, light caramel and flowers in the flavour.  Body is light to medium with medium carbonation.  A really awesome take on the style.
Mikkeller bar, maj 2012: Lätt, frisk, lite tunn eftersmak med något små humletoner.

Bottled. Nice soft nosewheat, citrus hop, some paint thinner. Nice and tangy flavor, with rich, thich malt, wheat, biscuits, nice sweetness. So drinkable and soft, very mellow, with a nice, soft bitterness. Could drink it all day. A beer I wish I could get by IV.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar. Pours clear golden with a small white head that quickly dissipates without leaving much trace. Smell is tiny sweet, slightly sour and hoppy with grapefruit juice, lemon zest, apricots, grass, orange peal and pine. Taste is sweet, bitter and sour with pine, orange peal, grass, crackers, green grapes, lemon zest, grapefruit juice and hints of wet soil. Mouthfeel is crisp and light bodied. Finish is bitter and tiny sour with green grapes, grapefruit juice, lemon zest and grass.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Great thirstquenshing brew, smooth mouthfeel and lots of tutti frutti hops.

12oz bottle, unknown date.  Served around 40F.  Big thanks to Jamie for bringing me a bottle of this!

Pours lightly hazy golden amber with a nice white head that retains extremely well and leaves a lot of sticky rings of lacing behind.

Aroma is quite fruity and citrusy with lemon, orange and grapefruit as well as pineapple, peaches and some banana.  Somewhat floral as well as some notes of yeast and bread.  Very good strength.

Flavor is massive on this one, a ton of pink grapefruit fruit and rind, orange and lemon, peach, some banana, candied fruit, bread and yeast.  A little sweetness and mild bitterness on the finish.  Minimal alcohol.  Very hoppy.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied, oily and sticky, good carbonation.

Beers like this really redefine the Wheat Ale style as this is so incredibly hoppy it is almost hard to believe that it is a wheat beer, which is a style I normally dont go for, but I love my hops and this delivers in a big way.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar. Rated on 11.05.2012
Aroma is fruity with american hops, some wheat and gooseberry bush. Dry and slightly watery palate. Flavour has american hops, fruits, hints of wheat. Hoppy and refreshing.

Tap @ Mikkeller bar. Pours clear light golden with a small white head. Aroma of light malt, wheat, fruit, lemon. Taste is malt, fruity hops, citrus, wheat. Thin body, lively carbonation. Very easy drinking.  110512

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen
Pours light yellow with a small white had. Aroma of fruits, wheat malts, spices, lemon and citrus. Taste is fruity with a lot of lemony and citrusy notes, wheat and slight spices. Finish is tasty with exotic fruits, hops and spices. Extremely tasty and well balanced wheat ale.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar.
Pours clear golden color with small head. Aroma of hoppy fruits, grass, mild spices and wheat. Flavour of fruits, mild herbs, dry hay and lemon notes. Very crisp and refreshing.
3525

Clear golden yellow pour thin white head sticky lacing .... Aroma of funky floral hops, light wheat, citrusy, light lemons rindy .... taste is rindy with floral hops nice bitter lively spicy bite, citrus rinds, lemony, peaches and wheat, caramel malts light biscuit malts sugary ... Lingering bitter bite. .... Not bad oily mouthfeel. ... Thanks shueyy for sharing
Clear yellow golden beer big white head. Creamy hoppy nose lemon and oranges. Light smooth taste, slight bitterness, lots of carbonation. Good drinkability, tasty.

Seems odd that Ive never bothered to rate this one after all these years, so here we go: Like most things by 3Fs, the hops make this one stand out amongst its peers -- particularly given that most Wheat Ales usually arent that hoppy.  Florally nose, pours a nice pale golden with a slight head. Mouth is light bodied, but not too light. Lots of grapefruit and florally hops, hint of cereal with a minimal bittering finish. Has been one of my favorites from these guys and will likely always be.

Originally reviewed: 1/19/10. Poured into a weizen glass. Pours a very clear pale yellow. I expected a bit more color to this. Capped off with a frothy white head on top. Great retention; left some sticky lace. I just dont like the color that much. Scents of strong pine right away. I can smell this across the room. Some citrus notes, flowers, and pond water. Seriously. This reminds me of a pond at a golf course. Spot on. Not sure thats a good thing. 

Good crisp body to this. Finishes with a soft mellow smoothness. Flavor is hoppy at the onset. Some grapefruit notes, and pine. Not too bitter though. Finishes bready and warm. Theres the wheat! Without that finish I would swear this is a mild IPA. Three Floyds has a nice take on this style. I could drink this all the time if I had better access. Recommend.

Draft to pint. Looks decent; like a wheat beer. Smells good; Nike a nicely-hopped wheat. Tastes solid; easy to drink. Mouthfeel is good too. Tasty stuff, but not as good as I remembered it being when I had it at FFF brewery.

On tap at the Atomic Koi in Madison.  Pours yellow with a moderate layer of white head that stays throughout.  Extremely clear.  Okay lacing that stays for a while.  Very citrusy aroma...grapefruit in the aroma and prominent in the flavor.  Not getting a lot of malt, but overall this is a great beer.

Pours a hazy gold with a foamy white head.  
Fruity aroma with wheat notes.  Grapefruit, orange.
Sweet taste. 
Bitter palate, smooth, sticky.

A - Pours a slightly hazy golden-orange color with a finger of frothy white head. The head fades down at a normal pace leaving behind some nice lacing.

S - Aroma is citrus hops and tropical fruits including grapefruit, mango, pineapple, orange, and lemon zest. There is a bit of wheat as well and a touch of spice.

T - Starts off with a mix of lemon zest, citrus hops, grapefruit and mango, and a bit of bitterness. Through the middle, a bit of pine comes through with a bit more bitterness and some wheat. The finish is a mix of wheat, lemon zest, citrus and tropical fruits, mild bitterness, and a bit of spicy hop flavor.

M - Medium-light bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth with a dry and bitter finish.

D - Super drinkable. Really nice hoppy wheat ale. Super sessionable but also full of flavor and very tasty.

Fresh bottle poured aggressively in a duvel tulip. Clean golden yellow with a 2 inch white head that shrinks to a half inch with awesome lacing. Aroma is Amarillo hops, grapefruit, flowers, caramel, and bread. Flavor is  orange, grapefruit, biscuit, lemon. Very smooth with a light and somewhat sticky mouthfeel. I dont drink many wheat beers and this is awesome. I buy it when I can.

Thanks to Beersis on beeradvocate for the trade, amazing trade partner. 

Pours a light amber color with a finger or so of head. Smell is slightly sweet and hoppy at the same time, zesty. Taste is crisp, refreshing, a bit tart and citrusy on the finish. Great balanced beer and very very drinkable. Good job FFF.
Draft. Hazy golden yellow, wispy white head, some lacing. Sweet aroma, some wheat. Dry, grapefruit, some maltiness.

I received a 12oz bottle in trade with a friend (thanks, Joe!). I poured it into a wheat beer glass.

Appearance: Banana skin-yellow hue, almost glowing. Surprisingly clear for a bottle-conditioned brew. Forms an average-sized, bright white, foamy head which retains and laces well.

Smell: Fresh oranges dominate the nose due to the Amarillo hops. Not much of anything else, though.

Taste: Three Floyds classifies "Gumballhead" as being a wheat beer of some sort, which is odd because it has few qualities I would associate with a beer of the general style. This is much more in the line of an American pale ale than anything wheaty. From beginning to end its lemony, zesty (almost peppery), hop flavor and accompanying bitterness. Theres a tingle across the tongue throughout the entire swig, so its quite energetic for such a relatively small brew.  It ends with a quick hop bite, a hint of chalky aftertaste, and then slowly fades away cleanly.

Whats remarkable is that considering how hop-forward this is for the style (and in general), its very refreshing. This would be an ideal summer beer, but has enough flavor to satisfy in any situation. My only complaint would be that its a one-dimensional palate. Id prefer some more familiar qualities of a wheat beer instead of something bordering on a pale ale. 

Drinkability: According to Three Floyds website, Gumballhead is 5.5% ABV and 35 IBUs. I can definitely see the potency as this beer has a thicker, longer-lasting, and energetic palate than your average pale wheat ale. Although the 35 IBUs actually seems a little low as this seems to have as much hop presence as many pale ales and single IPAs Ive tried. A smaller, lighter body would enable it to be a true session beer, but for now its just a tasty, enjoyable pale wheat ale that Id happily buy if I could get it.

12 oz bottle into a three floyds glass.

A - Golden amber body with a 3 finger soapy head with large bubbles. Lots of floating bits of yeast and sediment. 

S - Really hop dominant. Grapefruit with a wheaty and spicy finish. 

T - Bread, grapefruit, belgian yeast, spice, and some hop bitterness. Kind of muted and watery. Mouth feel is pretty fitting for the style.

O - An odd little beer. Hoppy and wheat heavy, spicy with a bit of fruit sweetness. Its a bit tame but I could see myself throwing back a lot of these.

Bottle. Pours hazy dark gold, vigorous white head. Nose is clove, banana, some bubblegum, a bit of citrus. Tinge of piney hops on the tongue, with a bit of lemon and orange peel, effervescent carbonation. Balanced, quite good.
Pours clear golden color with a white head. Aroma is wheat along with piny and grapefruite hops. Taste is of   citrus and pine hoppiness, backed by a toasty wheat flavor. Very well balanced.

Even against the backdrop of the hype that had been built up around Three Floyds to me and that this does not fall in the styles I am into these days, Gumballhead delivered on all levels.  Very refreshing and full on flavor!  A must try!

Bottle thanks to BuckeyeSammy: pours hazy golden, faint off white head. Fair amount of carbonation. Nose isn't terribly strong as mild grassy hops, straw and faint lemon notes is all I'm getting. Once on the palate, wheat, grain, bread malts, honey sweetness are evident as this is medium bodied and crisp. Solid mild session beer for a warm day. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle from Discount Liquor Milwaukee.  Pours a clear, bright yellow color with a white head. Aroma is hoppy, citrus, lemon and grapefruit. A little light on the palate with average carbonation. Flavor is bitter, hoppy, lemon, wheat, with a bitter hop finish. Very refreshing, an excellent beer.
Perfect brew for a warm day.  Best wheat beer on the market.  You really do get the smell of juicy fruit bubblegum.  Unreal
An American wheat beer that backhands you across the face. Hoppy, citrusy and pleasant. Its not normal!

Pours a hazy golden yellow with a nice wispy head. Aroma is hoppy with plenty of citrus, with strong lemon scent. Taste is full of flavor, well balanced
with nice hoppy taste and full of citrus. Finish is fabulous. Not a big fan of wheat ales, but this one is El Primo. Quaff Score ( drinkability with hearty enjoyment ) 8 / 10 Another winner from Floyds Cubed, absolutely thirst quenching  !!

Pours a hazy gold with a white head and a sweet, hoppy aroma. Taste is of fresh hops, citrus, and grapefruit, nicely balanced with a crisp, clean finish. Very drinkable, flavorful, and refreshing brew.

Aroma- Smells very hoppy, 
Appearance- Pours golden/pale in color. White head. 
Taste- slight hoppiness, very clean dry finish. slight bitterness in the aftertaste. 
Overall- Was expecting a typical wheat beer, not a hoppy, almost pale ale beer. Drinks very nicely. If it were available in my area, would definitely be buying more.

More of "on tap at the brewpub".  Clear but very slightly hazy yellow.  Bubblegum aroma with plenty of sweetness.  Mouthfeel was light and slightly sticky... but not so much so :: lousy description::  Taste was fruity, very fruity.  Plenty of banana, bubblegum, light fruit.  Tasty.  I was expecting to be blown away by this one but I wasnt.  Very solid and Id happily drink again, but perhaps Im not as big of a fan of the style as I thought I was.

12oz bottle.
Pale yellow brew with tons of fluffy white head.  Nose of grapefruit and spice.  Flavors of citrus and pine with a wheat bite.  One of the few wheat beers Ive had that holds a candle to Lil Sumpin Sumpin.  I could drink this all day.

Super clear for a wheat but the hops come shining (literally) through with clean clear citrus bitterness and a focused finish.  Everything that Bells Solsun once was and what Oberon will never be.  Bazinga!

From notes.  First reviewed 12/1/2010.  Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a pint glass.

Out of the bottle comes a clear straw yellow liquid with a mellow 2 cm white head. The cap slowly regresses, leaving just a thin film and a bit of lace. Large fizzy bubbles form on the bottom of the glass and rise up to sustain the head.

Very mellow wheat, some lemon and orange, and a blast of citrus and slightly herbal hops.

Three Floyds does a great job of just obliterating the Pale Wheat Ale category. When designing it, they must have decided to make a nice, relaxed pale wheat and right at the end added a truck load of Amarillo. Awesome. Some soft honey-like sweetness with a touch of citrus seem to come from the malt, but a ton of pineapple, mango, grapefruit, and herbal hops blast through and take control. Finishes clean and somewhat bitter.

The light feel is not something I would really have an issue with for this style, except that with the huge hoppy character to this beer warrants a slightly bigger body. Overall it feels crisp on the tongue, with a bit of oily hop residue as a contrast.

This is a lot better than most of the boring beers in the category, and is a great light change of pace from a great Three Floyds lineup.

Gold in color. Thin head that receded fairly quickly but lots of stringy lace. Aroma is all hops. Taste is more of the same, cut grass hops. But with a nice and sweet malt backbone to the beer to provide some balance.
Citronnelle, des ballots de blé avec les superbes notes damarillo qui viennent rafraîchir le bouquet. Fini légèrement poivré, buvabilité excessive.

12oz bottle courtesy of queenholly, pours a mainly clear with a slight haze with a golden/yellow color and a medium off-white head. Aroma of hops, lemon, yeast, bubblegum and grass.Taste is very hoppy and sweet, caramel bready malts, finishes with a nice balance of lemon citrus, wheat, and yeast. I am not a wheat beer fan by any means, but this is great stuff.

Pours a golden honey color with a soapy head and the aroma is an enticing citrusy scent. The first sip sends your mouth into a bubbly almost champagne like feeling from the carbonation and it is cut by sweet and tangy citrus kick. Very mild and refined four a wheat beer.
Pours a slightly hazy golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma is big piney and citrus hops. Taste is also big on the hops. Grapefruit and grassy hops with some sweet malt balance. Very good.

What a beer this was. The scent was surprisingly hoppy for a wheat ale - and quite herbal as well with hints of kumquat. While the taste was rather light on the hops there was a nice and distinctive dryness after the bready, grapefruit body.

Thanks, again, to Chipalsa. This one is hoppy with wet hops and grass filling the nose. Some tangelo citrus aromas with a hint of sweetness are also evident. The pour is golden-orange with big bubbles and a white head. The wheat comes out much more once tasted. Wheat and grain flavors meld nicely with light citrus/grassy hops. This one is very sessionable and pairs effortlessly with pizza. Awesome

Hazy orange colored body. Creamy two and a half finger white head is set atop. The head works its way back slowly leaving spotty but thick lacing stuck to the glass.

Hop forward aroma. Assertive tropical fruit backed by pleasant citrus and soft floral aroma. Wheat malt backs and balances the hops. Less of a grainy aroma than many American Pale Wheats, there is a rather pleasant sweetness.

The hops are allowed to take center stage upfront. Sweet pineapple flavor leads followed by subtle grapefruit and a general citrus sweetness. The bitterness is rather low, though there is enough to provide balance. Soft malt sweetness rounds out behind. The soft wheat provides a nearly perfect combination for the fruity hop flavor.

The bodied falls on the lighter side of medium. Fairly crisp carbonation. Moderate but refreshing finish.

Gumballhead is a fantastic beer. While it is not one I reach for often when it is available to me, I also enjoy it when I do. Great warm weather beer but then again I would not be opposed to enjoying a few in the comfort of my home while watching the snow fly. Very drinkable, easy to enjoy.
One of the best wheat beers by one of the best microbreweries in America. The color and aroma are very nice.

Bright gold, frothy, slightly off-white head. Hoppy, grapefruit nose.
Taste is strong, spicy hops, very crisp.  More bitter than 28 IBU would suggest.Hard to feel the wheat. Dry.Not a big hop-head, but its pretty decent in my book.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2012 Last time I drank this was while living in Chicago back in 2007. Glad I can appreciate this brew now.

Hazy, golden pour with red hues and nice head. Strong hoppy aroma with hints of sweet malts too. Sweetness from the wheat malts help balance the hoppiness, though it finishes a touch watery with a lemony citrus aftertaste. Reminds me of Zombie Dust in some ways. Great beer for a hot summer day.
This is the best beer out there.  It doesnt really have a rival in the wheat category.

Jakes Pub, Chicago bottle ($6): Pours a reddish color with a quickly dissipating head. Aroma is amarillo hops, amarillo hops, and amarillo hops (similar to Jinx or Pride & Joy). Taste is also very hoppy, but in my opinion the wheat elements come out more and provide a pleasant counterpoint to the hoppiness. This is not to say that the hops are extreme, for I do not believe that they are, but rather that they are awesome. Very sessionable and helps restore my faith in wheat ales.

Pours a cloudy golden color w/a small white head & lots of carbination. Fruity, pine, citrus aroma. Has a lot more up front hops than you would normally get in a wheat-but they dont overpower it like an IPA. Sweet, citrus, pine, grassy flavor w/a long crisp somewhat bitter finish. Its good, its refreshing and its very different.
Pours a pale yellow with a thin white head. Nice crisp and bubbly on the palate. Taste is light and hoppy with a little spice on the tail end a very good beer.

A- Shiny, translucent golden-yellow with a one-finger head that slowly dissipates. A nice amount of lacing is present.

S- Clean hoppy citrus, pineapple, and yeast. It smells sweet and slightly bready.

T- Its slightly oily with a sharp bite to the tongue. Big wheat bread flavor that has a slightly malty sweetness. It finishes with a nice citrusy hop bite.

M- Refreshingly crisp with a light-medium body.

O- A highly sought-after brew from 3 Floyds. Is it completely worth the mythological hype? Maybe not, but this is a solid wheat beer. Honestly, I have not had the style in quite a while, but this is probably the best wheat beer Ive had.

Serving type: bottle

BRAG 2012. cloudy yellow. Sharp citrus nose, papayas, slightly spoiled orange juice, I dont even find the wheat, great. There is some wheat in the taste, watery on occasion, peaches, weak grapefruit, bitter, citrus, Im already drinking Goose Island BA Rare... so yea. Next!

Love this beer. Good summer beer. Crisp and dry. Big fan. Not much can go wrong with three Floyds. Would definitely have again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 Reviewed from notes (2009).


A: Light golden blonde body. Large white head. Subtle lacing.

S: Bubblegum. Lemon. Other softer citric notes. Wheat and grain. An interesting and inviting brew.

T: Light wheat and citric hops throughout. Still some gummyness to it. Nice presence of hops without overwhelming bitterness.

M: Smooth, light bodied. Refreshingly clean.

O: Solid brew indeed. I wish I could get this beer locally. Its unique and drinkable, a great combination.
The beer that turned my son into a craft beer fan.  Hazy amber with smooth blend. Summer gets better with this beer

Pours a transparent golden yellow/orange with tall white long lasting head.  Smell is initially bright citrus hops, some flowers, lemon spray.  Taste is nice citrus hops and citrus fruit that meld with the bready doughiness nicely.  This is pretty much the perfect session beer.  Too bad I only have one left.

Bottle purchased at the Three Floyds Brewery. Pours a clear golden colour, with a big white head that dumbs down to a think ring, lots of lacing on the glass walls. Aroma is hoppy and sweet, citrus, bananas. Taste is a little hop bitter, and just awesome. Its smooth and light, and really has everything you would want in a beer. Ive had this brew a few times now and has become a personal favorite with ease. Great stuff.
You cannot find a better entry level craft beer.  If you ask me this is almost a perfect beer. So easy to drink. Smells like lemons tastes like citrus.

Shared bottle with Timfoolery. The aroma was the best aspect of the beer. The floral hops jump out at you immediatley. The aftertaste of lemon was the most overwelming chracterisic and what I most remember. I good beer, but 100th percentile for its style is hard to believe.

Bottle from Jashais trade. Strong scent of floral hops and slight Meyer lemon. Taste was of pure, light hops, but there wasnt much more to it. Old bottle? Good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer has an amazing aroma and a nice balance between the sweetness of the wheat and the bitterness of the amarillo hops. I cant wait to revist this beer once the winter has passed on and the spring/summer months come back.
UPDATED: MAR 4, 2012 Smells great...lemon and hops.  Pours hazy gold with a nice thin white head.  A great hop taste with the lemon as a good finish.

seems like the best session beer ever. crystal clear gold, hop forward with wheat finish. i could drink this all day. little sumpin sumpin isnt even in the ball park, this beer has so much more finesse.
on draft at 3F semi cloudy with medium white head. slight hop aroma. very easy drinking with a faint lemon finish

Pours a great hazy orange with a 1 finger head. The aroma is of hops and a slight bready character. It overwhelmed of hops though. Smells great!! The taste has nice hops in the front that are little grassy. Grapefruit and lemon take over. The back has a nice grassy wheat flavor. THE BEST Wheat beer Ive had!
If you enjoy hops, the three floyd efforts are for you. Just the aroma of this brew is intoxicating. Loved it !
Looks like a light lager, pale and quickly disappearing head. Aroma is lightly floral, lemon, hop resin. Taste just like it promises. Interesting wheat. Love Amarillo.

On tap in an English pint.  Pours amber with a cream-colored head.  Aroma of caramel malts, wheat, some light fruit, and some citrusy hops.  Flavor about the same, with a lot of wheat and hops.  Average texture.  A good beer.

nearly clear golden with a nice white head that leaves fantastic lacing, nice retention... spicy hop aroma, perhaps a bit herbal, quite a bit citrusy, very appealing... a little spicy, not very very lively, medium to medium thin body, quite drinkable, a little lemony as advertised.. relatively bitter for the style, dry finish... a little tea like in its dryness and light bitterness...
Awesome beer, I havent found anything like in Michigan.  I highly suggest but I have made road trips just to get it.

Malt aroma is bready and dough and pales in comparison to the explosive citrus, resin and lemony hops. Some fruity esters that linger in the carbonation as it escapes. Beautiful full gold with great clarity and a small white head that doesnt last but laces up very well. Opens with the same bready and doughy malt character. Hop Flavors of citrus and resin slam into the middle and carry the fruity yeast notes well into the finish. Aftertaste is lightly sweet with plenty of fresh hop characters like herbal and orange. Body is medium with large bubble carbonation, no warmth or astringency and just a touch of creaminess. Delicious and one of my favorites.

Floral bouquet, odd for a wheat beer, lillies and rosehips discernible. Clear amber, medium head, nice lacing. Wheat and lilly flavor, tangy lemon. A hoppy american wheat, which is a stroke of genius, since the style lacks lack the fruity esters of the german hefes. I finally got my hands on a few of these, courtesy of some friends who made a pilgrimmage to 3Fs. It is well worth the wait. I would buy this regularly if 3Fs ever decides to return to VA.

Draft at Kaseys. Transparent gold with a thin, lasting white head, filmy. Nose initially dank, lightly dusty and dirty with citrus and a strong wheat presence, reminiscent of a few New Glarus wheat beers. Flavor is a bit green at front, some paper in the finish, but likely my favorite FFF beer Ive tried in years, reminds of JP ES Bam (though of course not that bright) with the sparkling carbonation, grains swirling, and nice hop (though here more dank, expressive, forceful than ES).

On tap at Jackie-Os, for $5 a pint. Almost totally clear paler/darker yellow color, really dense, persisting white one-finger head. Nice, frothy rows of lace. Really hoppy-sweet nose-smell. Good, light crisp carbonation. Great, dry texture. Nice, juicy hop taste to the wheat, this could probably pass for a fresh-hop pale ale. Theres a lot to bite into, here. Nice, sweet, lemon-zesty taste. This is how I like my wheat ales. Is this really a wheat ale? Such a wonderful, powerful aroma.
Hard to believe this is a wheat beer. Hoppy beyond anything like it. Great lemon scent, very easy drinking beer. Easily sessionable, could be dangerous!

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Nonic Imperial Pint.

Appearance: Very cloudy straw-gold with medium-sized stark white cap. Slight lacing.

Aroma: Grapefruit, lemon zest and dried-out wheat. This is my third Three Floyds beer, and they all smell damn good.

Taste: Refreshing wheat malt body with very hoppy notes of grapefruit, lemon and even more tropical nuances. Some white pepper on the finish, but very little bitterness.

Palate: Moderately high carbonation with a light, crisp body. Finish is very dry and refreshing.

Overall: Wow, a Wheat beer that manages to be both hoppy and balanced. And unlike Lagunitas Little Sumpin Sumpin (which is really more of an IPA), I can actually tell this is a wheat beer. If this was available in Minnesota, this would be a must-have lawnmower beer ever summer. By far the best American Wheat I have had.

Bottle at Shirtless Joes in Rosemont before the Furthur show. Aroma is crisp wheat, grassy hops, distant fruit. Light bodied with medium carbo, has a very focused, crisp wheat profile with a slight hoppiness. The finish is dry and toasty. An excellent wheat ale.

12 oz bottle. Cloudy light yellow with a white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, wheat and toast. Flavor is wheat toast malt with a medium hop bitterness. Light body with active carbonation and a crisp, refreshing finish. Great wheat ale, the hops make this one stand above most other wheat ales.

Bottle from Jeff, thanks!  Wow. Never thought I would like a wheat ale quite this much.  Pour is a crystal clear light golden straw, with a billowing white head that fades to chunky lacing.  Aroma is fruity yeast esters, lots of citrus and floral hops...awesome. Taste is light wet wheat, lots and lots of white fruit, a bit of straw, a decent amount of citrus hops.  Freaking outstanding.  Thanks!

On tap at beverage source, pours golden orange, thin white head, aroma of lemon and pine, lovely. Great taste, not what I expected, almost like a wheat ipa, you get a great hop flavor, mild bitterness and some of the fruity esters that come with wheats. Great

No liquor store in Chicago can keep this one in stock.  A good friend of mine in NW Indiana uses a case of Gumballhead to successfully bribe his NW Chicago supplier of computer parts into better prices on his purchases.  So this beers reputation precedes my review.  Im a big Three Floyds fan, but would rather drink Alpha King at the same price.  Theres nothing wrong with Gumballhead, but it isnt quite as intense as their mainstream or seasonal pale ales.  I would never have guessed that this was a wheat beer if I hadnt read the label.  The aroma is full of pine and grapefruit.  It pours a mostly clear amber with a quickly vanishing small head.  Not a whole lot of carbonation, but a great hoppy taste, as expected from 3 Floyds.  Body is thinner than most other FFF brews, and the finish is short but pleasant.  Very drinkable and pleasant, but somewhat less than outrageous.
Bottle. Pours a clear yellow with no head. Aroma is heavy pine hops. Very fresh smelling. Taste is slightly holly with a clean finish. A bit of a property finish to it.

This is a very enjoyable, refreshing beer.  It tastes more like a pale ale than a wheat.  Pours clear golden color with white foam.  Aroma is the best part...surprising hoppy with crisp citrus and grapefriut.  I could drink this all day.

Poured on draft into an imperial pint glass. Appearance is a translucent gold with a moderate head of white foam. In the aroma I detect notes of lemon and grapefruit rind. In the taste I find a mildly bitter presence over top of a biscuit backbone. Finish is of moderate length and aftertaste is a touch bitter.

355ml brown bottle from arminjewell! Yellowy-golden colour. Airy white head. Nice citrus nose, lemon peels and grapefruits with some sweetness. Flavour is of dry wheat malts, lemony hops, orange and grapefruit peel/pith. Dry finish, orange peel and a little lemony tartness linger briefly. A trace of bread. Light to medium bodied, lots of carbonation. Refreshing, sessionable and pretty clean. Probably the best use of hops in a wheat ale Ive come across.

GABF 2011.  Clear brilliant gold with a bubbly white head. Spicy hop aroma with peppery orange peel and floral resin. Flavor is a little fruity with notes of peach and pineapple, but also hoppy with floral notes and some citrus rind. Sweet pale malt backbone with a touch of toffee and caramalt. Not too sweet, just to balance. But I love the hop profile and complexity of this brew!  Fruity but not tropical. Delicious.

Pours a deep golden into the glass with an initially sudsy, quick-forming head that diminishes to a thin, yet solid cap retaining well.  The head leaves thick soapy lacing.  The nose is of pine effervescence.  Grassy flavors dominate, with a pine-needle citrus, bitter hop back and lingering grassy bitter finish.  The body is perfect for summer, allowing a healthy quaff with substance, and without an overburdened palate.  Complex yet light and super tasty, this is a great wheat offering.

have had on draft and in bottle. yellow color with whitish head that lingered with nice lacing on the glass. great summer beer or anytime for that matter. you have that wheat thing going on a little grassy flavor and the pinyness of the hops. great combination that melds together to form a  very good beer. love the lightish flavor and then the zip of the hop.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2016 Draft in pint. Pours golden with white head and some lacing. Nose is pine hops and hay. Aroma is like nose. Aftertaste is hops. Dry and fruity finish. Usually dont like hoppy beer but this is good

Defectuosa. Escuma amb bombolla gegant i amb aire pel mig. Sosa. Espero que sigui pel transport que sha espatllat. Aquestes cerveses millor provar-les al país dorigen i més tinguent en compte el preu que acabes pagant aquí. 9 euros tirats pel wàter. Segona decepció de la mítica Three Floyds Brewing.

Ive gotta say Id been craving this one for awhile. There hadnt been a case around in three weeks. It looks great as its an orangish gold in color, cloudy, and active. It smells great as well. Its yeasty, slightly sweet, and features slight fruitiness.  Its very heavy on Amarillo hops and is very clean. It tastes excellent as well. Its an excellent combination of its differing features and none of them takes the lead. Its perfect really. The mouthfeel is light and smooth and this has got to be one of the best wheat beers around. I also greatly appreciate the higher than average alcohol content. Great beer and one of a kind for the style.

I really dont get into wheat beers, but this one was lively enough to keep me interested.  It has that citrusy hops thing going on that betrays its boring blond appearance.  Definitely worth checking out.

Bottle, courtesy of Relight, thanks! A lightly hazy pale to medium blonde beer, with an average sized, frothy/fizzy, mostly diminishing white head. The aroma is lightly malty (cookies), lightly hoppy (grapefruit), lightly yeasty (dough). The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Light to medium body, watery texyure, lively carbonation, short finish with light to medium bitterness. Average, not bad, but I was expecting more from this brewery

1. Look  A hazy straw color wheat ale with a medium white head and steady amount of bubbles.
2. Sniff  There is a big citrus nose with a strong lemon aroma.
3. Sip  This IPA is light bodied ale that is fruity from start to finish.  It has a long lasting finish that is very tasty.  It is very similar to the taste of a regular piece of bubblegum.
4. Another Look  The beer looks average with weak lacing.
5. Evaluate  Overall, an interesting wheat ale, with a very unique flavor and taste.  I would recommend this wheat ale to family and friends especially in the summer months.  This is a easy drinking and fun ale to drink.

Bottle. Pours pale gold with a foamy fluffy off white head that slowly fades. Aroma is awesome pine and grapefruit with bready rye scents. Taste is more pine and grapefruit with again a bready yeast and rye flavors (the hops are awesome and upfront with this one). Palate is medium and sticky with a solid dry finish. Really great wheat beer, not many I could compare this to, this stands alone!

Fresh 12 oz. - Pours a slightly hazy orangish with a frothy off-white head.  Nose is pretty much just hops; amarillo, citrus, fruity, grapefruit, lemon, wheat, etc.  Taste is pretty much the same, huge hops for a wheat beer, not overly bitter, but big on citrus/mildly spicy, fresh, crisp, earthy hops with a discernible wheat edge.  This brew is super drinkable, flavorful, and fairly light in body/mouthfeel - the spicy/citrusy hop character is the most noticeable part of this, especially at the very end as the hops fruity taste linger in the aftertaste.  A very drinkable, light, hop-forward American Wheat Ale.   People go nuts for this beer - beer novices even seem to really enjoy it.  It is a bit over-hyped, but still good nonetheless.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2011 Just had a 60 minute ipa and the aroma is almost the same as that. Sweet orange aroma,some breadiness refreshing smell of goodness. Dankness!Clean smooth /slicklight creamyness with a dry crisp finish not lemony too much but you do get that kind of tartness on the side of your cheeks. Very drinkable tasty well hopped wheat beer i have ever had.
 Flavor has orange/tangerine probably from the hops- this works very well in this beer and is one of the best wheat beers i may have had. This was worth the 160 mile trip to get it. The friendly people selling me it said i was lucky to get it as it sells-out almost instanly.It is a very good beer,and very good aroma,nice

Sampled at CBF11
Pale golden. White head.
Citric hoppiness; grapefruit.
Light and fresh.
Light to medium bitterness.
UPDATED: APR 13, 2012 Pours golden with huge white head.  Aroma is loaded with citrus hops. Flavor is a citrus hops up front with a little bit of wheat on the finish.  Wheat beer for hop heads.

I only had one bottle of this left in the fridge after a party...
A - Pours bright gold
S - Smells very citrus/pine forward, hint of vanilla
T - Refreshing, smooth, clean, finishes crisp with a lemony tang at the back of your tongue. Its nice.
D - This is damn drinkable... I only wish I had a second.

Serving type: bottle

Pours a very clear and bright gold color with a medium white head...lively...decent retention and lacing.  aroma has pineappley citrus and spice to go with some earthy wheatiness.  Flavor is notably wheaty and balanced with a crisp, spicy hop character.  Mouthfeel is lively and the finish is dry and spicy.  Very tasty!
355ml bottle shared by jsprime. pale golden with a white head. big hoppy nose. lean malt profile with some dry wheat flavour. enjoyable.

Leafy herbal hop aromas with a little underlying citrus and wheat. Flavors of hops and herbal citrus notes dance lightly on the tongue. Finishes quick and clean.  Overall a fantastic wheat! Many thanks to Chicago Mike for sharing!

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2013 Bottle. Golden slight haze. Two finger white foam. Citrus earthy aromas. Some bitterness in an otherwise crisp brew. Soft carbonation. Very Pleasant. Rerated 12/12-13. Home. Golden clear. Small head. Soft pleasant bitterness. A bit overpriced for kr 50 for 33cc.

Bottle. Slightly hazy golden pour, thick foamy white head. Aroma of citrus hops, lemon, somewhat floral, coriander and wheat. Flavor is slightly bitter, fruity, smooth and very well balanced. Thick body, lively carbonation. Very drinkable.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2012 Date: September 3, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: Trade with FullObs, Plainfield, IL Appearance: Translucent golden orange, good amount of head and lacing. Aroma: Lemon, citrus hops. Flavor: Consistent with aroma but also some sweet maybe honey, thin to medium bodied, and a slightly bitter lemony finish. Other: One of my all time favorite beers, love this stuff!

What a phenomenally unique beer; I struggle to name another wheat beer that has so much hop flavor and aroma with low IBUs.  Extremely drinkable and satisfying, this is my top pick for the perfect summer beer.  Great aroma (Amarillo easily top my list of favorite hops) and fantastic taste.  One of 3Fs best.
Alright, this is beyond charming. Magical. The good citrus hop flavor and aroma. The wheat adds a thickening, delicious hop finish

pours fierce somewhat hazy yellow with a lasting white head and some lacing.  aroma is hops, citrus and a hint of yeast.  taste is primarily hops but the wheat aspect comes through as well with the citrus of the hops complimenting the banana quality of the wheat nicely.  finish is strong but not extraordinary.  a nice wheat beer that really leans more closely to being an APA.

Its style is "American Wheat" but it is unlike most beers in its style. I think of it more of a hybrid of a wheat and an APA. It is a very well balanced easy drinking beer. I highly suggest this as a gateway beer from BMC to craft, it is very light and pleasant and will no overpower someone new to higher quality higher flavor beers.

This is one beer that I oddly think is better served in the bottle than on tap, for some reason no matter where Ive had it on tap I have found it to come across semi-watered down.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2011 Not what I expected in a good way.  Ive never had a wheat beer with such amazing flavors.  Flavor is lemon, grapefruit, herbal notes, and great  crisp flavors.  So tasty.

EDIT: After drinking this not back to back with zombie dust, which was unreal, I realize its even better then I initially rated it.

Bottle pours hazy gold with a white head. Aroma shows lots of citrus as well as wheat and tropical fruit bubblegum. Flavor is lemon dominated with additional notes of stone fruit. Overall body is light to moderate, crisp, and finishes with moderate bitterness.

Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma is hops, citrus and a hint of grapefruit. Flavor is tropical fruits, wheat, hops. pretty well balanced between the hops and wheat. Overall an interesting take on this style.

Aroma is flowery hops, some citrus, touch of spice.
Flavour is caramel, fruity hops, flowers, citrus, medium bitterness. Nice.

Draught CPH 2011, 
AR/AP/F: pale yellow, wee head/watery but fruity/tuttifruttii, apricots, sweetness residuals
A big hit of fruity hops, light caramel and creamy wheat aromas. Fresh and inviting. Clean taste with citrus, apples, bubblegum and honey.

The best wheat ale Ive ever had. I normally dont like this style of beer because of the banana taste. But combining this style (that has a great mouthfeel) with some nice fresh american hops and balance out the heavy sweetness usally found in these beers. Overall a very refreshing great tasting beer, to bad Three Floyd arent easy to find here...

Got in trade with an non-Ratebeerian.  Used a weizen glass. Pored a relatively clear yellow, very small head. Light / Medium body.  Mouthfeel is nice and tingly and a bit of Pizazz.  Nose with the taste is very much a light IPA. Grapefruit and lemon.  It is a nice, refreshing beer, however with a name like Gumball Head I think more of a Hefeweizen rather than an IPA. I guess I was hoping for two much. Didnt realize the label was a Cartoon character.  A bit above average.

Shared by AirForceHops. Poured semi clear yellow, minimal head. Aroma was sweet grapefruit. Taste was light slightly sweet grapefruit hop with a lemony finish. Very light and refreshing. No bitterness which was a plus, unlike most other IPAs Ive had. It went down smoothly and quickly. I liked it. Granted with Gumball on the label I was worried at first it may have a fruity funk to it.. but later realized Gumball was a cartoon character. Nice Brew.

I have had this beer from the bottle and off the tap, and I highly prefer the tab, especially the tap at Three Floyds.  The beer pours with a cloudy golden colour topped with bubbly white head.  The aroma of this beer feels quite different from other wheat beers as it has a notes of lemon like IPAs.  The flavour is nice and lemony with wonderful hoppiness to balance it out.  The finish is smooth and refreshing taste with little to no bitterness,

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2011 On tap at the brewpub.

A: Very hoppy for a wheat beer, light banana, cerea and grass. Nicely complex.

App: Clear golden with decent lacing.

Flavors: Nice fruity profile (tropical fruits), subtle crisp wheat. A little sweeter at first, with a bitter finish. Very refreshing.

Palate: Light and lively carbonation.

Overall: Very good beer but it seems to be that it is an IPA with wheat more than a hopped wheat beer.
Lus och lätt grumlig när bottenjästen hällts ner i glaset. Citrus och lite skumbanan. Mer humlebeska än hos de flesta europeiska veteöl. En trevlig variation.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2014 Bottle @ home, courtesy of arminjewell. Another awesome beer from a cool dude. Incredibly transparent, corn yellow appearance with a fairly small white head. This really looks like a cheap macro light beer. Huge piney hoppy, light malty nose. Lots of piney hops, light wheat flavor. This thing is a hop bomb with light wheat and light malt characteristics.
(on tap) Urinelike color, white head. Sweet, bonbon, artrificial. Waterish mouth, sticky amnd rancid finish. What´s with the hype about this beer?

Bottle.  Light golden color.  Thin head that fades down into what looks like mold spores on top of the brew.  Pine and citrus hop nose.  Kind of surprising.  The taste is similar.  Lots of hops.  This is a wheat pale ale!  Very crisp and bitter.  No detectable yeast fruitiness.  Good body though.

I appreciate Three Floyds clever "twist" on wheat beer. Gumballhead seems to be all the rage these days, and while I dont like to bandwagon jump, I also try not to be too stubborn sticking to "my" brand (Oberon, in this case). Really, I think theres plenty of room for both in your summer rotation. The lemony aroma and bitter bite on the palate are refreshing, and the ABV keeps it light enough to be sessionable and thirst-quenching. Its easy to see why this has become so popular. And who isnt a sucker for a cat smoking a cigarette?

One of the best beers Ive had and a staple in my fridge. This wheat beer puts many other American wheat beers to shame. You get the wheat and then also the hoppiness of a pale/ipa. Great during the summer. Awesome brew!

12oz bottle.  2nd time with this one.  Hands down the best wheat beer I have ever had.  Pour is golden with plenty of white head.  Nose is grain, a little citrus and hops.  Taste follows the nose.  Not much to say about it except it is a very simple Hef with a nice hop kick that is very much a beer you can throw back all day.

12 bottle from Sonoma via sherm1016...thanks.  Pours a lemony yellow with frothy but quickly fading head.  Lots of hops and a lesser amount of wheat...some lemon on the side....a great summer beer.....have one after mowing the lawn!

12oz bottle - thanks Matt. Golden yellow with a white head that fades quickly. Balanced hops, not much wheat, or yeast. Starts sweet, slight bitter aftertaste, great finish that hits both sweet and bitter. Would definitely not describe as a wheat ale though - more IPA - still delicious.

Cheers to jrallen34 for this one as a trade bonus.

First off, I am not a wheat beer fan, but I really like this beer.   Aroma is honey and floral hops aromas.  Almost no lacing, gorgeous gold.  Good carbonation.  Hits pallate mostly up front with sweetness, but still enough bitterness to make my mouth water.  Flavor is very unique grapefruit citrus and ground black pepper.  Terrific balance-great summer beer.
Draught, KØ11. Weak hoppy aroma. Seems like nelson sauvin. Good and spicy, but not fat spice. Rather clean. Good, you know.

look: 4.5  smell: 4  taste: 4.5  feel: 4   overall: 5

A- Pours a light golden color with a thick white head that dissapates.

S- Very pleasant wheat smell with some citrus notes

T-Hits with a citus flavor then to a slight bitterness,very slight and then ends with a crisp flavor

M-Very light bodied but has a nice bubbly feel in the mouth

D-I love this beer in the summer! HECK i love this in the winter. it is my go to beer so i might be alittle biased but def. give this beer a try if you havent

12oz bottle courtesy of bobbypaulson. thanks, mike! hard to believe i havent rated this one. pours a hazy, peach-gold with a full, creamy, bright white head leaving light rings of lace. aroma is excellent with a heavy dose of lemon, white grapefruit, and orange peel citrus hop notes backed by sweet, biscuity yeast, wheat grass, and light berry notes with fresh cut grass and pine esters as it warms. flavor is damn nice as well with fresh, bitter, grassy hops, lemon zest, and pine esters backed by honey-wheat, yeast, and light spice notes with just a touch of peach flesh on the back end. palate is medium bodied and very smooth with crisp carbonation and a dry, bittersweet finish. overall, a damn tasty wheat ale/ipa hybrid.
36cl, no mention of ABV, American brew, thx to Jeppe!, complex brew, fruity and slightly bitter, easy to drink, balanced, hazy, good head, nice brew

Poured from a 12 oz bottle.  Pours a nice golden color with a finger of white head.  Aroma is citrus and just a bit of hops.  Taste is slightly sweet, some sour citrus.  An incredibly drinkable beer with nice carb.
12 ounce bottle, pours a pale yellow with a white head that quickly dissaptes.  Tastes like a classic wheat beer with hints of lemon and some spice.

Cloudy golden with orange hints and a huge fluffy white head. Lovely light but hoppy aroma of pine and berries, with some wheaty notes coming through as well. Taste has a lot more wheat which makes for a soft mouthfeel and toasty flavour, with an overlaying hoppiness.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2011 Bottle at Sorbon. Hazy, yellow liquid with medium white head. Very fruity and a bit floral smell with notes of dark berries, lemon, mango, tropical fruits, spices and lots more. Complex and wonderful aroma. Taste is dry with medium bitterness. Refreshing. Light to medium bodied with nice carbonation. Great beer, recommended.

Sampled @ Copenhagen Beer Festival 2011:  Pours a bright clear pale golden body with a gigantic fluffy everlasting white head. Really nice and hopy grassy aroma with notes of sour hay and sweet fruits. My lord thats one smooth beer! Has a slick and creamy mouthfeeling, its softly carbonated and medium-bodied. Really nice and thirst quenching body and beautiful wheat flavors. Notes of hay, and its quite peach-fruity with a perfect light sour grapefruit-like finish. A truly fantastic beer.
4/10 i mörkhet,  Frisk och fläderig i lukten. Oljig, syrlig och besk i smaken. Besk eftersmak.

Sampler at CBF 2011-05-26. Clear golden with a white head leaving excellent lacing. Pickled, spicy and floral nose with hints of malts. Light acidic, earthy, light sweet and bitter. Light to medium body. Dry mouth.
Unique beer. Not so much a wheat as a hoppy american pale ale with just a bit of citrus flavor from the wheat. A hazy yellow pour, lacy white head. On tap at Via in Milwaukee.

Tap @ Three Floyds. Clear gold pour with a minimal white head leaving a geographic lace. Fruity and pine hop nose. Medium-light body with moderate fine carbonation. There is a definite wheat toast sweetness and a typical wheat finish, but its all overlain with a fruity, estery hoppiness that really adds depth and breadth to the brew. Finish is light, like lemony Wheat Thins. About perfect.
Bottle that fell off a truck. Pours gold with a white head. Fresh hoppy aroma with floral and piney notes. The flavor has a wheaty base, with floral hoppy notes and some lighter piney notes. Nice.

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Festival. Pours a slightly hazy honey-hued body with a big white head. Aroma is mango, wheat, bubblegum, malts and peaches. Fresh. Taste is similar: peaches, mango, wheat and grassy hops with hints of bubblegum again. Fruity, full-bodied and yet very nice and drinkable. A really delicious session ale.
Copenhagen Beer Festival 2011. Pale yellow beer, whit head. Fruity aroma, perfume, wheat, spicy. Fruity spicy flavor with perfume and grass.
One of the best wheats available today.  Slight orange on the nose, perfect balance of citrus & grain in flavor.  Great beer for warm days.

Sampled at Copenhagen beer festival 2011. Clear golden with a small white head. Strong hop aroma, grapefruit and sweet mandarine mixed with fruity banana and cream. Its mild, wellbalanced an delicious.

On tap at Copenhagen Beer Festival. Golden colour, moderate white head. Lovely piney and resinous aroma, also notes of tropical fruits. The flavour has also notes of pine and tropical fruits, very pleasant and thirstquenching.
Draught at the Danish Beerfestival 2011.Clear golden, medium white head. Heavy citric hop aromas, a bit stale. Medium bodied and smooth. Dry with a bit astringent bitterness.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2015 the pour is an oily deep gold without much of a head. DANK nose, very fresh and tropical, with citrusy hops, mango, lime, some peach, orange peel, black pepper, a bit of earth, and a bit of grass. Incredible. The mouthfeel is medium and slightly oily and wheaty, with a medium body and moderate carbonation. Great. The taste is perceivably bitter and spicy, with a fruity and citrusy edge that lingers. A whole lot of flavor for such a sessionable beer. Dangerously good.

Draught @ Ølfestival København 2011.
Pours a light yellow colour with a small white head. Aroma of citrusy hops, mild wheat, some malts and grapefruit. Flavour of lemon, grapefruit, hops, wheat and some mild malty tones. Medium bodied with a slick mouthfeel. CItrusy, caramel-like finish. Tasty.

Pours a clear yellow with minimal head and some particulate matter.  Aroma is huge citrus and mango (honestly smells like some straight chron) with a balanced malt sweetness.  Flavor is mild bready wheat balanced with plentiful citrus hop bitterness.  The wheat comes across as clean and grainy, not fruity and estery like a hefeweizen or most other types of wheat.  Body is light and fizzy but has a nice viscosity from the wheat.  Finishes dry and extremely refreshing.  There can scarcely be a better session brew for the discerning hophead.

Aroma: citrus, bready malts, pine, resin, pineapple, very floral.  Pours a very clear straw-light gold color with about 2" of white head, couple minutes of retention and some lacing.  Flavor: robust punch of hop flavor; pine and citrus, pineapple, bitterness is noticeable but not overwhelming and takes a backseat to hop flavors.  Bready malt character, hint of light, sweet caramel.  Fairly light in body, medium carbonation, refreshing.

Bottle. Pours a clear and yellow beer with a white head. The aroma is hops with citrus, grapefruit and orange. The flavor is malt and hops with the same profile as in the aroma. The palate is bitterness. Overall a really good beer with a really good balance.

Looks cheap, honestly.  But this bottle has a heart of gold, like any good eighties comic underworld character.  Smells nothing like a wheat ale, but still incredibly satisfying.  Dripping with citrus, piney hop madness, this killer nose relays perfectly into the wheat-beer anchor of the brew.  The orange marmalade hops blend with the clovey, grassy malt, creating a benchmark American Wheat Beer.  Not the greatest of its kind, but a good posterboy.  (2/25/09)

Pours clear light golden yellow with a good amount of carbonation and a thin white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of sweet candied sugar, wheat, raisins, flowers. Taste is not as complex with a resin filled flower texture and bitter citrus finish.

Poured from a bottle into a chalice. Thanks Dan!

Kind of hard to take style into account here, as this is a very one of a kind beer!

Appearance- Golden in color with minimal head or lacing. Love the label!

Smell- The aroma is similar to an American Pale Ale, as there is a prominent citrus hop presence. 

Taste- I found this beer to be very balanced. The citrus hops flavor was very nicely complemented with the wheat malt flavor. 

Mouthfeel- Very light on the tongue. Nothing exceptional to note, but I could easily drink a growler of this over the course of a night.

Overall- Three Floyds created another very different beer with this one. This is the wheat beer for the hophead!

Tasted on 5/8/11 from a 12oz bottle at Lush Roscoe.  Pours hazy light golden with a thick, foamy white head that slowly recedes to a thick blanket of uneven lace.  The nose is more citrus hops than anything else, but there are also light aromas of resin, flowers, and a bit of cereal and hay wheat malt.  The flavor is, once again, more citrus, resin, and floral hops than anything else, but they give way to the cereal and hay flavors of wheat before appearing again as bitterness.  The body is light with lively carbonation and a medium bitter hops finish.

On tap @ 3F, pale gold w/ sticky heavily lacy head, huge Amarillo aroma, moderately clean malt and light and light bitterness throughout with huge amarillo on finish, very tasty and unique example of the style

Apr 23, tap @ 3F brewbar. Pours clear golden with a smal white head leaving nice lace. Piny hoppy, slightly fruity aroma. Fruity piny medium mouthfeel. Flavor is clean; piny hoppy, fruity and dryish. Good medium palate. Finishes pungent and bitter hoppy.
Sampled at Dark Lord Day. Thanks for the share. Very light golden yellow with light head. A lot of unique flavours come through here. Some citrus. Very unique.

Bottle from trade. This to me is a great BBQ beer. Very good wheat beer with great hop presence. Not another boring Blue Moon clone, but a really interesting beer. The label also might be my favorite beer label ever.
Split with McBerko. Skunky hop nose with potent lemon citrus. Effervescent mouthfeel, lemon drop taste, some wheat. Tastes muted, not fresh. Finish lingers well, touch sweet, but its underwhelming.
Golden with a small white head. Aroma of grapefruit, pine and orange. Sweet tropical fruit and orange peel flavour

Bouteille 355 mL - Couleur dorée avec une fine mousse blanche. Wow! Arôme très prononcé de citron résineux. Se boit à très grandes gorgées. Goût citronné avec une finale légèrement amère. Peu amère pour une IPA. Dommage que nous nen trouvons pas au Québec. Elle serait magique pour cette été!

12 oz. bottle, split with manuchampions, pours hazy golden orange with a small white head. Aroma of skunky, herbal hops, with citrus, grass and wheat. Flavour brings out the wheat on top, with citrus and grassy hops that follow - wheaty, hay-like finish. Quite decent though not ambitious in any way.

Bottle. Yellow with dense white head. Aroma hopps, grape, hay. Taste hopp dominated, quite nice. I don´t think I ever get the idea of wheat ales, what´s the idea of using wheat when it can´t be tasted anyway, just an excuse to make another IPA or APA and call it something different.
Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is wheat, peach, orange and mandarin. Flavour is wheat, orange, mandarin and peach. Light bitter.

12oz bottle shared by Sendsilk. Another beer Ive been wanting to try for some time. Aroma was piney and earthy. Hops definitely make their presence know up front swiftly followed by the malt on the back end. A little yeasty and sweet but nothing too over the top. Another shining example of what a good solid beer should be.
Big fruit notes in the smell. Awesome beer. Really shines once it warms up outside. One of my favorite beers. One reason I enjoy beer. =)
Orange hazy body, white head. Aroma of pines and grapefruit, nothing reminding of wheat. Flavour has wheat though, apricot and yoghurt.

Clear golden orange with a big and lasting white head. Aroma is first and foremost moderate hoppy - peach. Notes of wheat and yeast as well. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Finish is bitter and dry. Very much dominated by the peachy hops with the wheat being overshadowed. 040411
Bottle @ Odense tasting. Clear yellow body with a large white head. Aroma is rubber perfume and fruit chewing gum. Flavor is wheat, fruit and peaches.

Bottle @ Odense Tasting , March, 2011. Pours clear copper with a creamy white head. Nose is fruity hops. Perfume and pine. Quite exotic. Fresh and quite tropical with wheat in the back. Smooth palate. How I like any Wheat beer.
Bottle. Tanks to Micke! Pours hazy yellow/golden. White head. Aroma and flavor is quite typical for a German wheat beer, has ripe banana, candy, sweet malt and some perfume.

Pour pale golden yellow completely clear with nice white head and good lacing. Aroma pine, citrus, grapefruit, grainy maltiness. Taste citrus, touch of spice, pine, pepper and wheat in background. Crisp carb smooth easy drinking MF. Interesting beer lots of thing uncharacteristic of a wheat but very good closer to an APA with wheat. Still very easy to drinking a great refreshing summer beer.

Poured into a snifter. Gumballhead pours a pale yellow, translucent, with a nice white head. Little retention, and the head eventually drops down into the halo effect. Faint lacing. A shocking hop aroma for a wheat beer, yeasty, citrus and some earthy tones. Hops are upfront in the initial taste, but it fades and hides behind the sweet malty flavors as well as the citrus from the wheat. Clean and crisp mouthfeel, not heavy at all. Interesting palate with the Amarillo hops. Not what I expected style wise, but as a hophead I loved it.
On Tap at the Brewery. Clear golden color, modest head, little lacing, faint hops odor, funky wet mop hops taste.  Quite drinkable with the wheat providing a light background
Bottle served MacTivens in indianapolis while chatting with Jim.  Hoppy wheat ale, full of flavor and body.  Still has strong drinkability, I could have this all night.

Its hazy, warm golden with a huge head and a mild and fruity aroma, primarily with notes of citrus. The same goes for the sweet flavour, that has a light, citrussy bitterness in the finish. Its refreshing and OK, but a wheat  not for me...
UPDATED: JUL 6, 2012 Has a strong wheat scent and taste. Color is a rather light gold with a quickly fading head, funny how taste change, rerated from 4.1

Tastes more like an IPA than your typical wheat beer. Very hoppy, with a citrusy, grapefruit flavor to it. Pours a lovely golden-yellow with a medium-sized, quickly dissipating head. Grassy, floral, citrusy aromas. My first shot at a Three Floyds beer and it doesnt disappoint.

Bottle 355ml. Pours a clear,  glowing, amber with huge, fluffy, white head. Aroma is tropical fruits,citrus, note of grainy malt. Taste is light sweet,  light to medium bitter, mildly lasting. Very light body, watery,  lively carbonation.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Bar, Copenhagen. Hazy amber looks with a pillowy white head that left some nice lacing. Excellent aroma ,sweet and fruity with some prominent grapefruit and fragrant hop showing through. Really light refreshing and easy drinking. Excellent piney hoppage in the flavour that works a treat in the context. More citrus, and a touch of spice in there too. Shortish fruity/bitter finish. Somehow this seemed like a perfect hot summers day guzzler that was a little inappropriate for a sub zero danish day. Great beer all the same though.
