Bought a 6 on my latest trip to Chicago. Poured to a golden orange with thin white head that lingered awhile and left okay lacing. Nose was an interesting mix of hoppy citrus fruits, ilke an IPA and a cookie dough-banana wheat. Mouthfeel was slightly bitter, yet full, and the tate resembled the flavors found in the nose. Although I agree with other raters that its hard to call this a straight wheat beer, it was nonetheless a darn good summer cooler.

Had a pint at The Boundary in Chicago. Simply put, this is the finest beer Ive had in a long time. Fantastic hops. They explode on the nose and palate. Orangey-yellow color. Medium lacing. Fresh, clean. Mindboggling.

On Tap at BJs GPM. Looks much more red-tinted in the glass than any wheat beer I remember. Nose is confusing, is this an IPA or a wheat beer? That translates to the nose being inviting as well. More hops on the nose than any wheat beer Ive ever had. The wheat comes through in the taste and is mixed in with the citrus, fruity, fresh hops taste of an IPA. This almost seems like a new style all of its own, because Id have a hard time calling it a wheat beer, or an IPA for that matter. Either way, ITS GOOD!
clar gold under a medium sized white head.  watermelon, citrus, soft fruit aroma.   a fruity hop flavor with light citrus.  smooth.  great take on a wheat ale.  the hops liven it up nicely.

12 oz bottle courtesy of secret santa. Thanks Rudy. Pours a cloudy yellow-amber color with a small white head that has good retention and some sticky lacing. The aroma is soft with IPA-type citrus, melons and sweet malts. The flavor loaded with sweet lemon drops, candied oranges and a touch of biscuit.  The mouthfeel is silky smooth and malty-full. The finish is short and dry. Overall: A very sessionable and enjoyable wheat brew.

The absolutely most perfectest summer beer.  Tremendous hop flavor and bitterness to go with a smooth wheat mouthfeel.  Quite a bit of citrus fruitiness from the hops.  Cuts through perfectly after a big stout or DIPA.

This was a great beer for me.  I had it on tap at FFF, and I was surprised when the bartender suggested it once I told him I am into doppelbocks. I have to admit it was a great choice. Light in color and great tasting. It had a light fruit flavor to it. Great beer.

I drank this in a pint glass from a tap.

The beer is a dark gold yellow with a light white head.  There is decent but minimal lacing.  

There is a not a strong aroma coming from the beer but you detect slight smells of citrus and flowers.

After the smell I wasnt expecting much, but boy was I wrong.

The taste is great, its lkight but sweet with a very subtle bubblegum finish.

This is a great summer sessional beer that I could drink all night a long.
This beer has a nice fruity flavor with hints of earthy grassiness. I could lose an afternoon drinking this stuff.

Draft.  A darker yellow pour, some white head.  Smell is quite floral, citrus, banana and pine.  Good carbonation to off set the sticky nature of a wheat beer.  Taste  matches the aroma, a constant battle of sweet wheat malt, fruits and hops.  The over hops for a wheat make this pleasant and drinkable. One of the better wheat brews Ive had.
user_location: from Michigan now in Charlotte, North Carolina, USA

text: Is this good or what? Tawny yellow hazy pour from a 12 oz bottle resulting in a finger or so of snow white head. Fragrant aromatic hops dominate the aroma  citrus, pine, and hops. Flavor balances complex and even somewhat sweet wheat with  fabulously rich hops flavors. Very lively carbonation and full mouthfeel  the tongue tingles after each quaff. Awesome.
bottle thanks to Bman1113vr.  poured a hazy yellow with a white head.  aroma of citrus, wheat, bubblegum, lemon, and fruits.  flavor was wheat, pine, citrus, and lemon.  light body.  not bad at all.

on tap at the fff brewpub.  Probibly my least favorite out of all the ones I have had from them.  pours a murky gold with a tiny white head. smell is very strong of wheat and cirtus.  The taste is of citrus and surprisingly hops I didnt smell them at first but I taste a light hop finish.  goo beer

12 oz bottle. Had this quite a few times previously, and was surprised to find that I havent rated it, so being the summer, I picked up a 6pk of it. Pours a gorgeous hazy golden color with a small white head that dies quickly. Smells of lemon, hops, a little wheat, and maybe a hint of malt. Truly, the smell is more like an IPA than a wheat to me. Tastes of lemony wheat, with light hops in it. Surprisingly medium bodied, which I wasnt expecting the first time. It is an interesting wheat beer, and seeing as how little I generally like wheat ales, but this is very refreshing.

Bottle thanks to ericandersnavy. Pours a nice looking hazy gold with white fizzy head. Aroma is pretty hoppy with strong notes of grapefruit. Flavor is of obvious hops, some citrus, and some wheat malt. Mouth feel is light-medium body with high carbonation. Overall, not bad at all, very hoppy, in  aroma and flavor......a nice hoppy wheat beer....very interesting...

Bottle thanks to belgiumtripel. Pours with a largish off-white head over a nearly clear solid gold body.  Aroma of dank, citrus hops, of a DIPA level. Marijuana and wheat. Really dank. Flavor is citrus, wheat and herbal hops. Very nice and drinkable, but not complex or mind blowing. Nearly watery. Medium carbonation, dry finish. Solid beer.

Bottle courtesy of cmr1517.  Pours a hazy yellow with a one finger white head that leaves nice lacing.  The nose is malt, wheat and citrus.  The taste is malt and ripe citrus.  Medium mouthfeel.  Good brew, a nice hoppy wheat!  Thanks Chris!

Bottle thanks to one of my friends who goes to school in Illinois. Pours a nice golden color with a small white head.  Aroma of citrus, wheat, hops. Flavor is hops, wheat and some sweetness. Nice mix of flavors in this wheat, quite good.

12oz bottle from bulldogp04.  Pours a mostly clear mid to light golden color with very little white head that leaves some lacing on the glass.  Nose is a touch sweet yeasty wheat, some grass, and faint citrus hop notes.  Super refreshing with good carbonation, but nothing too sharp or over powering.  Wheaty citrus sweetness up front with some hoppy bittering notes on the end.  Very enjoyable wheat beer and would love to be able to buy this regularly.  Glad to finally try one...thanks Dean!

Bottle.  Damn this is a wheat IPA, awesome.  Poured a light, hazy, golden color with a medium sized white head.  Nice effervesence and lacing.  Amarillo hops definitely take center stage in this brew both in aroma and flavor.  As the beer warms and opens the wheat becomes more present and it works perfect with the hops.  Very nice.

This beer must be drank fresh!
The hop profile on this is awesome. Citrusy, some pine and grapefruit. But its mostly the nose. The beer is a interesting twist on the wheat beer style. There is more hops there than a usual wheat beer. The taste of this beer is great when its fresh.
Thanks cexshun for the extra.

Location: 12 oz bottle from Sahara Mart (Bloomington, IN), 5/15/09
 Part of the totally and completely made up"The Geororodanda Beer Sampling Party"


Aroma: Citrusy sweet nose, some light fruit

Appearance: Nice gold/yellow color, hazy, nice lacing

Flavor: Really nice citrus fruit flavor, really hoppy for a wheat

Palate: Nice medium body

Overall Impression:
A pretty nice wheat, one of the better ones that I can remember, maybe the best.  Why dont more breweries hop up their wheats like this?  It really worked!

Bottle thanks to punkrkr27.. Thanks Steve!!  Pours a nice golden color with a thin white lacing head.. Smells more like a pale ale with some citrusy hops and little bit of bread and grapefruit..Nice citrus hop bite with nice carbonation that makes this one uber easy to drink..I love it!!  Thanks again Steve you really do rock for sending this one.

pours hazy yellow with nice sized head. aroma is bursting with citrus, lemon, grapefruit, orange, wheat. drinks really hoppy for a wheat which is nice cuz its all citrus with just a little wheat sweetness to balance things out. damn fine wheat.

Pour is a clear dark yellow, light orange. Similar to filtered apple juice. Not much head, foamy and white. Aroma of lemon, yeast, orange, hoppy. Good hop bite. Light malt, floral notes, heavy citrus. Thin body in the mouth. Very drinkable as a session beer.

On tap at Brixies, Brookfield, IL. Pint served as a hazy gold tone with a modest, foamy white head. The aroma was malt, light pine then citrus. The flavor reflected the same with a little grain and a pleasant dryness to the finish. Light and very sessionable.

On tap @ the Ida Noyes Pub. Pours a satisfactory white head, golden and surprisingly clear for an unfiltered wheat ale. Characteristically hoppy FFF nose, w/ the Amarillo coming through especially. Spice and citrus, thin in the mouth and quenching. I liked the Oberon better.

Thanks to STFun for the bottle, number #1100. Pours a light hazy gold with a thin white head. Citrusy orange hop aroma with hints of wheat. Light crispy wheat malt taste with a nice citrus hop bitterness. Crisp refreshing wheat ale, excellent.

bottle poured a golden color with a thin white head and good carbonation. aroma has juicy citrus hops, pine, sweetness, and a faint bit of wheat. sorta like a stick of juicy fruit. mouth feel is light with crisp carbonation. flavor highlights the sweet citrus and pine hops.  there is a wheat beer under there but the hops just take this to another level. super drinkable but so juiced full of flavor.

Clear gold pour with a small white head.  Nice juicy mango and grapefruit aroma with some grassy wheat maltiness.  Estery citrus flavor with a fair amount of piny hop bitterness on the finish and a note of clover honey.  Medium-thin body with lots of tingly carbonation.  What an awesome summertime beer.  I wish I could buy it locally.  I would drink the crap out of this stuff!

I had this on draft and in bottle at DLD 09. The draft was fresher but they both were tasty. Poured a semi-cloudy yellow with a nice white head. The aroma was hoppy and a little spicy. The wheat and hops made a very drinkable beer.

I love this stuff.  Could drink like 15, yet it has good character.  Nice citrus hop aroma and really does kind of taste like original flavored bubble yum.  Light yet flavorfull.  Its a really good lighter beer.

22 oz. Bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a large white head and good carbonation.  The aroma is grassy with spices and some fruits, but also a surprising amount of hops.  The flavor is wheat grass with spices and hints of fruit.  The hops from the nose are not quite as prominent, but definitely there.  Medium body and smooth drinking.

Bottle.  Pours a dark golden with a very thin white head, great lacing.  Aroma is stong with wheat and hops.  It has a sweet character to it and some citrus notes really come through.  The taste is not what I expected, but still very good.  The wheat really comes ou in the taste and the hops are a little hidden.  This beer is very balanced and has a slightly bitter finish.  A great beer, worth trying.

Bottle, courtesy markwise. Clear filtered golden color, frothy white head, thin braids of lacing. Hops in the nose, spicy vegetal note, some dry grain and wheat. Flavor is wheaty, crisp fruit, and some hops in the finish. Meh. Thin-bodied, drinkable but boring. Havered it.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2010 My go to beer. pours a clear yellow iwth a big white foamy head..  leaves some spotty lace on the glass.  aroma is floral hops, pine, orangepeel .  Nice mix between a wheat beer and a ipa. Flavor is much the same with some wheat and bread notes.    the girlfriend loves it.  There are few beers that are more refreshing than a fresh bottle of this.   
</br>
</br>
just an awesome refreshing session beer.  always in the mood for a fresh gumballhead.

12 oz bottle

Thanks to kseecs for sending this along with some other Three Floyds beers in a very recent trade.  Knowing that Gumballhead is at its best when fresh I did not hesitate to open it just as soon as it had settled a bit.  My reward was a fabulous sessionable IPA/wheat ale which is near the top of its class.

Aroma / Appearance - The foamy stark white body contrasted against the carbonated golden fluid beneath.  As it percolated upwards the bubbles released a blend of fresh pine, grapefruit, and malt.  Hoppy and strong I have always thought of this more as an IPA than a wheat ale.

Flavor / Palate - Fluid and smooth it tickles the tongue and throat before easing into the stomach.  As it makes its voyage it leaves a trail of calm bitterness that tastes like a blade of fresh grass.  Excellent all around I am glad that this is a regular release that has not lost anything over time.

TAP: didnt know this was in the "wheat ale" category until I saw it here - would have thought it a pale ale. More hop profile than I would expect from a wheat, very smooth and drinkable. Thought it was low on flavor for a pale ale, but is pretty flavorful for a wheat.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2011 Ive had this a few times now, either via online order or through trade.  Golden color with a fluffy white head that settles to a thin layer.  Some scattered lacing sticks to the glass. The aroma is citrusy and a surprisingly quite hoppy with pine and herbal notes.  For the most part, the flavor follows.  Light wheaty notes, herbs, and clove, but the flavors are centered around citrus and a strong hoppy profile for whats supposed to be a Wheat.  Really solid stuff. If someone told me this was 6.8% abv instead of 4.8% I probably would have bought that. Too bad I dont have regular access to this, would be a good one in the Florida sun!

On Tap at the Horseshoe Casino in Hammond, IN.  Was surprised to see this on tap at the casino.  Had several glasses of this.  The law of diminishing maginal utility did not apply to this one.  I enjoyed the last drop as much as the first.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2009 Growler from Rich Os in New Albany. Pours dark orange with a hint of gold and reasonable head. Aroma of hops and surprisingly enough, gum balls. Mouth feel is very dry but when the flavor hits, it hits you hard. Great bitter taste of hops that lingers and eventually turns into a sweet gumbally flavor that dissipates very slowly. I had no idea this was a wheat ale when I was drinking it because it tasted so unique. Nice job Three Floyds!
Bottle.  Light gold appearance with little to no head.  Medium carbonation.  IPA aroma with light body and medium mouthfeel.  Crisp finish.  Very Refreshing.

Pours golden with minimal white head. Aroma is citrus, definite wheat quality, banana pepper, and vinegar. Flavor is lemon citrus, wheat malt, and hints of tart tropical fruit. Palate is super refreshing with a super dry finish. Nice one.

Golden pour, with slight head.  citrusy hop aroma.  slight amounts of acid, green pepper.  Taste is absolute refreshment.  light and playful, this wheat beer has good complexity and balance.  Very good, Fresh!

pours quite a light orange copper with minimal head. Aroma is citrus hops and wheat- not too complex, but very nice. Flavor is extremely refreshing after a night of heavy beers- wheaty and hoppy with a slight vinegar tinge to it. Palate is smooth, very nice wheat beer.
good beer, claims to be a wheat beer but It drank like an IPA, had fruity flavors.
Draft at Birreria Paradiso in DC.  Hazy orange color.  Lively carbonation.  Great mouthfeel.  Lots of tangy wheat and lemon.  BItter finish.   This is an excellent beer fresh.

Clean soft gold, hardly any head.  Clean juicy hops, wet with pineapple and mango.  So clean the hops jump right out and fade out quickly.  I dont see much in the way of wheat, yet this is more along what I would brew for a wheat ale.

Thanks to stfun37 for this 12oz beer. It smells very lemony just as the label states. Golden yellow with some fizz at the top. This has a very strange taste some lemon but also slightly fishy, what the hell? There is something very strange about this beer that I just dont quite get.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-24-2009 02:41:17

Fresh bottle shared by Ryan & Felicia at Daknoles. I love Gumballhead! Pours bright golden with slight haze and small off-white head. Estery, fruity aroma. Grainy body. Delightful backbone of beer that is not yeasty at all, just loads of character, sweet grain and wheat malt character. I am loving this full-flavored characterful beer.

Pour is a hazy gold with a large white head.  Aroma is a a very nice hop especially for a wheat ale.  Flavor is some grain and citrus hops but nothing really stands out.  A odd beer with the araoms of a pale ale but the flavor of a wheat.
Golden in color with a small head. Aroma is of citrus, hops, wheat and some grass. Taste is of grass and grapefruit with a moderate hop bitterness.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2009 Appearance:  has some red tones from the red wheat; otherwise a light orange, almost golden; pretty clear slight haze like they say; however, loses points for very little head

Aroma:  very enjoyable; has a slight rye presence to go along with fruity wheat; gumballs are not out of the question; the amarillo hops seem to show a light American citrus feel but not too present

Flavor:  Frankly, its delicious!  Wheat and rye nicely blended; light malty sweetness provides just enough of a presence; 

Mouthfeel:  medium body; high carbonation; average texture; above average finish

On tap at Chumleys

Clear yellow amber in my glass.  Smells like citrusy hops, not very wheaty, but great.  The flavor is very hoppy, balanced with malt, and there might be some wheat in there, I cant really tell,  but I like it anyway.  The mouthfeel is thin and refreshing.  I like the fact that this isnt very high in alcohol.  This is a good un.
On tap.  Dark golden hazy and light brown head. Aroma:  big hops and is slightly sweet Flavor: dry wheat flavor some bitterness.

bottle as an extra BA trade.
Pours clear copper with thin white head.
Aroma is hoppy, citrus and light grains.
Taste, hoppy with light citrus / grapefruit  notes and palate, wheat.
Not a strong beer, but overly enjoyable and complex. Finish leaves a bitter and nice silky touch on the palate.
Hazy yellow-orange pour with a white head. Aroma of yeast, hops, and citrus. Nice flavor of hops upfront with sweet malt finish.
UPDATED: AUG 8, 2010 12 oz bottle.  Very dry and hoppy for my taste.  The drink was not refreshing at all, especially for what was once a "summer brew".  Aroma was similar to the taste.

Bottle from Archer Liquors. Poured a clear orange gold color with a decent fine white head. Nice grapefruit aroma. Surprising. Near medium body with mild carbonation. Flavor is distinctly hoppy. Beautiful, except for a certain graininess between sips. Just an excellent weizen!

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2010 On tap at FFF in Munster, IN.  Not your grandmas wheat beer.  Golden color with a white head.  Aroma of wheat, citrus, honey, and way more Amarillo hops than you expect.  Flavor is wheat, honey, lemon, and grapefruity hops - excellent choice of hop variety.  You really get an insane amount of hop aroma and flavor without very much hop bitterness.  Medium-bodied, very nice for the style.

12 ounce bottle courtesy of cdumler. Thanks! Pours a light amber color with a small head. Average head retention and lacing. Clear. but with small white particles. Very nutty aroma, reminiscent of sunflower, with some fruity hop notes. Taste is also strongly suggestive of sunflower seeds with pecan, honey and subtle hop notes. Medium bodied.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2009 Bottled.  I completely agree with the commercial description. Obviously one of the brewers and not the ad folks developed this.  The amarillo hops really make this a unique and easy drinking wheat ale.  By far my favourite wheat beer so far.

Bottle courtesy of tpd975. Pours a clear golden with a small white head. Aroma of citrus hops and wheat. Taste is the same as aroma. Medium mouthfeel with a moderate amount of bitterness. Simple but very good.
12 ounce bottle purchased at Archer Liquors in Chicago, IL for $1.95 Very good.

Amazingly clear for a wheat beer, suggesting only a moderate contribution there; light golden with excellent carbonation and a full-bodied, almost chewy mouthfeel, again suggesting some restraint as to the use of wheat. Smells distinctly of grapefruit, likely because of the hops. The yeast is either neutral or slightly fruity but hidden well despite the bottle conditioning. Tastes like gumballs with a heavy dose of amarillo hops and has a lemony citrus finish. Hardly bitter. This beer is a fine showcase for the flavor and aroma profile of amarillo hops. The wheat adds enough body to give this beer another dimension, but the hops are worthy in themselves. Quaffable and refreshing.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2009 12 oz bottle into pint glass, served at cellar temperature 50F.  Pretty weak clear light golden color with a big white creamy head that holds and laces well.  Where the hell is the wheat beer haze?  This thing is crystal clear.  The aroma is beautiful.  With a big whiff you get lots of amarillo hops with a faint hint of wheat.  But, when you sil your glass with a big head and sit it of the table, you pick up the more subtle aromas of cotton candy, yeast, and sweet fruit.  The flavor isnt as outgoing but still very nice.  Great hop character accompanied by a subdued wheat quality.  Superbly balanced.  One of the best session beers around (if only it were a bit cheaper this would be an easy regular).  Feels light on the palate but more textured than expected for such a light beer.  Soft medium carbonation - not overly carbonated like many wheats.  Overall: my glass is vanishing rapidly!!  Not a typical wheat (I certainly wouldnt have called it a wheat beer in a blind tasting), but yet another flawless offer from FFF.  I also love this label.

(RE-RATE) same score.  Really outstanding wheat.  Lots of hops on the aroma and flavor.  Not as wheaty as many, but maybe thats just the hops outweighing the wheat.  Great either way.

On tap at a dive in Chicago. Pours golden with a foamy white head. Aroma is of wheat, hops, citrus, spice, and pine. Taste is of wheat, citrus hops, spice, all with a nice piney taste. This wheat beer has way more hop characters and fruit flavors than most average what beers. Very drinkable.

12 oz bottle courtesy of Acknud. Pours a hazy yellow with a 1/2" white head. Little bit of lacing. Aroma is citrus hops, lemon and wheat. This seemed more like an IPA than a wheat ale to me. Classic IPA flavors,  strong citrus hop presence, grapefruit flavor, with some weak wheat flavor in the background.  Bitter grapefruit like finish. Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2010 Draught at Birreria Paradiso.   Opaque gold-amber with a small head that leaves just a bit of foam.   Straight grapefruit juice with all the pulp left in for the most part.   Big hops in the nose, with juicy grapefruit, orange, and some sharper pine sap.   considering that this keg must be left over from last summer, the hops are still pretty pungent.   The wheat base is a bit sweet and tangy, with a creamy texture.   Big hops in the finish, like orange-lemon-pine, perfect amount of bitterness, but then again I like bitterness.   Not exactly typical of the style, but then again, typically the style sucks.   Medium-light bodied with the yeast making it feel more substantial and smooth.   My only gripe is that the carbonation level is just a bit too low, probably also contributed to the lackluster head.   I wish there was a summer seasonal available in California that was this good!Rerate: Draught at Local Option.   Almost perfectly clear this time.   Filtered?   Seems like either that or the keg was disturbed the last time I had it.   Big orangey amarillo aroma.   This is the second al- amarillo beer of the day, and it works much better in this setting with a clean yeast, versus the hefe yeast that Goose Islands beer used.   Just kind of a bitter resiny fruit; very simple, straight-forward and drinkable.   Nice dryness but hint of wheat texture and sweetness as well.   Still great but definitely different than before.   Id love to session on this.

minimal haze for a wheat ale, a golden appearance with only a mild head.  moderate carbonation.  interesting and unique flavor, with the classic fruity weizen yeast components, sweet and estery.  a ton of favor hops thrown in which i have never experienced in a wheat ale.  not down style guidelines, but a quality brew

Sampled at the Second Cellar Reduction.  We entered into this very warily, due to the 2003 vintage.  Clear gold pour with thin white head.  Nose of vanilla honey and wheat.  Flavor is wheaty, with a grassy hop and some citrus.  Medium body with medium carbonation.  This held up surprisingly well for being 6 years old!
Bottle with Butters at Second Cellar Reduction.  Vintage 2003 bottle.  Fairly white head and golden cloudy appearance.  Spicy nose.  Honey, spice, some citrus.  Nice mouthfeel.

12oz bottle pours a lightly hazy straw color with a small white head, not much retention.  Aromas of citrus, lemon and orange zest, and yeast.  Flavors are mainly citrus, lemon zest, yeast and there are some hops in there too.  Palate is smooth, not to much carbonation.
Had this off the tap at Globe Pub in Chicago. Pours a light golden color. Flavorful, although hops dominate the aftertaste.
Very light straw colored with medium white head.  Very light-bodied, really too light.  No aroma.  Tasted like a rice-brewed light lager, with a bit of lemon zest.  I’ll take a pass on this one.
Bright gold with small white head.  Big hoppy nose with a touch of grain.  Flavor is hoppy with citrus that fades to a slight wheat/grain with a nice malt backdrop.

12 ounce bottle given to me by a friend. I was not expecting much out of this brew because my buddy said it was nothing too exciting. I think he was wrong...

Poured a deep gold color with a nice sized white head. The aroma consisted of a lot of citrus hops with a little bit of floral in the background. The taste was extremely refreshing with a nice citrus taste with a nice hop character. Finished very smooth making me want more. I thought this was an excellent beer! Probably my favorite wheat beer to date!

(10/12/08) Draught during Riot Fest in Chicago. Clear deep golden with a medium white head. Aroma of citrus hops and some  fruits. Sweetish flavor with some wheaty fruitiness, lots of hops, grapefruit, notes of pomelo and a bit of malt. Medium-bodied. Good stuff.

This beer has tons of character.  It has complex flavors that remind me of grapefruit with a smooth, crisp finish.  A refreshing beer that can complement many flavorful foods.  Gave this one such a high rating because it blows away every beer for its style.  Would serve this one with everything from crab cakes to ribs.
Deep golden color.  Very different for a wheat beer.  Very hoppy.  A good beer, but does not fit the style.  I’m not exactly sure about the hoppy wheat combination.
Picked up from the brewery with Honkeybra.  Crushed with Jakebra.  Color of pee, nervous right away.  Confused.  Very hoppy, musty.  Weird profile, but somehow pleasing.  Strange, but yummy.

bottle from Archer Liquors.  The Best Wheat beer I’ve ever had..... insanely hoppy for a wheat beer.  FFF signature is all over this one.  Pours a light gold with a bit of white head.  Very strong citrus hop aromas ... followed by a soft citrus based, floral hop presence on the palate.  Very smooth through the mouth with the hops and lemon intertwining perfectly.  Unlike most wheat beers which tend to be heavier on the lemon - Gumballhead throws some serious hops in the mix.  Nice bitter finish that sticks with you for a bit.... excellent beer... I wish FFF was in my area - b/c I would be drinking their beer every week.

12oz bottle. Pale yellow color with a slight amber hue and minimal head. Awesome balance of citrus and hops. A little thin on the palate, but wonderfully refreshing. Best suited for summer days, but Id drink this any (and every) day.

Getting notebook online. Bottle. Pours hazy gold. Great hop and lemon flavors. The red wheat taste is a lot more subtle then a lot of wheat beers that just aren’t my thing. This one is, by far my favorite wheat to date!!
great bbq beer. Good about of Citrus. Pleanty to taste and it remains refreshing.

Bonus bottle from StFun.  Thanks Josh!.  I love wheat beers.  Gumballhead is super easy to drink.  Some skunk in the aroma.  I’m not sure if it was light struck or it uses Saaz hops.  Nice crisp hop flavor. Very well done.

For someone that doesn’t like wheat beers, if I had to drink one, this would be it.  Very hoppy and flavor is great.  It’s the wheat palate and finish that just don’t do much for me.  Not a knock on 3F at all - just my personal preference.

Bottle.  Poured a slightly hazy gold color with a thin white head.  Aroma of grapefruit and floral hops.  Flavor was grapefruit and wheat up front, with a grassy hop finish.  Medium body with good carbonation and a crisp mouthfeel.  Great beer.
Not sure how this can rate under 3.2-3.5  Strange wheat beer and the final flavor that hits you is an eye opener. Cloudy amber-yellow, hops, wheat, citrus.  Enjoy....

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2008 Beers pours from the bottle a clear golden color with a thick bleach white head which dissipates quickly.  A heavy citrus and floral hop aroma hits the nose as soon as the bottle is opened up.  Flavor is grassy mixed with wheat at the start but finishes with an awesome grapefruit flavor at the end of the tasting.  A good and unique beer. As it warms, the citrus flavor really comes out and really shines.

Bottle from the brewery.  Pours a dull clear orange with receding head.  Aroma is very sweet hops and malts.  Flavor is also very sweet, not a whole lot there.  Lacing is not present.  Not my favorite FFF but still a drinkable brew, better if it was a hot summer day.  Better than a 2.9

This is a very light, clear, clean straw color with golden hues. The carbonation helps to maintain the head for some time. It has a great floral hop aroma similar to other FFF beers. There is a perfumy floral taste that pervails but doesn’t dominate. Also some citrus hops are present and a bit of sweetness. This is a great tasting beer and tastes more like an IPA than a wheat, but I like it just the same.
Normally I’m not a fan of grapefruit, but the zinger on the tail end of the taste is a nice change of pace.

Not what you’d expect in a wheat beer. I’m not a big fan of any pine-taste in my beer and this one had a subtle pine flavor. Also, more carbonation than I’d prefer. Some sweetness mixed with some bitterness. Overall, it’s a slightly above average experience but with so many people raving about Gumballhead - I was disappointed.
From bottle.  Poured a lightly cloudy golden-yellow. Big start to this ale but finishes thinner than expected considering the maker.  Lighter hoppiness than other FFF but a good end-of-summer beer.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2009 Poured a somewhat cloudy golden-yellow.
Nose was honeysuckle and yeast.
Taste was rather mild, with malts up front, some lemony hops in the middle, and almost no back end whatsoever. The mouthfeel was very watery and thin.
Not very complex, but extremely drinkable. Id share with lagerheads anytime!

Appearance is a super clear yellow-light orange hue, head is two fingers of loose foam that sustains, light lacing.

Smell is subtle for this style, but I could pick out moderate yeast and bananas, some other light fruit and spices.

Taste is initially dominated by biscuit pale malts leading to lemon citrus hops, some bubblegum sweetness and syrupy fruits, finishes bitter and drying.

Mouthfeel is light-bodied, watery and thin texture, very high carbonation is almost distracting.

Drinkability is compromised by the overly high carbonation and bitterness, otherwise this is decent example of APWA (not too many of these in SoCal) that has good balance, low alcohol presence, but lacking in complexity.
bottle at OTR thanks to Devin.  Pretty sure that I saw jon’s kids finishing the dribblets from this bottle.  just amazing.

A very nice wheat brew.  A hazy light gold yellow with a nice white head.  Aroma is nicely balanced of wheat, hops, lemon and citrus.  Flavor is hops and then the lemon and citrus flavors come in.  Probably the best wheat beer out there.  Palate has a nice sour bitter (very light).  Perfect for a wheat ale.

Very nice lemony hop aroma. Reminds me of a quality pale ale. Taste is very crisp citrus with a slight hint of wheatiness. Definitely not your typical wheat. Somewhat light, but extremely quaffable. A sixer of Gumballhead will not last very long. God bless Three Floyds!
A Three Floyds standard. Pours very thin, with a light frothy head. This stuff has a very light hoppy flavor, with a  lemony spice after taste. A very drinkable wheat beer.
On draft at the brewpub. Straw colored and a little cloudy with a white head. Lemony aromas. Spicey flavors with a dank hop flavor mixed in.
Look is golden in color sort of hazy with a light white lacy head.  Smell is wheat, hops, pine, and citrus.  Taste is wheat, malts, hops, pine, and citrus.  Easy to drink.
bottle, golden color with white head, nose and flavor is oddly green/fermented but enjoyable, good body and finish but not a typical wheat

Tasted on 5/4/08.  The appearance is at first sort of off putting. It pours a fizzy filtered yellow with a white head that fades fast, but once you get to the smell you know its a whole different ballgame. It smells of strong citrus hops and a nice wheat sweetness. The taste is similar to the smell and its just perfect. A nice hop bitterness with a sweet wheat after taste. Its more like a plain pale ale but with an added wheat sweetness. This is an exceptional beer. The mouthfeel is sort of thin but its ever so drinkable. I wish I could get this all summer in Texas!

Bottle. Moderate notes of cereal, lemon for the hops, light leather for the yeast, with hints of apple, white wine, corriander and maybe some bubble gum. Head is small, white and creamy with fair lacing and is fully diminishing. Color is amber with a slight haze. Flavor is lightly sweet and moderately acidic to start, and finishes lightly acidic and moderately bitter. Palate is light to medium, between dry and watery and has a lively carbonation. A very tastey wheat ale, I drank this way too fast.
From a pub poiur ths came a cloudy gold with a fizzy white head and good lacing.Nice nose of banana and citurs hops.  Light but smooth mouthfeel. Favor of wheat and hops,  Slightly bitter mouthfeel.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2010 Thin, white head quickly disapates to none at all. Slightly hazy. An original wheat. Lemon-grapefruit and resin notes dominate. Finishes with the flavor of sweetened grapefuit zest. An ideal summer beer for any hophead.
Like no wheat I’ve had. Lacking all those traditional flavors. Refreshing is a good adjective. It is light. Like a straight up ale. I like how 3F messes with the concept of a wheat here.
A great light beer with a citrus hop taste.  A lighter taste that’s not overpowering but still has the typical hop FFF taste.  Very refreshing, very light.  A bright yellow appearance, mildly hazy.

12 oz. bottle courtesy of a trade with yem25.  Pours a very hazy yellow gold with a moderate white head that quickly faded to a film and left virtually no lace.  Strong aroma of pine along with some banana and lemon notes.  The flavor is a bit of a disappointment.  Heavily herbal with some pine as well.  There is no lemon, banana or wheat for that matter.  More bitter at the finish than I was expecting too.  An interesting beer, but not what I would choose for an everyday wheat beer.

bottle, hell yes!!  a beauty of a golden color with a very small white head.  aroma is hop heaven and maybe some fruit, banana or apple? flavor is wovenly so beautifully between citrus hops and malt. flavor is just so damn juicy.  i could drink this all day every day if i had to.  wow.

Crystal clear deep golden hue with a thin white head.  Aroma is all hops, and nothing but the hops!  Big amarillo citrus punch in the nose.  Flavor is decidedly delicious.  Big malty backbone - almost rich honey flavors - thn a big lemon zest fresh citrus finish - but not tart.  A fine beer - well balanced while stilll giving us a great amarillo profile.

Bottle.  The pour is straw colored and so clear you can read a newspaper through your pint glass.  (What a nerdy coatings chemist like myself might call a "10 haze".)  The thin white head is not long for this world, but leaves behind thin lacing on the glass.  Nose is grass and bubblegum with a surprising amount of citrus hop aroma.  Taste follows that template, and ends with a crisp, slightly bitter finish.  Easily one of the most refreshing, drinkable summer beers available.

Straw-colored with a fine white head.  Powerful aroma of banana, bubblegum, and spice.  Lively and spicy on the palate.  Leads to a very tasty wheat beer.  Malt, yeast, bubblegum, and pepper.  Slightly bitter aftertaste.  A delicious wheat beer.
Bottle from out west!  Pours a gold beer with a thin head.  Arom is hoppy suprisingly for a wheat.  Flavor is citrusy and oily.  A little bitter.  Not what expected, but it is still damn good!
This is the best wheat beer i have had yet. It was Bottled.  Not much head.  Fruity aroma, lemon and love. and taste is fruity too.  it is very crisp and refreshing.  Holler at your boy.
Bottled: Pours a gold color with small white lacing. Smells of sweet citrus and pine. This beer tastes amazing with a fruity taste with hints of wheat and malt. The best Wheat Ale I have ever had!

pours murkey medium yellow with a frothy white head.  Aroma is lighty malty of grain, heavily hoppy of pine and lemon and lime moderatly yeasty leather? and bubblegum.  Flavor has a great balance with some grapefrit / citrus but not overdone.  Finish is the same but a bit more bitter, clean and refreshing. light bodied on the watery side with lively carbonation.  Nice.
Great beer for the summer.  Very hoppy aroma, with wheat notes.  Citrusy hops, with wheat, and lemon peel flavors.  light mouthfeel.   Great Wheat.

lemony-citric hop on nose, great looking beer, clarity is pure. on palate there is a-lot going on but the balance is spot-on. finishes dry & long thats last for minutes, kick-ass for domestic wheat beer, ultra-ego of traditional germans that have little to no ibu’s, great summer guzzler

Thanks alot FFF,for making me dislike all other wheats! Not really, but close to it.
Lemony, zesty,summery ahh!! Lip smackin good!

Poors misty light with a small head.  very citrisy aroma - lemon maybe some peach?.  
Taste of Grapefruit (bitter but fruity)
Like the bottle says "It’s not normal".  
Interesting mix of citris and wheat flavoring.
A little too bitter for my palate but still enjoyed

Aroma is light and slightly sweet.
Appearance is light.
Favor is bitter, slight hops.  Less than a IPA, moreso a pale.
Extremely Hoppy.  Pours a light yellow with a thick head that does not diminish quickly.  Smells of Citrus and Hopps.  Great flavor, if you like a hoppy beer then you will love this one.

Bottle.  Pours golden yellow with some haze to it and has a decent white head that sticks around for awhile.  Aroma is straight up citrus hops.  Flavor is.....yeah... citrus hops.  Great tangy slightly bitter finish.  Extremely refreshing and and thirst quenching.  Another great, intensely hopped up 3F version of a "normal" style of beer.

At FFF Brewpub.   Golden yellow with a thin white head.  Aroma of hops (Amarillo), pine and resin.  Taste of pine, light wheat and lemon, mixed with tons of hops.  Body is a little sticky.  There’s something about this one that just isn’t right

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2008 12 oz bottle from Binnys.
Aroma: HOPS! Citrusy, lemon, sweet.
Appearance: Light, golden, bubbly. White, small carbonated head that dissipates quickly.
Flavor: Intense mouthful of hops. Tons of hop aftertaste. Lemon and fruity in the middle. Wheat.
Palate: Decently high carbonation. Smooth. Really rolls of the tongue. Light.
Overall: Well...Three Floyds keeps impressing me. This is the best "wheat" beer Ive ever had. Props to the boys in Munster on this one. Actually, I had this on tap during Darklord Day in 2008 and it was even better.
Hoppy, Hoppy, Hoppy, Hoppy, citrus.  That is that! Hopheads will love it, not bad.

Bottle. Pours a translucent golden yellow with bits of sediment floating around. Head is bubbly and white and quickly diminishes. The aroma... wow... Imperial Wheat Beer? Hops are so prevalent here. Lots of pine tons of white grapefruit. Wheat is somewhat distinguishable behind the intense hop aroma. The flavour is surprisingly very well balanced as opposed to the aroma. Pine isn’t as strong in the flavour, though, grapefruit is still a dominant flavour. The wheat is more distinguishable. Subtle roastiness appears then fades almost instantly as the brew passes the tongue. Towards the finish, pine becomes a little more evident. The finish has some nice round, smooth citric notes that’s well complemented with a bready dryness and a light bitterness. This is very thirst quenching. This is, by far, the best American Wheat I’ve ever allowed access to my taste buds.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2009 On draught at the Map Room in Chicago.  Hazy gold with frothy white head.  Aroma extremely hoppy and citrusy.  Tastes very bitter, not what I would expect from a wheat beer.  Smooth fizzy mouthfeel.  I like wheat beers, but it being this hoppy, just not my thing.

Updated rating: Ive become more of a hop-head, and appreciate this one upon re-tasting.

Pours pale, hazy gold, with a half-inch head of white. A few white, flakey particulates make their way to the bottom.
Retention is fairly brief, and no lacework.

Aromatics lead off wit a blast of peaches, melons, and tangerines. Extremely tropical and fresh. 
A hint of lemon zest follows through.

On the light side of medium bodied, somewhat crisp and creamy also.

Peach halves, mangos, and juicy citrus start the pallet. Sugared pink grapefruit steps forward and theres a hint of malt. 
Bitterness is nill, and the beer drinks quick.

Finishes with shades of apricots, peach fuzz, and papaya.

I had this years ago, and was not impressed. This one, however is top-notch, and Im tasting quite fresh.
Plenty of hoppy goodness in the nose and middle.
Yum.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2009 Bottle shared by Taverner, pours attractive honey color with a finger thick cream colored head. Nose is sweet like honey and some bitter hoppiness. Flavor is the same., with bitter hops standing out more. Clean finish.

bomber from marinos in toledo.  grapefruit and hop smell - golden color with a fairly sticky large white head.  light lemon-lime hop taste with a malt and wheat backbone.  quick finish, but balanced overall.  very drinkable.  K-8

Bottle.  Beer poured a clear golden color with very minimal white head that disappeared quickly.  I really liked the aroma of this beer as the hoppiness of this beer really made its presence known.  The beer had a light body, thin texture, avarage to lively carbonation and a slightly bitter aftertaste.  It has an interesting flavor combination of citrus (slightly lemon) and bitterness.  Overall, this was an interesting beer.  I will definately have to come back to it again and see if my opinion has changed.  It was different from traditional wheat ales that I am used to.  I did enjoy the hops.

Bottle. A hazy orange beer with a white head. The aroma is sweet hoppy with a light touch of wheat, while the wheat has a stronger presence in the flavor on a sweet malty back ground, and still with a distinct hoppyness. OK, but nothing spectacular - Im not that fond of the strong hoppyness combined with the wheat.
thanks ronsup golden pour with a nice lasting head very hoppy citrusy hops citrusy hoppy no bubblegum present but a very interesting brew

12oz. bottle from bdigi66....thanks Robert!  golden/slight orange pour and a wonderful aroma of citrus and grapefruits....almost an IPA aroma! Extremely light beer! Slight citrus and hops flavor much better than any wheat beer out there! Wonderful session beer. This being my first experience with FFFs and I am so excited to try the rest of the lineup!!!!!!!

In short: A smooth but crisp hoppy thirst-quencher.
How: Tap at brewpub
The look: Clear golden body with a small white head
In long: A crisp beer with crisp caramel and dried honey.  Some floral notes.  Rather hoppy with what feels like a mix of citrusy american hops and English hops (although Id be surprised if any English hops were used).  Very nice session beer.  There were some light lemony notes but overall this is not the light summer ale I got used to with Wheat Ales.  Thicker and more nourishing than just about any Wheat Ales Ive had before.  Another excellent Three Floyds product, although saying excellent Three Floyds product is about as redundant as AOL for Dummies.
UPDATED: JUN 2, 2008 really good summer beer nicely  hopped and quenchingly good! appropriate carbonation. good palate. nicely balanced. fruity sweetness...

Perfect score from me.  This has become my favorite American beer, and whats funny is I usually dislike American wheats with a passion.  These guys do it right though.  Wonderful, crisp, dry, wheat beer.. super clean, then this MASSIVE amarillo hops aroma and flavor dominates.  Its like a wheat IPA almost.  Its amazing and I highly recommend it to ANY beer drinker.

12oz bottle. Pours yellow gold, capped with a big off-white head that slowly diminishes. Wheaty aroma at first, which is soon overpowered by earthy, citric hops. Wheat, grain, and salt flavors are complimented by Amarillo hops, which take over for the long finish. Definitely stands out in the crowd.

Cool! I got a glass of this just before I got into the Three Floyds building to get my six bottles of Dark Lord. From a 22-oz bottle pours a hazy dirty golden brew with a thick white head that has some good retention and some spotty lacing. Aroma of light bread malt, citrus and flowery hops, a touch of lemon and some green vegetables. Taste is medium bodied, light carbonated with flavors of light white bread malt, some citrus zest and a touch of pine. Finish is semi-sweet with a mild bitterness that sticks around after the finish.

Pours a very lightly hazy golden-orange color.  A frothy, snow white head settles slowly to a thin film, leaving random spots and patches of sticky lacing behind.  The nose is delicate but hoppy, with notes of lemongrass, light orange and grapefruit providing a bright spark atop pale, toasted malts and cereal grains.  The flavor is a perfect compliment, with those same citrus hops shining triumphantly alongside a light, toasted honey-wheat bread backdrop.  Medium-bodied and smooth, drinking easy and finishing dry.  Refreshing.  I could drink this all day long by the pool.  Great summertime beer.

What a different wheat ale. Pours a hazy yellow color with orange highlights and a medium sized off white head. Nose is hoppy and of wheat with some lemon. Taste is pretty hoppy and bitter for a wheat but has a nice lemon citrus finish. Goes down smooth and is very refreshing.
UPDATED: JUN 18, 2008 Great summer beer from FFF.  Citrus and hops give it clean, refreshing feel and a nice crisp finish.
Pours golden with small but nice head. Its got a citrus/honey/hop/wheat flavor. Great finish.

Pours golden with a pure white head.  Really unique aroma for a wheat beer- lemony tang, some soft berry notes, herbal-tea, honey, and citrus hop presence.  Flavor is a bit more muted than the nose, but still a fantastic change from the normal wheat beer formula.  Really great floral and fruit notes intermingling on a crisp, lively palate.  I love the pronounced hops in this one.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2010 Pours clear golden with slight haze - is this really a wheat beer.  Aromas of citrus hop, lemons, smells refreshing.  Wheat comes through in the taste with definite hop presence - the familiar tangerine/apricot 3F patent hop profile . Very crisp and refreshing palate.   Could put back several of these.  Very approachable and tasty.

Bottle from Eithcubes. Pours a fairly clear orange with a thin head. The aroma is mostly a rich hops and citrus, also some grains. The taste is dominated by a citrusy hops, quite fresh and full, also full of wheat dipped in honey. Pretty nice. Very clean and easygoing. I enjoyed this one quite a bit.

This one came in from Eithcubes. The lesson to be learned from this beer is that amarillo hops = bubblegum flavors/aromas. Getting more of an IPA than a wheat experience but I am not complaining. Clear golden orange color. Wheat style comes through faintly on the finish. A little banana and grain flavors there. Straight amarillo is a little one dimensional.  A good dimension but still one dimension.

My favorite wheat ale, to date, blows the blue moon right outten yer arse. Unfortunately, Im not sure it has wide appeal... Its been a miss whenever Ive tried to introduce it to non beer people. Ebels makes a better outreach beer IMO. Thats fine, I take Gumball to the BBQ now and theres more for me!
I gave this beer a 5 for appearance, it looks beautiful too.
Smell of hops, musky and sweet.  Good clear golden pour and a slight head.  Bitter hop profile in the beer with a citrus/sap finish.  Nice to sit and drink to quench the thirst on a hot summer day.

22 oz bottle.  Pours a hazy dull gold with massive white foamy head that is mostly lasting.  Aroma of hops, kind of citrusy, mostly pine.  Initial flavor has the presence of a wheat plus all the hops.  Balanced taste throughout, hoppiness overtakes at the end.  Moderate lacing, light to medium body, moderate carbonation, without any signs of alcohol.  Very drinkable, especially for hop heads or open minded fans of wheat beers.

Pours a bright , slightly hazy golden with a very small white head that faded quickly but left a slight swirl of foam on top throughout.  Lacing was light to moderate.  The smell is surprisingly dominated by hops not wheat.  Major resiny pine scents and some lemony citrus aromas form an interesting mix with the sweet wheat.  The taste starts with a mild wheat sweetness which gives way almost immediately to a nice crisp hop bite dominated by citrus and pine.  The finish is very crisp with a slight hop bitterness balanced by a hint of the wheat.  Very crisp and highly carbonated with an overall moderate mouthfeel, heavier than I would expect in a wheat beer.  This one is seriously drinkable if not easily categorized.  As summer approaches here in Atlanta, this one would be a staple in the fridge if I had access to it.  Very refreshing.

Clear golden pour with a bubble head. Nose is hops, sweet malt, kind of intense. Taste is the opposite of what I expected: very mellow with the perfect amount of hops and a nice citrus finish. Im not a big fan of wheat beers, but this is excellent.
Bottle. Absolutely and positively clear pour with a thin bubbly head. Mild nose, musky with some sweetness and hops. Grainy basmati rice flavor, dry finish. Thick and highly drinkable.
DLD On tap. Pours a clear golden. Bitter and quite citric. Very high hoppiness. Lots of grapefruit. Hint of plantsap. Light bodied. Kinda mild. Good. Been there, rated that, bought the t-shirt.

Slightly hazy straw, some white head.
Big hoppy aroma: floral, some citrus.
Spicy flavor, some bitterness, light sweetness.
Light but full palate.
Great session despite high alcohol.

This is simply the best Wheat Beer Ive ever had. Orange with a frothy white head that went away. Easy to drink and full of hops - has a strong floral and yet dank and bitter hop profile. This beer may get me to try more wheats.

A- Pours a very clear light orange with a 2 finger, fizzy head which dissipates rather quickly.

S- Is this a wheat beer or an ipa? First thing to hit my nose it a massive whiff of hops followed by a wheaty, light fruit smell, possibly apricot.

T- Taste is smooth. Light fruits, earthiness, a bit of grain, followed by a distinct piney hoppiness.

M- Medium viscosity, quite a bit of carbonation.

D- This is certainly an easy drinker. Glad I have 3 because now I know what im going to pop open on a warm summer day.
really nice wheat beer.  refreshing, sightly fruity...kinda gumball-y.  really nice showpiece for the amarillo hops.

Bottle courtesy of Holdenn.

Pours a barely hazy gold color with a small white head. Aroma of hops, grapefruit, wheat, and fruits. Loads of bitter, sweet, grapefruit, hops, fruits and believe it or not almost gumball come together to give this low alcohol beer a rather big taste.

Great refreshing brew! Three Floyds has a great assortment of delicious beers and this did not change my opinion of that. From start to finish, a symphony of amarillo and citrus bursts capped off with a smooth well balanced aroma. Both pleasant to the smell and taste, this one should be liked by most beer lovers.
bottle.  terrific wheat beer!  lots of hops and very smooth.  Three Floyds makes some awesome beer

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2008 This is an amazingly refreshing summer beer.  Wheat bread, grain, lemon zest, bubblegum sweetness, and tropical fruit (mango and papaya).  Very easy to drink and tasty, but not all that complex.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2010 Pours orange, slightly hazy, with a large foamy/sudsy white head.  Candied wheat malt, citrus, grapefruit and some spices in the aroma.  Sweet and bitter with too much alcohol showing for something thats only 4.8%.  A little bit salty and some bubblegum flavor.  Average palate, slightly sticky.  Not nearly as good as I would have thought by how fast it flies off the shelf.  

[Had this on tap at the Map Room.. .and it was much better than the bottle pour... ] 8.4.8.3.15 . . . . . . . Fresh six-pack.  Pours a clear glowing rich golden with a frothy sticky white head.  Aroma of fresh amarillo, sweet and spicy, wonderfully presented over the wheat base.  Flavor is much the same, super clean, great amarillo flavor especially towards the finish, full of oranges, hint of banana, some bubblegummy bitterness,  so quaffable its ridiculous.  Medium/light bodied, smooth and glassy, very drinkable.  8.4.8.4.15

22oz from From the Vine, Columbus. Ive been eager to try this for a while now, and its a pleasant, refreshing beer on this first truly warm day of the year. Golden and full bodied, with an energetic, overflowing head. Its got a pleasant aroma, with ripe peaches, modest spice, and sweet flowers. The bodys just a touch thin, and the finish is bitter and dry. Pretty good.

12oz bottle from Noras Fine Wines (Indianapolis). Pours a golden caramel with a thick, frothy white head. Aroma: sweet and citrusy with a nose of apricot and peaches. Flavor: Sweet and spicey with ripe peach and apricot overtones. Grapefruit bitterness on finish. Excellent and refreshing wheat ale.
nice deep golden amber color with a aerated white head.  wheaty, with lots of citric acid and good floral notes.  not my favorite style but a good example of a wheat.

12 oz. bottle via trade from Acknud.  Pours straw yellow/gold with a small, fizzy, white head that is rimming.  Smells of wheat with sugary, cotton candy type vibe.  Taste is skunky wheat with slight fruit, a touch of sweet candy and moderate bitterness.  Decent, I"m thinkin this one may have had a bit to much age on it, and fresher is better.

Courtesy of Juart.  Pours a slightly hazy golden tangerine color w/ a fizzy white head.  Strong grapefruit cotton candy aroma with a touch of pine for good measure.  A mild bittersweet grapefruit flavor.  Doesnt have many of the usual characteristics of a wheat ale.  It is very crisp with a decent amount of citrus.  Slight bitterness in the finish, but doenst leave that much on the tongue.

From bottle courtesy of dpjuart. Honey, flowery, bit of sulfur, fruity rinds, and nicely hopped. Almost smells like a mead with some lavender and peach. Hazy light amber with a bit of chunky floaters, light off-white head. Medium-light watery body with medium carbonation. Starts rather mild, with a lot of fruitiness. Peach, light flowery hoppiness, fruity sweetness. Very nice mild wheat ale with good bitter finish, mild chalkiness. Light bitter after. Tasty, but perhaps a bit old - hope to try again a bit fresher.
UPDATED: JUN 11, 2009 nose of huge citrus.  malted wheat buoy this to a lighter palate but otherwise its another hop bomb. lack of subtlety or real balance lose points on this one.

Nice clear orange body with heavy carbonation.  Faint white head that left a tiny ring after ten minutes.  Sweet floral hop notes with not a hint o wheat.  Hops and sweet malt flavors preceded a grainy finish.

Poure golden with a good sized white head that dissapates quickly.  Lacing on the glass.  Aroma of heavy hops, not thinking this is a wheat.   Taste is very hopped.  Wheat not really present.  Taste is of grassey, fresh, piney hops and a light malt backing.  Body is medium (esp for style) with light carbonation.  May be the bottle Ive got but this seems more like an APA.  Very good though.
Bottle.  pours with small whitish yellow head.  color is orangish yellow.  Quite light in flavor.  this would be a good summer brew.

12 oz. Bottle:  First off, this is a beautiful looking brew.  Light copper in color with a nicely sized, foamy white head.  Sweet citrus wheat aroma with some amazing floral notes and a subtle spiced aspect to compliment it.  Medium-light bodied mouth feel.  Crisp, clean tasting wheat flavor with a bit of pine and floral hops...mild citrus undertones.  This stuff is absolutely amazing  when its fresh and is my favorite summer brew.

12oz bottle. Poured transparent, crisp amber. Aroma is a dominating white grape juice, with piny and floral tones. I could taste some honey, grapefruit, and the grape juice again. Small amounts of hops and a good balance. Havent had a wheat beer in a while, so this was a nice change of pace. Good session beer.

Pours a slightly hazed orange colour with a minimal but retainig off-white head. The nose is mild, with tropical citrus, honey and wheat. The flavour is hoppy, slightly acidic with a zesty lemon finish. Suggestions of orange, flavours of wheat and toasted grain and bitter hops. Very thin mouthfeel that has a creaminess from the wheat. A nice refrshing brewski.

Pours a cloudy orange hazy color with a head that faded just as quick as the pour. You can really smell a lot of hops with some minor light fruits on the nose. The initial flavor was rather bitter and you could really taste the hints of fruit along the sides of your mouth. The finish is a bit watery but still the hop bitterness stays in your mouth trough the entire duration of the beer.

This is a very creative use of hops.  I am impressed.  The beer pours hazy slightly-red yellow color, it has a large head that is spurred on by the sugary lemon aroma.  At first taste I am not sure if this is lemon or hops and as I go I enjoy the balance.  It is so balanced that it finishes with only a slight tang.  Good stuff,

Found this one bottled at Top Shelf in South Elgin, Illinois.  Hazy medium yellow pour and a thick white head.  Very unusual wheat ale. An awesome hoppy and citrusy nose tops a very flavorful and complicated taste.  Citrusy hops quickly moves into a citrusy maltiness, banana and orange.  Very, very good beer.

12ozbottle tanks to stfun: pours golden yellow with mminimal white head. aroma filled with lots of citrusy hops and wheat, flaovr is on the light side but doesnt taste watered down, wheat malt nice touch of hops and a hint of a lemon like citrus added. very easy drinker doesnt puch any limits but is still pretty complex, i like this beer.
22oz bottle. Pours hazy golden in color with white head. Aroma citrus, wheat and hops. Taste of hops and light wheat with bitter finish.
Great hoppy flavor.  Hits all parts of your mouth.  Much better than most "run of the mill" IPAs.

Shared by DrBayern @ Steves house (Thanks Matt!!), poured from a bomber, hazy medium amber.  Aroma of wheat, hops with flowery malted tones.  Flavour is of a full bodied, hopped wheat beer.  Lovely balance, incredible beer.  Would love to try on tap.
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle. Pours a slight hazy amber, big white head. Aroma is sweet hops, maybe some wheat. Flavor is hops, malt and wheat. Nice beer.

Three Floyds Gumballhead is a very interesting beer. I have a tough time calling it a true wheat ale because of the strong hop flavor and initial taste. However, the hops seem to disappear as soon as you swallow the liquid. 

A nice appearance with a good head, this beer if full of inconsistency. It drinks like an IPA and finishes like a wheat. That said, it is still very good.

Another bottle from StFun, Muchos Gracias. Reasonable head, around a half-inch or so. Yellow gold color, not much yeast visible but definitely present in the aroma. Not too cloudy. Smells fruity and surprisingly hoppy for a Wheat Ale (I guess thats Three Floyds thing, which is fine by me). The taste is really interesting -- much hoppier than other wheat beers that Ive had. Smooth and has a very nice finish -- bitter and slightly sour. A very good beer.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2009 Bottle from STFUN!; Poured a yellow color. Not much head. Smelled really fruity, some citrus and pine hops. Taste of hops and over all sweetness. I could see this being a good summer time brew. Very easy to drink. UPDATE Oct 09. Poured into a lager glass. Big head. Nice lemony aroma. Citrus and pine as well.  Taste is a light piney and lemon taste. Nice hoppipness in a wheat ale... good brew

22 oz. bomber served in a Pilsner glass 2006 release 
Pours a surprising clear yellow-orange. I thought there would be cloudiness to it but there was none. Nice 1 inch white head that lasted a while and left great lacing. Slightly more carbonation than your average beer. Good pop on the nose. Great grassy aromas with a touch of citrus. Flavor was outstanding. Probably the best example of the style, at least that Ive had. Grass and citrus with a yeasty, hoppy finish. AMAZING. Not heavy on the pallet making this very easy to drink. This is a great beer for the warmer season coming up.

The color was hazy golden.  The head was thin, fizzy, and white.  The aroma was sour, wheat, and lemongrass.  The flavor was hoppy, whieat, and lemongrass.  The palate was nicely carbonated.  The finish was clean.

Thanks ucusty. Pours a hazy copper amber with a two finger creamy white head. The aroma is wheaty, sour, citrusy, slightly hoppy. Very citrusy, hoppy, I love amarillo hops, wheaty, a bit sour, yeasty, good flavor. Nice hop presence in a wheat. The palate is not too carbonated with a bit of a crispness from the hops. Citrusy finish.

Thanks courtesy of Pepsican. Pours a hazy golden orange with white head. Aroma of fruit and hops. Tastes of citrus fruits like lemons orange and peaches, with a nice bitter hop finish. This is the first FFF beer I have tried and it has certainly lived up to the hype. Outstanding and by far my favorite wheat beer

Bottle Thanks to hopscotch: (All the people who thanked me for this bottle should thank him as well) Hazy golden with white head. Extremely hoppy aroma for a Wheat beer. Full of mango, orange marmalade and peach. Yowza! Very creamy texture. Fruity and hoppy flavor. Not much indication of wheat malt in the mash. Full of tropical fruits (mango, peach) and a smooth mildly bitter finish. Extremely hoppy for a wheat ale, but not much else to say about it than that. Overrated, slightly.

I have had before but not rated. Thanks pilsnerpeter for bringing. Aroma of sweet amlts and some sour citrus and grapefruit. Maybe some orange and lemon zest as well. Taste a lot more grapefruit and wheat. Some bread and yeast help the nice body too. Nice.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2008  poured golden to orange with nice off white head aromas of hops and lemons.taste like a gumball really it does, lots of hops and a yeasty  bitter finish really not my style of beer so i tend to be  a bit hard on all non dark brews

Hands down the best wheat beer out there.  This has some body and a kick to it, and remains very balanced.  Complex graininess that has a cool feel to it that wheat beers have -  but this makes all the others seem watered down.

now thats fantastic, interesting golden color, decent white head, nose is big time citrus, and a little wheat. taste is amazing well balanced great pinapple nose, not huge wheat but its there, really really good. so flavorful and i could definatly down a few cases of them.

Thanks to pilsnerpeter for sharing this one.  Very pale golden beer.  Aroma is loaded with mango, apricot, and other tropical fruits.  Flavour is zesty and fruity with lots of fresh wheaty malts.  Lemon and lemongrass flavour.  Nice enough brew, but I wasnt blown away.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2009 Poured into a weizen glass, the beer is a cloudy apple juice color with a 1 finger off white head. Modest lacing.

Floral hops tickle the nose, along with pleasantly sweet grain aromas.

Very interesting take on a wheat beer here; floral and piney hops dance with banana phenols and vanilla notes atop a stage built from sweet malt and wheat smoothness. Grapefruit, lemon zest, a little spice and everything is indeed nice. What complexity!

Perfect mouthfeel. Exemplary carbonation, extremely smooth, with a nice drying finish from all those Amarillo hops.

Low alcohol, incredible smoothness, refreshing qualities, and balanced flavors make this beer supremely drinkable.

Pours a cloudy light yellow color with a frothy white head that condenses but refreshes itself throughout the entire drinking process. Laces the glass slightly. Smells nice and hoppy but mellow hoppy not bitter or aggressive. A little grassy but not overwhelming. Tastes of a well balanced but liberal dose of hops. Great beer to start on if your just getting into hops. Palate is a bit on the thick side for such a light colored brew. Insane carbonation at first but the carbonation fades at about half glass.
 Pretty awesome beer, I really dig it and will do my best to get more.

Thanks kryptic and Jay23 for the opportunity to experience this one 
22 oz bomber poured into a Weizen glass produced a clear golden yellow. Along with a large billowy white head that lasts a good long time
 
Tons of citrus, hops, wheat and yes bubblegum aromas fill up my head 

A wonderfully clean and crisp palate 

The flavors of this one are extremely well balanced for a wheat beer not to sweet not to tart Kind of like Goldilocks just right

Very drinkable beer made me think it was summertime even though Im looking at snow outside my window right now

(Tap) Pours a dark golden color with a medium-sized white head. Aroma of fruit and wheat malts. Taste is citrusy and includes a lot of yeast notes. Good palate for the style and a light mouthfeel. Another enjoyable 3F beer!

12oz bottle acquired in trade with Acknud.  Wow!  My first FFF was a great one!  Pours a lightly hazed sunrise yellow.  Head was white and about 1 finger thick.  Peach, apricot, honey, lemon grass and yeast dominate the aroma.  On the palate was mostly fruity and a bit yeasty.  Hands down the best wheat beer Ive ever had......Thanks Acknud!

[1040-20080112] 650mL (w/ garthicus, HogTownHarry, jerc, mds, Radek Kliber; Vintage 2007). Sweet citrus navel orange hops aroma. Clear, yellow orange body with a quick foamy white head. Lemon citrus hops continues in the flavour. Medium body. Mellowed due to time in the fridge but still enjoyable -- would like to re-rate with a fresher sample.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2010 Great deep golden color.. crystal clear, light head. Strong hoppy aroma. Flavor of strong hops.. underlying notes of wheat, lemon, very crisp finish. So enjoyable. Had this one sitting in the fridge for about 8 months, opened it in the dead of winter. Cant wait for the summer to get another bottle. Light body and so easy to drink.

Draft.  Pours a golden/yellow color.  Aroma is sweet, hoppy and almost lemony.  Light bodied and easy to drink.  Lightly flavored of wheat and almost bubblegum and lemon in the background, finishing nicely with Hops.

This gold couldnt be any more crystal clear.  Corn starch, mint, lemonade, and soft metallics in the aroma.  Aged.  Tastes of sour grain, dry grass, creamed corn, tea leaves, and rotted citrus.  Hops are buried and anything lively imparted by the wheat has lost its zest.  Crisp and almost medium in body; leaves a sour green apple, honey, and sugary lemonade residue to coat the mouth after swallowing.  If this had an expiration date it seems that it would be long since past; this will merit a revisit eventually, but the basic character here provides little of promise.

I really enjoyed this beer and I am not a tremendous fan of the style!!!  Thanks to Atalla for this one!!!  You cant miss the 2-3 inch head...a billowing white cloud that never leaves and greets your lips on every sip.  Its a cloudy rich golden hue and has aromas of citrus and a tint of pine.  I think the most surprising and inviting aspect of this beer is the level of hops.  Kind of a cross between a traditional wheat and a mild pale ale.  Palate is light and refreshing...GREAT SUMMER BEER!!!

a perfect example of liking the palate better than the actual flavor of the beer. im not a fan of wheat ales at all, but this is the best ive had (even though im still not incredibly high on this one). slight candy and citris taste. the wheat is very evident, and the alcohol is pretty pronounced for just 4.8%. full of juice. a little sticky, but not overly so. a great palate though, the flavors seem to change while they sit in your mouth. probably wont drink much again, but thats because i dont like the style of beer, nothing to do with this actual beer.

Delighted to have shared this with the Toronto crowd and my first Three Floyds rating. Golden yellow with a slightly cloudy tint. An amazing hop-candyfloss aroma. Flavour- sweet hoppy mouthfeel, juicy! Very satisfying beer

Bottle.  Pours hazy yellow with thick white head that reduces to thin film.  Aroma is citrusy, spicy, sweet and hoppy.  Flavor is complex, citrus (lemon and grapefruit), with very pleasant spice character, some hoppy bitterness.   Slighly sweet, very refreshing.   I normally dont really like wheat beers, but this is excellent.

Courtesy of Quake1028. Pours hazy straw with initially big white head that dissipated in under a minute. Wow, the aroma is a load of citrus hops and pineapple mixed with mild wheat, lemon and orange peel. The taste is fresh and lively with lemon tartness, sweet malts, wheat some grapefruit hops and hints of orange juice. Theres also an under current of sugary sweetness. Good refreshing summer brew. Perfect for this warm winter night in FL.

Yellow pour with a white head that quickly recedes.  Aroma was surprisingly strongly hoppy, quite a bit of citrus.  Flavor is similar, lots of hops but a bit of wheaty bubblegum in the background.  A very interesting wheat beer for sure.

A very nice yellow to straw in color.  There were scents of lemon and a wheat/rye aspect.  The palate is crisp but round with very nice texture for a crisp beer.  The midpalate is light on its feet making this a very nice beer to drink on a warm day.
22oz bomber-A nice golden body with a nice two finger white head and an aroma of hops, wheat, and some citrus. Taste of the same with the wheat coming out a little bit more. A nice tasting brew.

Thanks to my Secret Santa (pantanap) for this bottle. Pours a nice rich, golden straw color with a huge white head and nice lacing. Nose is floral hops, pine and some citrus as well. Flavor is just like the nose with some of that wheat beer flavor. Very nice and refreshing.

Review from 2006.

Pours a very nice golden color with a nice pillowy head that leaves a wonderful lacing on the glass, clearer than most wheat style beers. Smell is hoppy, opens with a floral bouquet and finishes with citrus smells (orange, lemon) and even has some pine in there as well. Taste is glorious, I swear I tasted some banana and bubblegum before the hops takeover mid-drink and hit you with a refreshing citrus burst. Light to medium bodied with a medium carbonation, it really could not be improved on for the style. Drinkability, umm, yeah I could have this wherever, whenever and plenty of it.

Additional information: My bottle was refridgerated since its summer release, and is still this good now, thats just crazy, I was afraid to buy it at first because of how long it was sitting there, but Im so glad I did.

Pours out a hazy yellow color with good amount of white head that fades quickly.  Aroma is intensely lemony along with citrus hop notes.  The taste models the aroma to a key with some notes of coriander.  Carbonation is a little light for my liking.  Palate is a little bit astringent for my liking.  Also has a light soapiness in the end.  Not bad.

Pours a cloudy golden yellow color with a diminishing frothy head.  Aroma is wheat, and citrus fruits like lemons and grapefruit.  Taste is bitter up front with some citrus throughout, and finishes kind of soapy.  A great Wheat Ale in terms of drinkability.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a huge white head.  Aroma is alive with citrus.  grapefruit,  lemon,  and orange take up most of the flavor,  but some nice hops and wheat tones come through.  Finishes so quick you take another drink,  and another,  and another.  I always keep a few of these around to drink after I have a few impy anythings,  these things are like a battery for your taste buds.

12oz bottle from unclejedi. Orange juice looking pour with a 2 finger thick, pillowy white head. HUGE grapefruit aroma, smells like a fleshy, perfectly ripe ruby red grapefruit. Havent encountered grapefruit to that degree in any other beer thus far. Also pick up hints of pineapple, sweet citrus candy and wheat, with a huge hop backing. The grapefruit is toned down quite a bit in the flavor, but still present, along with more sweet citrus and wheat, and tons of hops. Thin to medium bodied, nicely carbonated and feels perfect for the style as you drink it. Heavily astringent, but doesnt detract at all from the experience. Finish is medium in length, citrus and sugars followed by bittering hops. The aroma is just enormous and phenomenal, and the flavor lives up to that billing. Surpasses Oberon as my favorite American Wheat. This would never leave my stash if it was available fresh in Florida. Outstanding!
yeah, buy this. drink this. i cant believe how clear this was for a wheat beer. just shows that you dont have to have chunks of stuff floating in your beer to be good.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2007 Bottle from Binnys (Orland Park, IL). Poured from 12 oz bottle into a conical pint glass. Pours a nice lively yet hazy golden color. Small head that manages to stick around and laces fairly well. Aroma of hops, citrus, and some wheaty notes. Taste is wonderful. Hops and citrus with the wheat beer finish I truly enjoy. Hoppy cerealesque finish. Wheat and a lemony aftertaste that is a little candy-ish and sticks to the palate and is reminiscent of about 15-30 minutes after youve eaten some Lemonhead candies. A hoppy assertive wheat beer that is wonderfully done.

Bottled sample via oakbluff. Gold in colour with fairly strong carbonation. Aromas of stale malted wheat and citric hops. Hop forward in the mouth, followed by more wheat malt and some coriander like citrus flavors. Some bitter length on the finish keeps the wheat in check. Pretty good overall, especially considering the style. This bottle might have been a bit past its prime too. Probably really nice when fresh and on a hot patio in the summer.
Very good beer, smooth and refreshing.  The aftertaste left me wanting more.  Best wheat beer on the market.

This is by far the best wheat beer out there. Nice golden color. nose is hops and citrus.Taste is wheat and hops. I like to let this one warm up a bit. I feel it brings out the hops more. Drinkability is great.

Wow... I dont like wheat beers!  This is great.  Relatively clear yellow, small white head.  Aroma of citrus.  Very hoppy taste with (as the description says) a lemony finish.  Very nice drinkable beer.

One of the best smelling summer wheats around due to the amount of hops.  Unique.  A great wheat, one of my favorite.  The beer is very pale.  I seem to remember this beer having more of a knockout flavor, but it is still solid.

10-17-07 bottle.  Semi-transparent deep golden color with thick foamy head.  Amazing candy-coated hops aroma.  Peaches and cream dominate the flavor.  Finish is clean and smooth with ideal carbonation.  I highly recommend this beer to anyone!  Great palate - smooth, yet clean and crisp - lively yet not over the top.  All around, a fantastic beer!

Bottle. Poured a hazy yellow with a huge white, fluffy head. Immediately on opening the bottle you get the citrus aroma of the hops. On pouring in the glass the hop smell is even more evident and enticing. Flavor is of smooth wheat flavor with a tremendous hop presence which gives it a bit of citrus flavor. I love German wheat beers but, this is the best Ameircan version I have had so far. Many thanks to my brother biggmike for this one.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2008 Thanks to Pantanap for the bottle.  Fluffy head...typical wheat body.  Very pleasant aroma...has strong grapefruit scents but also a lot of other fruits, including orange and lemon...very nice work of the amarillo hops!  Nice flavor up front...hoppy, citrusy and bready, then mellows out into a mostly-lemon flavor, and actually has a somewhat watery finish on the palate.  Flavor lingers long for a wheat.  Im not one that has completely bought into the FFF craze so far, but this was a very enjoyable variation of a wheat, which is nice to see today!
 
Update 10/31/08:  On tap in NW Indiana...this is a very clean beer on tap, the amarillo hops are truly allowed to shine in this beer...lemon and orange flavors very well defined and the oscillation between strong citrus and sharp bitterness is wonderful...notching this one up slightly from previous rating

I was very nonplussed by this.  I was expecting a slam-down version of my favorite style and received a very hollow, watery version of Sunshine Wheat.  I am still rating it partly on what I was hoping for, and partly because I am convinced I missed something.

Pours cloudy gold with a white soapy head. Aroma is predominantly hops with notes of leaves, pine, and lemony sweet candy (Amarillo). Softly bitter yet nicely citric as well. Small to medium bodied. If more wheat ales tasted like this I would probably buy a lot more wheat ales!

A beautiful beer with a long lasting 2" head w/ great lacing. Nice moderate hoppy flavor w/ a fairly strong citrus finish. Dry on the palate and the flavor is pretty long-lived. Another excellent beer from The Floyds of Munster!

I had this beer from my beer meister at home.  This was my first beer from the Three Floyds Brewing Company.  It was very good with a citrus finsh almost like grapefruit.  I have not had this for a while but I hope to be able to grab a 1/4 barrel next summer.  A great wheat ale

12 oz bottle:  From trade with pantanap (Thanks!)  Aroma is nicely hopped for a wheat, with a lemon rind overtone that is quite refreshing.  a bit of yeast and wheat notes round out the brew.
